loans.name: Basher's Group

texts.en:
Basher is a member of this group from Iraq. Basher is 33 years old, married and has three children. Basher opened a electric devices shop four years ago and managed to provide the essentials needed to his family. 
Basher has a smart boy in primary school; always get high grades in school.
Knowing the importance of education for his children future, he is requesting a loan to pay for his son's tuition fees and other school expenses.  Basher aim to see his children get best education, 
The story of Basher and his son is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: Each member of Basher's Group's $ 3,000 loan intends to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen began her seamstress business since when she was 15 years old, she studied this profession but she could not conclude for limited economic resources, however it has allowed her to has a job and earns some money. Her husband is an employee but his salary is not enough to cover all home necessities, for that reason Maria del Carmen decided to started her own business and contribute with the family expenses. She has 2 children who are her inspiration to work day by day.

She requires a loan of $375 USD to purchase raw material like cloth, thread and more. She and her family need your support to continue financing the studies of her children. Maria del Carmen plans to return the loan in a term of 5 months, she thanks your affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maria del Carmen inicio su negocio de costurera desde que tenía 15 años de edad, estudio esta profesión pero no pudo concluir por falta de recursos económicos, sin embargo le ha permitido trabajar y ganar dinero ejerciéndola. Su esposo es obrero pero su sueldo no le permite cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar, por lo que Maria del Carmen decidió poner su propio negocio y contribuir con los gastos familiares. Tiene 2 hijos quien son su inspiración para trabajar día con día.

Maria del Carmen requiere de un préstamo de $375 USD para comprar insumos como telas, hilo y más. Ella y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo para seguir costeando los estudios de sus hijos. Maria del Carmen planea regresar el préstamo en un término de 5 meses, ella agradece tu cariño.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. Her small business selling dishware, kitchenware and pottery is the main source of income for her family. Irina received her first loan from “Nadiya Ukraine” in June, 2002. Currently, she maintains around $7,000 in working capital and her monthly net profit amounts to $500. Irina has a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has promptly repaid all loans with no delinquencies. Her neat kiosk with a beautiful array of inventory, her customer-friendly service and exceptional prices has ensured the long-term success of Irina’s business. Irina would like to get a loan for $1,000 to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to increase her supplies of ceramic dish ware, porcelain dinner sets, cutlery, coffee mugs and fancy glasses to attract more potential clients to her vending kiosk. Irina believes her efforts and determination in combination with financial support will eventually help her to achieve her full potential, greater income, and success.

Ірина – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона торгує посудом, кухонним приладдям та керамічними виробами. Цей бізнес є єдиним джерелом прибутку для її родини. Ірина отримала свою першу позику від „Надії України” в червні 2002 року. Зараз в неї приблизно 7000 доларів робочого капіталу, її щомісячний прибуток складає 500 доларів. В Ірини чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”. Вона вчасно сплатила усі позики без жодних прострочень. Її акуратний кіоск, широкий вибір товарів, ввічливе обслуговування та помірна цінова політика забезпечили стабільний успіх бізнесу Ірини. Ірина хотіла б отримати позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів. Вона планує закупити керамічний посуд, порцелянові столові набори та прилади, чашки та скляні вироби для того, щоб придбати більше потенційних клієнтів до свого кіоску. Ірина вважає, що її зусилля та наполегливість у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможуть їй реалізувати власний потенціал, отримати більший прибуток та досягти успіху.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Abdul Qauom

texts.en: A. Qauom lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is a young and educated boy. He is single and he works to support himself. He is a shopkeeper. He has a cosmetics shop he wants to expand his business. He wants to take a individual loan to buy new designs of clothes and shoes and some other kits for cosmetics to attract more clients and do a good business to make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To expand his business into clothes and shoes

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Aged 38, Mrs. Kossiwa L. is married and has five (5) children. She currently lives in Mawussi in the sub-prefecture of Afagnan, where she runs her agricultural and handicraft (rope-making) businesses. The sale of agricultural products and ropes constitutes her sole source of income. Given that the growing season has begun and the region's soils are poor, she needs fertilizer to re-energize the production capacity of her soil in order to increase yield. In addition, she buys more often the raw materials for the fabrication of ropes. Limited by her means, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to invest in her business, whose yield will provide her with improved living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame L. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle réside actuellement à Mawussi dans la sous préfecture d'Afagnan où elle exerce ses activités champêtres et artisanales (fabrication de cordes). La vente des produits agricoles et des cordes constitue sa seule source de revenu. La saison champêtre ayant débuté et les sols de sa localité étant pauvres, elle a besoin de fertilisants pour redynamiser la capacité de production de ses sols afin d'augmenter le rendement. En plus, elle achète plus souvent les matière premières servant à la fabrication des cordes. Limitée par ses moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir investir dans ses activités dont le rendement lui apportera une amélioration des conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: San

texts.en:
In the provinces of Cambodia, people rent sound systems (speakers and microphones) when they hold celebrations. Mrs. C. San's husband earns $5 a day renting sound systems to people in their community.

Mrs. C. San would like to use this loan to purchase another sound system - speakers and a microphone - to increase her husband's business.

Mrs. C. San is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. She currently earns $3.70 a day working as a tailor.

loans.use: Purchase speakers and a microphone

loans.name: Mebel

texts.en: Mrs. Mebel A. is 33 years old, is married, and has three children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks. She studied her business for 5 years, and and she has 15 years of experience in the business. She is seeking the sum of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en: Bahar is  a widow and lives in Khachmaz town. She does not have children. This 46-year-old woman has her own shop, where she sells clothes. She has two years of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of  $850 to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Molemo A Group

texts.en:
Salome, age 48, is married with 2 children (ages 21 and 28). She owns a clothing business and also is a food vendor. She started the clothing business in 2005 and has been selling food since 1998. She works each day from 9am to 6pm at these businesses and currently makes a monthly profit of about $330.

In the past, Salome took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy inventory for her businesses. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Stella, who owns a tailoring business.

loans.use: To expand their two businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Victor makes different types of furniture from wood, and his business is located in the area of the May 1st highway.

His family is made up of his wife and children. Victor takes care of all the family expenses and his wife helps out with income she receives from the sale of raw milk. The family is very hard-working and continually looks for ways to get ahead.

Currently Victor is in the process of putting up his own carpentry workshop and is building a structure onto his home for this purpose. He would like to take advantage of the broad experience he has and above all, the steady clients who appreciate his work.

The competition in this sector is high, but Victor´s success is based on the quality of the finished work of his furniture. With the current loan request, Victor will buy different types of wood as well as iron and zinc with which to make a small shed where he can store his materials. Prices are stable and vary depending on the type of furniture, quality of wood, manual work, etc.

Victor currently has debts with small institutions which he pays off punctually, the same as he does with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Victor es un señor que se dedica a la fabricación de diferentes muebles de madera su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el sector de camino a 1ro de Mayo.

Su familia esta compuesta por su esposa y por los hijos, Victor se encarga de todos los gastos de la familia y la esposa le colabora con los ingresos que percibe por la venta de leche cruda. Esta familia es muy trabajadora y constantemente buscan el superarse.

Victor actualmente esta independizandose para poder tener su propia carpintería y está construyendo en su domicilio una estructura para poder armarla, él quiere aprovechar la gran experiencia que tiene y sobre todo la clientela fija que aprecia su trabajo.

La competencia en este sector es elevada, pero el éxito de Victor se basa en la calidad de acabado de sus muebles. Con la presente solicitud Victor comprará madera de diferentes tipos, también comprará fierro y calamina para poder hacer un pequeño galpon donde armará y depositará su materia prima. Los precios son estables y varian dependiendo del tipo de mueble, la calidad de la madera, trabajo manual, etc. Actualmente Victor tiene deudas en pequeñas instituciones las cuales cancela de manera puntual al igual que con nuestra Institución.

loans.use: Working capital and construction.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
"As you can see, the walls in my house are very deteriorated due to their age, and I would like to repair them before they collapse and cost more money to repair.”  I am requesting $600 to repair the walls of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

 “Como pueden darse cuenta las paredes de mi casa están muy deterioradas debido a los años, me gustaría repararlas antes de que se caigan ya que después tendría que invertir  más.” Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para reparar las paredes de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Repair walls

loans.name: Trois Cocotiers 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ndiaye Ndiaye lacks a population capable of consuming all of its seafood production, which includes shrimp, oysters, and smoked fish. This is why these women have formed a group to finance their purchase of storage material to keep the seafood products fresh, and especially to transport the products to the larger cities to sell.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ndiaye ndiaye est dépourvu de populations capable de consommer toute la production en produits de mer, comme les crevettes, les huitres se, les poissons fumés. C'est pourquoi les femmes se sont constitués en Groupement pour disposer de financements qui leur permettent d'acheter du matériel de stockage pour mettre bien au frais les produits halieutiques mais surtout à pouvoir acheminer les produits dans les grandes villes et les vendre.

loans.use: To buy material for the storage and re-sale of seafood products

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke A. lives at Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells weave-ons and hair-lengthening attachments, and she is also a hair stylist. It took her two and a half years to acquires these skills and she has been in this business since 2001. Joke is 29 years old and is married with three children. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more weave-ons and hair attachments to sell. This, she said, will help her serve her customer better. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more weave-ons and hair attachments

loans.name: Padagnassi

texts.fr:
Mme. Padagnassi A. has been a corn retailer since 1994. She was born on December 31, 1969, in Badou, in the Wawa prefecture in the Plateaux region of Togo. She is married to Mr. Akation A., who is retired. With three children dependent on her, she is an energetic woman who never gives up. Since starting her occupation, she has never diversified. She buys corn when it is plentiful and resells it when it is scarce, thereby turning a large profit. Currently, she has exhausted her stock, and requests her first loan to buy eleven sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse de maïs depuis 1994, madame A. Padagnassi est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Badou dans la préfecture de WAWA dans la région des plateaux. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur A. Akation qui est un retraité. Avec trois enfants à charge elle est une femme dynamique qui ne baisse jamais les bras. Depuis qu’elle a commencé son activité, elle ne l’a jamais diversifié. Elle achète le maïs en période d’abondance le stock et le revend en temps de pénurie. Ainsi elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfice. Actuellement ayant épuisé son stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 11 sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Purchase of eleven sacks of corn

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha baji is a widow of M. A. and has been living in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the last 29 years. Ayesha baji owns a three-room house. She is the mother of one son, Nadeem Akhtar. He is 21 years old and he has been in the business of selling cosmetics for the last 4 years. Ayesha baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell retail.

She is joined in her loan group by a three other members. Rani baji, Rashida baji, Zainab baji, and Zainab baji. Rani, Rashida, and Zainab request loans to buy fruits wholesale to sell retail. Zareena baji requests a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheel vehicle).

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve current businesses

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma, 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 12 and 1, has been selling coconuts, juice and khanga since 2005. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwajuma is now requesting a loan to buy more coconuts and khanga to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and khanga for expansion of her business.

loans.name: Chicas De Monique Group

texts.es:
El Comitè “Las Chicas de Monique” se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio Barsequillo de San Lorenzo, este comité desde un principio se ha mostrado sólido en cuanto a su organización y muy activo y participativo a la vez.

Todas las integrantes del comité tienen en común la venta de productos cosméticos de la Hines Monique de ahí el nombre de dicho comité. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran todas las integrantes del comité. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad estableciendo normas y reglamentos internos a ser cumplidos, a más de organizar ferias de comidas y rifas para obtener fondos para el Comité.
texts.en:
The Committee “Las Chicas de Monique” formed beginning with the meeting of various neighbors in Barsequillo de San Lorenzo. Since its beginning this committee has demonstrated itself to be solid with regard to its organization and is very active and has good participation. All the members of the committee have selling Hines Monique cosmetics in common and that is where the name of the committee came from. In the photograph you will find all the members of the committee. All the members have their own businesses, they are developing their businesses as part time businesses to increase their income. The members have demonstrated their unity establishing internal norms and rules to follow, they organize food markets and raffles to obtain funds for the committee.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is a businessman who successfully combines running his business and taking care of his family of six. He has four kids: two boys and two girls. Gennadyi is originally from Kherson, a city in the south of Ukraine. He started his business 6 years ago after a desperate period of unemployment when his family didn’t get enough for their most basic needs. Today, he offers English language training and translation services to all willing to master this language or needing the help of an interpreter.

Gennadyi has a perfect credit history. He has already repaid 5 Nadiya Ukraine loans without any delinquencies. This time, he is requesting a loan of 6500 Grivnas to purchase a new computer and hi-tech software which would help him offer better quality language training and more sophisticated training materials for all of his students. All Gennadyi’s students give positive feedback on his services and admit that the knowledge and skills they get at his courses help them in their careers and lives. We believe this loan will also be repaid promptly.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer, software and books

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Juarez se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de diesel el cual los almacena en barriles y luego los comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega.

Con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos y siendo este negocio el único sustento del hogar ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado préstamos que los ha sabido invertir en la compra del diesel. Una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con el negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia Juarez sells diesel which she stores in barrels and later sells out of her home in the Somotillo area of Chinandega. With the responsibility of taking care of her two children and with this business being the household's only source of income, she has been able to advance thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has granted her loans that she has used to purchase diesel. Once more she hopes that her loan will be granted to continue the business in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diesel

loans.name: Ufuoma

texts.en: Ufuoma O. owns a store where she sells bags of rice and beans, wholesale and retail. She travels to Lagos State to purchase her bags of rice and beans to sell in Benin City. She has been in this business since 2005. She needs the loan amount of N60, 000 to purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Kiwedde- Nandutu Aidat Group

texts.en:
N. Aidat (far right) represents her  small group of restaurant operators. She is 32 years old, married and a mother of 4. This hardworking lady owns continental services restaurant in Pallisa. She has 5 years experience in preparing both local and international dishes. Aidat has 2 lady employees who help her put with serving the customers. 

A plate of a local dish ranges between Ush100- Ush3000 whereas that of international  dishes costs betweenUsh5000-Ush10,000. Basing on her price list, her profit margin lies at approximately 30% of sales. Aidat is using the loan to purchase rice, maize and wheat flour, cereals. Aidat has great ambitions! She dreams of opening up a catering institution and a chain of restaurants in various towns. From her income, she takes care of her family needs.

loans.use: Purchase rice, maize and wheat flour, cereals.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en: Mari S. is 52 years old. She is married and had seven children. Unfortunately two of her children have passed away.  Two others are in school, and the rest are married. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the popular local foods; it is enjoyed as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, which is boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or eaten with what we call Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil, so in just 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to earn a good income to support her children in school. Mari belongs to a village bank called ‘Yeda Nyame ase’ which means We Thank God.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her porridge business.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо Хайдаркулова  1968 года рождения, замужем, имеет 4 детей. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2008 года. Кредит получает для откорма скота. В настоящий момент сезон покупки скота, на рынке скот дешевый, она купит и продаст через 3 месяца дороже. В продаже и покупки скота  помогает муж и дети. Зебо благодарна КИВА и Микроинвест, за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Zebo H. was born in 1968, is married and has 4 children. She has partnered with MicroInvest since 2008. She gets loans for raising livestock. At this moment is the season for purchasing livestock, at the market livestock is cheap, she will purchase it and resell it in 3 months at a more expensive price. Her husband and children help her in the sale and purchase of livestock. Zebo is grateful to KIVA and MicroInvest for their help and support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad A. Z. is a 39-year-old married man with two children who lives in Shakra, in Nabatieh.  He used to work in a telephone and mobile shop since 1990, but in 2000 he opened his own shop.  Today, Mohammad wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy postpaid recharge cards.

loans.use: Buy postpaid recharge cards.

loans.name: Anoumou

texts.en: Anoumou M. is a teacher who has three children.  Because his teacher's salary was not sufficient to support him and his children, he began selling the much-loved local beverage, Sodadi, in 2006.  He buys Sodadi in bulk in Tsévié in the country’s interior and transports it to be sold in Lomé, the capital of Togo. M.’s enterprise has been successful thus far because he carefully analyzed his business before beginning. He obtained a loan from Wages in 2006 to begin his business, and he is now seeking a second loan to buy 20 large containers of Sodadi and to transport them to Lomé.

loans.use: Purchase a local beverage

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine J. is renting a small parcel of land to farm rice. She is 55-years old and already a widow. She would like to grow her business and buy her own rice field someday. Now, she is worrying about how she will be able to stretch her limited income. She has decided to grow vegetables in her backyard for additional income.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will help her family a lot to increase the harvest.

CEVI is a non-profit organization set up to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. It helps provide not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the town of Bambang. She is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a clothing business, primarily providing new clothing to local community members.

Josephine joined ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Through patience and sacrifices, Josephine believes that she can develop her business, paving her way to becoming a successful entrepreneur. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old. Lydia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a pedicab transport service. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair her existing vehicle for better service. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Парвина - женщина в возрасте 26 лет, замужем имеет одного ребёнка.Она нигде временно не работает ,т.к. у неё маленький ребёнок. Но без дела   она не сидит  помогает мужу по уходу за скотом.Её муж работает частныи таксистом и на плохо зарабатывает. Но из-за того что Парвина в мужем хочет отремонтировать дом она вместе с мужем занимается уходом за скотом и продав скот с дохода хочет осуществить свои планы.На снимке Парвина в день выдачи получает деньги.
texts.en:
Parvina is a 26-year-old woman, who is married and has one child. She is temporarily unemployed because she has a small child. However, she does not sit idly by. She helps her husband take care of livestock. Her husband works as a taxi driver and makes a good living. But because Parvina and her husband want to repair their house, they are involved in livestock care. Once they sell the livestock, they want to use the profit to accomplish their goals. The photograph shows Parvina receiving money on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sales

loans.name: La Solucion 3 Group

texts.en:
Marta P. (on the far left in the picture) is the group coordinator for a group of five women form the Sabana Perdida neighborhood of Santo Domingo. She lives in a small house near the Ozama River with her husband and three children. Two of her children are girls, ages 8 and 5, and the third is a two-year-old boy. Marta's business is a successful fruit stand located on a busy road in Santo Domingo. She sells a wiD. variety of fruit, including watermelon, papaya, mango, green bananas, pineapple, and melons.

Marta intends to use this loan for working capital to continue increasing both the stock and and variety of the fruit that she sells. Additionally, Marta has ambitions to use the larger profits she will realize from selling more fruit to begin to stock a small fantasia (a variety store, usually with underwear, school supplies, cosmetics, and jewelry) that she will operate from her home.

Where Marta lives, her home is at risk from flooding when the river swells during hurricanes and tropical storms. Also, the house that she lives in has a leaky roof and weak walls. With the money that Marta hopes to gain from her fruit stand and fantasia, she plans to first improve her house with a stronger roof and cement walls. However, in the long run, her goal is to move away from the river to a neighborhood on high ground. She firmly believes that this is the right thing to do for herself and her husband, but, particularly, she wants her children to be able to grow in a stable house so that they will be able to focus on their schooling.

This is Marta's third loan from Esperanza. She has successfully repaid the first two loans. Marta described how, at first, she was afraid to take out a loan because she was very poor and was worried that she would not be able to pay back the loan. However, after discussing the loan with her husband, and much prayer, she decided that she would take the loan. Thus far, Marta says Esperanza has helped her to expand her business and earn more money, in addition to repaying her loan. Now, she says that she has more confidence in herself and her business abilities. When asked what she had to say to potential Kiva lenders, Marta said "I hope that they will lend as much money as possible to help people like me, because it has helped people like me to live a better life and give a better life to their children."

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell at her fruit stand and to improve her business.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло Усмонов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Абдулло имеет среднее образование. Он более 10 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота и его продажи, после откармливания.
texts.en:
Abdullo U. lives in the Hamadani district. He is 37 years old, married and has 6 children. Abdullo has a secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock, for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock and subsequent sale after feeding it.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa M.'s main source of income comes from raising hogs for sale. She is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Teresa has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: La Alternativa 5, 6 Group

texts.en:
Antonia A. (fourth from right) is a loving mother of three receiving a loan to improve her clothing and shoe sales business.  She has been selling clothing and shoes for several years, and her successful business is now on its second loan with Esperanza.  Antonia is committed to making sure she gets the right products to her customers, and travels to Santo Domingo – a 3 hour bus riD. – to buy new clothing based on her orders.  She also makes a several-hour trek to the Haitian border to buy new and used shoes.

Living with her three children ages 10 and below, the success of her business is vitally important for their health and education.  Antonia finds herself using the profits from her business to feed her children and pay for their studies, books, uniforms and more.  This loan is vitally important to the growth of her business – and sub sequentially the education of her children!

The future is also exciting for Antonia – she would love to start her own car repair center alongsiD. the main road leading to the biggest nearby city – Samaná.  Though this goal is at least a few years away, she is hoping that the incremental growth of her business through loans such as the one you are funding today will proviD. her this opportunity.

Thank you for supporting Antonia and all others included in this Kiva loan!

loans.use: new clothing and shoe inventory

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Hương Thị Nguyễn was born in 1965.  She lives in Xuan Trach village with her husband and two children. Her husband is a builder.  Her son and daughter are workers. They have a stabL. income.  She is farmer who stays at home and breeds pigs and cows. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She is the group leader of a seven member group loan offered by SEDA. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  At this time, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her cows. 
 
Luật Thị Vũ was born in 1978. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Hương Thị Nguyễn was born in 1957.  She has three children. She raises chickens. She needs 5,450,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.

 Chín Thị Lê was born in 1978. She has two children. She is a tailor. She needs 5,450,000 VND to buy fabric.

Thu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1970. She has two children.  She needs 5,450,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Chi Thị Nguyễn was born in 1977. She has two children. She sells vegetables in the market.  She needs 5,450,000 VND for her small business.
 
Hoa K. Nguyễn was born in 1967. She has two children. She needs 5,886,000 VND to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy food for cows.

loans.name: Lina Armando

texts.pt:
Lina nasceu na cidade de Maputo no bairro Luis Cabral tem 43 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 17 e 25 anos. Fez 9 classe, tendo parado devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores, vive na casa própria com os filhos mais uma sobrinha sob sua responsabilidade.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores na cidade de Maputo e casou se aos 20 anos com o ex-marido que lhe transferiu e passaram a viver juntos num outro bairro da cidade. O casamento só durou cerca de 20 anos. Foi nessa altura que a lina comprou um imóvel na cidade onde passou a viver. Mais tarde vendeu a casa e construiu uma outra no Bairro de infulene, onde vive ate hoje.

Nunca contraiu empréstimos em bancos ou instituições similares. Foi através dos seus condiscípulos da igreja que teve informações sobre as actividades da Hluvuku-Adsema e tendo decidido aproximar solicitando o presente empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos no seu estabelecimento (arroz, farinha, sabão e outros). Rende aprox. 5.000,00MT por mês, provenientes das vendas. Tem 12 anos de experiência nesta actividade e trabalha sozinha, sem empregados.

Lina acha que o seu negocio vai conhecer um crescimento em termos do volume, para satisfazer a demanda e rendimento para o beneficio familiar.
Propõe se pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o intuito de melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Lina was born in Maputo, Mozambique. She is 43 years old and a single mother of 3 children with ages between 17 and 25. She finished 9th grade but had to drop school due to her parent's financial difficulties. She lives with her children plus a niece she also supports. She was married for 20 years and after her divorce she moved to a different neighborhood, bought a house and kept investing in her business. She has never made loans and she's asking for 15.000,00MT (U$550) to buy food products like rice, flour and soap, and reselling them at the store she owns, where she makes around 5.000,00MT (U$180) per month in profit. She's been doing it for 12 years and has no employees. Lina believes her business is growing and she foresees good sales ahead. She hopes to have no problems in paying the loan back so she can apply for others in order to keep improving her business and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic food products for reselling

loans.name: Karina Selene

texts.en:
This is Karina Selene. She is 31 years-old and lives with her partner and their two children. Karina is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. Karina is a native of Cusco.

Karina sells beauty products. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products to sell.

Karina Selene appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella D. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour.

Estella is 26 years old and is married to a peasant farmer. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more baking flour

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 33 años de edad, la esposa tiene 25 años son casados, tienen 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años respectivamente, tienen casa propia. Santos es empleado con más de 6 años de antigüedad, trabaja en la fábrica de aceite de la provincia,  la esposa se dedica al comercio de dulces por docena en la feria. La competencia en sus dos actividades es media pero por la antigüedad en el rubro  tiene ventajas. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo en el negocio de la esposa ya que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año y las ventas  suben y quieren tener  una buena cantidad de mercadería en esta temporada. Sus antecedentes crediticios en la institución son excelentes, esta es su cuarta operación y todas fueron canceladas con total puntualidad.
texts.en:
Santos, 33, is married. His wife is 25 years old and they have 3 children: 9, 7, and 5-years-old respectively. They have their own home. Santos has been employed for over 6 years by the provincial oil making company. His wife sells candy by the dozen at the fair. Both activities have moderate competition but his long history in his occupation has its advantages. The financing will be used in the wife's work since the end-of-year festivities are approaching and sales rise and they want to have a good amount of merchandise in this season. Their credit history is excelent; this is their fourth loan and all the previous ones were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 35-year-old married man with four children who still go to school. He has owned a car repair shop in his town since 2000.

Today, Mohamad is asking for a loan of $1,100 to buy new tools and a specific machine to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new tools and a specific machine

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun S., 39, is married with three children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province with her husband (pictured in front of CREDIT MFI branch office) and children.

To make a living, S. grows rice and earns an income of US $1.6 per day. Her husband, who is a construction worker, earns US $3.6 per day. These sources of income help cover the family expenses.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income.

Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a new motorbike for one of her children to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver to help support the family.

This is S.'s fourth loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Helen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling rice in the local community. Helen has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Helen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional rice to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Myriam de 40 años de edad es soltera, trabaja como responsable de riesgo laboral en la Empresa Medica Previsional Asuncion desde hace 18 meses, a pesar de no tener hijos siempre esta pendiente de su mamá apoyandola en lo que mas puede, esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de ver culminado todos sus esfuerzos de estudio, pues esta en el periodo de hacer el curso de graduacion y tramitar el titulo de Licenciada en Contabilidad Publica y Finanzas, y espera lograr ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva para realizar este sueño.  Ella se caracteriza por ser muy alegre, trabajadora, responsable, de buenas costumbres y con muchos deseos de superacion.  En el futuro desea estudiar un postgrado para poder tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Myriam is 40 and single. Her work is being in charge of labor risks in the Empresa Medica Previsional Asuncion. She has been doing this for 18 months. In spite of not having children, she is always attentive to her mother and helps her as much as she can. She is asking for her fourth loan with the objective of seeing all of her educational efforts completed. She is now taking her graduation course, and is ready to process her title of being licensed in Public Accounting and Finances. She hopes to get a loan from Kiva to make this dream come true. She is characterized as being very happy, hard-working, and responsible. She has good morals and a great desire to succeed. In the future she would like to study a post graduate program to be able to have better work opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Graduation course and title processing fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more used shoes

loans.name: Margarita Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Margarita R. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesillos en el municipio de Nagarote donde se desempeña en la venta de estos deliciosos quesillos que están compuestos por quesillo, tortilla, cebolla y crema.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha necesitado esta mejora y es por este motivo que ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio de la mejora de su vivienda
texts.en:
Señora Margarita R. makes and sells tortillas filled with melted cheese in the city of Nagarote. She makes them with cheese, tortillas, onion, and cream. She is requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of construction materials to improve her living conditions. She has needed this improvement for a long time and this is why she hopes to receive this loan. She wants to improve her and her family's living conditions by improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Installation of two telephone booths

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy healing products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin A. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 49 years old. Martin is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Martin is starting a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Martin is just starting this business.

In 2010, Martin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martin is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Martin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products to sell that will expand his business

loans.name: Vin's Group

texts.en:
In Kor village, in Takeo province, consists four people who make up a group loan.  Vin V. is the group leader, selected by the others members.  Each will use their share of the loan to improve their businesses. 

Vin is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate and sell rice, to support her family.  Her husband is a blacksmith who earns a small salary.  So to improve her family's living conditions, Vin is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding, to start a new business.  She and her husband support three children; one is enrolled in local public school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
35 years old, Hellen is a married mother of 5 children aged between 1 and 20 years old. Three of her children are currently attending school.

She is a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years and has employed one casual laborer. Her main products are maize, beans and milk which she sells locally. She also operates a tailoring business where she earns Kes.4,000 per month. Her biggest challenge in farming is too much rainfall which affects her produce. 

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of Kes 45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will assist her educate her children and improve the living standards of the family.

In future, she hopes to purchase more land to enhance her productivity. She is grateful to Juhudi for the assistance accorded to her.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is 39 years old and has seven children, three of whom are her own and four are adopted. All her children are in school, apart from the youngest. Her husband is a driver. She says that it’s quite a challenge taking care of all these children and giving them a quality education.

Valentine has a shop which sells different items such as juices, soap, snacks and milk. She has a good clientele because her shop is near to a health clinic and a bus park. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more items such as sugar and rice so that she can have a wider variety of items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama K. is 43 and married with 5 children.  She sells taro, which she plants and harvests.  Malama has 2 years of experience in this business.  Malama requests a loan of WST$1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Malama joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Malama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Martha D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust.
Martha is 38 years old, married, and has three children aged from 5 to 17 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.
For the last 15 years, Martha has been selling drinks (liquor), milk and soap at Thinkers Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more drinks (liquor), milk and soap. Martha describes herself as a hard-working person. Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nancy is inset lower right because she was absent during loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more drinks (liquor), milk and soap

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 52 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 6 children who are between the ages of 12 and 21. Four of the children are currently in school.

David has been farming for the last 30 years in the town of Nyamira in Western Kenya. He has employed two people from his community. His farm produces milk, tea, beans and tomatoes, which he sells locally. He also earns income from his lumber business.

David has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will assist him in paying school fees for his children and to improve the living standards of his family. Her biggest challenge has been pests and diseases which affect his crops and animals.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en: Bernandita B. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old and is married with two adult children. Bernandita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling motor parts and fuel for vehicles like gasoline in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Bernandita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bernandita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem K., 33, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She sells groceries at home for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a harvesting machine to improve the family agriculture business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a harvesting machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Buenos Aires 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buenos Aires 1 está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras  una de ellas es Luisa del Carmen S. de 33 años quien con el dinero que gano en una rifa invirtió en la compra de mercadería en calzado. Ella tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años quienes van a clases y con el préstamo piensa mejorar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la joven Petrona A. de 21 años la cual inicio hace cuatro años con el comercio de ropa en el cual invertirá el crédito y Xiomara Blandino desde hace tres años vende carne negocio en el que invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The "Buenos Aires 1" group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Luisa del Carmen S., age 33, who invested the money she won in a raffle to buy shoes to sell. She has two children, aged 13 and 10, who go to school. With the loan, she is planning to improve her business. 

The other members of the group are the young Petrona A., age 21, who four years ago started a business selling clothing, in which she will invest the loan; and Xiomara Blandino, who has been selling meat for three years, and who will also invest the loan in her business.

loans.use: Buying shoes to sell

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha R. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Sophoin Kong, have been married since 2005 and have one young son. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sitha makes garlands of jasmine flowers; she is hired by the villagers to do this. Her husband sells grocery items and gasoline and he is also a phone repairman. Sitha previously received a Kiva loan and she now is asking for her second loan of $1,200 to help her husband’s capital. He will use the loan to expand the shop where he runs his business by repairing more phones and installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players.

loans.use: To expand her husband's shop

loans.name: Diana Matilde

texts.es: Diana Matilde tiene 21 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Es una joven muy luchadora, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por salir adelante. Inicio este negocio como una fuente de ingreso pues tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, pues es una madre responsable. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares, amigos entre otros. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. Ya que se acercan buenas fechas.
texts.en:
Diana Matilde, 21, has had a grocery store for over 3 years.  She is a hard working young woman who has always striven to get ahead in life.

She started the business as a way to earn income because she has a one-year old son in her care and she is a responsible mother.

Her customers are neighbors, relatives and friends, among others.

She will use the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergents and basic grains because good days are approaching.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mary An Janit

texts.en:
Mary An Janit is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture raising crops. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 3,000 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Mary An Janit joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fertilizers such as manure.
Mary An Janit is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farm.

loans.name: Tulabing's Group

texts.en:
Harenerosa T. lives in the village of Magay, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old and leads a two-person loan group that gets funding from PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if one is delinquent or defaults.

Harenerosa is married and has two adult-aged children. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (general) store. She has been in this business for more than 7 years and earns about 2,700 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Herenerosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from PMPC, and used each of them to buy goods for her retail store. She and her loan group are applying for a new loan, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Alfredo Enrique

texts.es:
Alfredo Enrique B. F. tiene 21 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañera,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
  
Alfredo Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la comercial Olivo.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar mejoramiento a la vivienda.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Alfredo Enrique B. F. is 21 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner in the canton Ventanas, in the province of Rios. He doesn't have any children.

The members of the communal bank Nuevo Horizonte ("New Horizon") are located in the recinto Cachel y Grande, which belongs to the canton Ventanas. This communal bank is involved with short-cycle agricultural activities such as sowing corn, rice and pigeon peas, which takes a lot of time to do.

Alfredo Enrique is a farmer who sows corn, rice and pigeon peas. He buys his products in the Agro Karlyta and sells his produce in the store Olivo. He is requesting the loan in order to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers in order to sow corn, rice and pigeon peas. The support of the loan will help him meet his needs financially. He is faced with challenges such as insect plagues, crop diseases and variations in the weather. His dream is to be able to improve his home. He enjoys sports.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr: Baba N. sociétaire de Ngueniene  s’active dans la boulangerie. En effet, monsieur N. est le premier dans la localité de Ngueniene à se lancer dans la boulangerie traditionnelle.il a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine car l’ayant exercé pendant longtemps à kaolack. Depuis trois ans, Baba N. s’est installé dans le village de Nguéniene ou il rentabilise bien son activité car bénéficiant d’une large zone de chalandise. C’est lui qui fournit tous les villages de la communauté rurale du pain traditionnel que l’on appelle « tapalapa »
texts.en: Baba N. is a member who owns a bakery. In fact, Mr. N. is the first in the region of Ngueniene to open a traditional bakery. He has a good deal of experience in the field having practiced for a longtime in Koalack. For the past three years Baba N. has lived in the village of Ngueniene where he manages his business in a large commercial region.  He supplies all of the villages of the rural community with traditional bread called "tapalapa".

loans.use: To invest in his bakery.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda H. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 59 years old. Florenda is married. To make a living, Florenda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Florenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen A. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 25 years old. Aileen is married and has 3 children aged 6, 4 and 2. To make a living, Aileen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aileen is working hard to build her business and be able to save for her children's future.

Aileen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aileen from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es:
El señor Ponciano V. O. de 57 años, tiene una hija menor que estudia. Ellos viven en una comunidad que está a 49 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el Sr. Ponciano es agricultor produce papa, haba, necesita un capital para comprar abono orgánico el abono en esta época es barato y no tiene todavía ingresos económicos de la producción agrícola.

El sr. Ponciano es una persona humilde trabajador y responsable, para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos. Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona a otorgar crédito, El sr Ponciano se emocionó mucho al saber que tiene la oportunidad de obtener un crédito, con lo que pueda comprar el abono orgánico oportunamente y tener lista para la siembra de esta año, así va tener ahorro para el estudio de la hija, como también para mejorar la vivienda que habitan porque esta es muy precaria.
texts.en:
Mr. Ponciano V. O., 57, has a minor daughter who is in school.  They live in a community located 49 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  Ponciano is a potato and lima bean farmer who needs a loan to buy organic manure.  Manure is inexpensive this time of year but his crops haven’t produced income for him yet.

Ponciano is a humble, responsible, hard working person.  It is very difficult for him to go to banks in the city that have lots of requirements.  We took the initiative to go to this area to grant loans.  Ponciano became very excited knowing that he would have the opportunity to obtain a loan with which to buy manure at an opportune time to have ready for this year’s planting season.  He will, thus, have savings available for his daughter’s schooling and also to do some home improvements on their dwelling which is quite precarious.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and 4 school-aged children. He has 15 years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2004.  He cultivates all types of fruit according to the season. He uses plastic tents to make his produce grow faster. He is the main income provider of the family.

 He has obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with payments on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products and needed supplies for his agricultural work.  He is certain that the loan will help him increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and needed supplies for his agricultural work.

loans.name: Las Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Gloria.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de café, venta de comida, venta de medias, carpintería, taller de tejido, venta de broster, tejido de chompas y venta de tejido.

La señora Gloria, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en Pro Mujer y que para que venga a la institución la invitaron sus amigas de su zona.
En la actualidad la señora Gloria tiene un negocio de venta de medias y trabaja en el un año, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió algunas amigas que estaban en este rubro. El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (medias), la que compra de  la Isac Tamayo y la vende en la feria 16 de julio los días jueves y domingo.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Sembradoras” (Farmers) Communal bank will start their first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Community Center.  The bank is comprised of nine members.  Gloria is the president.  The members of the communal bank carry on with varied activities such as selling coffee, selling food, selling hosiery, carpentry, weaving shop, selling broasted chicken, knitting sweaters, and selling weavings.

Gloria, the president of the communal bank, says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She has a business selling hosiery, and she has been working in this business for a year.  She tells us that she learned this business from some friends who were in this field.

She will use this loan to increase her merchandise (hosiery).  She buys her merchandise from the Isac Tamayo, and she sells it at the 16 de Julio fair on Thursdays and Sundays.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise by purchasing hosiery

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is a mother of three adults and a farmer in the Nkubu area in Central Kenya. She has been farming for ten years producing potatoes, vegetables, carrots, maize and milk and selling them in the local market. Grace has employed one farmhand and relies entirely on farming for her family’s upkeep. She believes finding sources for financial assistance for farming is the greatest challenge to farmers in her area. She believes Juhudi Kilimo loans have done a great service in mitigating this problem.

Grace has requested a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she is focusing on purchasing more acreage and expanding her farm. She believes steady income from the cow will cater to her family’s needs and make saving possible so she can open her own shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is from the village of Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old and married . To make a living, Emilda runs a business farming in the local community.  Emilda has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Emilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. 

Emilda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP with which she will purchase fertilizer for her farm. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace O. is 41 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. Her oldest child is in university. She lives with her family in  Caloocan City. She makes her living running a “sari-sari” (or variety) store which she takes great pride in keeping well stocked. She works on her own and earns about PHP 11,800 a month. She is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more items such as rice and groceries to sell to her customers. She is grateful for the help she receives from Kiva lenders and vows to continue working as hard as possible. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda, age 41, earns a living by running a general store in the local community. Nelda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. She and her husband have four school-aged children and live in the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. 
 
In 2010, Nelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Nelda has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Nelda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, and home goods needed for her general store business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, and home goods needed for her general store business

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outer ger districts of the city.
