Both of her daughters attend kindergarten, while her husband works as a taxi driver at a local taxi company. 

Altantuya helps support her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When Altantuya first began her business in 2007, she had 800,000 MNT in working capital from working at another person’s stall. 

Now Altantuya has 2,200,000 MNT in working capital made from her own stall. She purchases clothing for her business from China once or twice a month, depending on her income. 

Altantuya is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT to purchase clothing from Ereen City, China. She wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year. Her goal is to improve her business and then to be able to buy her own apartment. This will be more comfortable than living in her small house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is aged 32 and has been in farming for six years, producing tea and milk and selling to the local market in his hometown Litein, South Rift, Kenya.

Emanuel has made a request for 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle in order to start up a transport business. He says the transport business has picked up in the area and the motorcycle will also help him bring his own produce to the market in a timely manner. He hopes the business will add to his farming income and expand the businesses significantly.

Emanuel points to drought and poor markets as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en: Charlyn is a married woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is 31 years old and has a 7-year-old child. Charlyn runs a tailoring business from home. She makes school uniforms and provides general alterations. She has had her business for 10 years now. She plans to use her loan to buy cloth, thread and other materials she needs for her business. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and other materials.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rufino; el socio tiene 59 años; el socio es casado y tiene 4 hijos,  de los cuales todos son independientes, El socio se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, el socio es curandero y ejerce esta labor desde hace 40 años atrás y el mismo prepara  abase de hierbas naturales y otras raíces los medicamentos naturales para diferentes tipos de malestares, el socio es muy conocido en toda la región y es por esa razón que el desea el crédito para invertir al por mayor en la compra de cebos de animales y hierbas al por mayor porque desea el crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes para elaborar las pomadas y medicinas naturales para la venta ya que tiene un pedido grande y especial para el mes de agosto, el socio también reparte a domicilio sus pomadas cuando la gente que ya lo conoce le hace el pedido. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de hierbas y cebos de animales para la elaboración de la misma.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Community Bank “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”.  This bank belongs to the Yungaqui district, Anta province, and department of Cusco.

This member is Mr. Rufino.  He is 59 years old and married with 4 children, all of whom are independent.  He sells natural medicine.  He is a healer and has done this work for 40 years.  He prepares natural herbs and other natural roots for different types of ailments. 

He is very known in the area and it is for this reason that he wants a loan to invest in wholesale herbs and cebos (animal bait/feed).  He wants the loan to be able to buy all of the ingredients to make ointments and natural medicines to sell as he has a large order and special in the month of August.  He also delivers ointments to homes when people he knows place orders.

He is requesting a loan to invest in buying herbs and cebos (bait/feed) to make the medicines.

He is very satisfied and grateful for the support that is provided through this medium and agrees to comply with the payment of his debts on time.

loans.use: to invest in buying herbs and cebos (animal feed/bait) to make medicines.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 45 years old. He is a businessman who is married to Elizabeth. They are blessed with seven children who are fifteen, thirteen, eleven, nine, seven, five and three years old. He has been running a hotel for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family members. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour and a television set for his hotel. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour and a television set for his hotel

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and married with seven children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Violeta has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Violeta aspires to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Karol Paola

texts.es:
Karol Paola tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rumipamba, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, fréjol y crianza de animales.
Karol se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fréjol y crianza de animales. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado del Cantón Chillanes cada fin de semana. Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y líquidos para la maleza de los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar un terreno para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Es una mujer muy responsable,humilde, tranquila, puntual en los pagos y le gusta salir a pasear y conocer otros lugares en compañia de la familia.
texts.en:
Karol Paola is 19 years old. She is single and lives witth her parents in the Chillanes Canton in the province of Bolívar.

The communal bank of SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS is located in the Rumipamba District which is part of the Chillanes Canton. The members of this group work in agriculture, mainly in growing corn and raising livestock. Karol works growing corn and beans and raising livestock. She buys and sells her own products every weekend at the market of the Chillanes Canton. She is asking for the loan to buy manure, seeds, agricultural supplies, fertilizers and weedkillers to keep the crops in perfect condition and also buy food for the animals she raises so as to be able to sell them later at a better price.

The loan will help her meet her financial needs and improve the quality of her products and her agricultural activities. She faces challenges such as the drop in prices for the products she sells and also dealing with the middle-men. Her dream is to be able to buy a plot of land so that she can grow a little more produce to get higher profits for the welfare of her family.

She is a very responsible woman, who is humble, calm and punctual with her payments. She enjoys going for walks and visiting other places with her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, agricultural supplies, fertilizers, weedkillers and animal feed.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel, vive con su esposa  y sus hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería,  este es el trabajo de don Samuel al que le dedica su tiempo y del cual recibe los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar maíz, este préstamo la ayudara a adquirir el abono y tratamiento para plagas,  para dar los cuidados necesarios a la milpa.
Don Samuel espera que esta siembra le de buenos frutos, una cosecha abundante.
texts.en:
Samuel lives with his wife and children. He is a farmer and rancher. His work takes up much of his time since this is how he makes the necessary income to cover his household needs.

At the moment, Samuel is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn. This loan will help him to acquire compost and pest treatments so that he can provide the necessary care for his cornfield. Don Samuel hopes that his crop will yield good results and an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase compost and pest treatments.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. Five years ago, he decided to start running his own business. So he got involved in the construction field in order to earn good income to help his parents pay the heavy life expenses. His job is specialized in brick positioning. Today, he is applying for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy construction tools and supplies. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and supplies.

loans.name: Gandjenou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GANDJENOU est composé de trois  personnes qui se connaissent et qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ahouélidé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ahouélidé est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Ahouélidé n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et pour contribuer aux dépenses du ménage, Ahouélidé mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (bois de chauffage, lait, produits vivriers, etc.) à son domicile. Ahouélidé exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Ahouélidé s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ahouélidé sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GANDJENOU, un troisième crédit. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gandjenou group is made up of three persons who know each other and live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time this group is requesting financial help from ALIDé in order to increase their business.

The leader of the group goes by the name of  Ahouélidé. She is the one with her hand raised on the photo. She is 41 years old and is married to a mason named Christophe. The couple has three dependent children all attending school. The children live together with their parents.

Ahouélidé did not attend school. In order to meet her needs and to take part in covering household expenses she sells various items (firewood, milk, food products) from her home. She has been practicing this activity for the last five years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

With the objective to meet her customers' demand and to increase her sales and her income Ahouélidé, along with the other Gandjenou group members, is requesting a third loan. The previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn and milk cartons.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 51 years old. Evelyn has a truck-for-hire business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her truck. Evelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance of her truck

loans.name: José Candelario

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 72 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, que es empleada domestica y un hijo de 13 años de edad, que estudia séptimo grado y una hija de 10 años de edad, que estudia quinto grado. Ellos viven en casa propia, construida de adobe con techo de teja.

Él es pensionado, desde sus 25 años de edad, ya que laboro para una empresa, donde se desempeño como obrero de maquinas estiradotas, cumpliendo con la labor de deshilar la penca del henequén, para luego pasarlas a las hiladoras.

En los últimos 17 años, José se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz, siembra normalmente 7000 metros cuadrados, produciendo 40 quintales de maíz (4000 libras), también, trabaja como jornal devengando un salario de $5.00 dólares al día. A pesar de su edad, tiene la suficiente fuerza para realizar trabajos de campo.

La compra de los insumos agrícolas y la venta de su cosecha, las realiza en la ciudad, esta se encuentra a cinco kilómetros de su comunidad, se trasporta en autobús y en la palangana de un carro.

El prestamos será invertido, en la cancelación de un crédito vigente en Fundación Campo, y el resto será para pagar mano de obra de la cosecha de maíz y pago de la maquina desgranadora. La producción que espera don José es de 20 quintales (200 libras) de maíz, resultado de la siembra de media manzana (3500 metros cuadrados) de cultivo. De esta forma él venderá su producción a buen precio, ya que la producción agrícola fue poca, además evitara que le roben el maíz en el campo de cultivo.
 
Don José posee dos terrenos, y desea construirle una vivienda a cada uno de sus hijos, que ellos puedan estudiar como mínimo bachillerato, para que puedan trabajar y sostenerse económicamente, enseñándoles el trabajo de la agricultura y por supuesto inculcarles valores morales como la honradez, responsabilidad y amor al prójimo.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 72 and lives with his life companion who works as a domestic servant, his 13 year old son, who is in seventh grade, and his 10 year old daughter, who is in fifth grade. They live in their own home, built of adobe with a tile roof.

He is retired. From the time he was 25, he worked for a business operating a sisal fiber extractor, which involved scraping the leaves of the sisal plant before sending them to the spinners.

For the past 17 years, José has cultivated corn, normally planting 7,000 sq. meters and producing 40 hundredweights (4,000 pounds). He also works as a day laborer, earning a salary of $5 a day. Despite his age, he has enough energy to work in the fields.

He purchases farming supplies and sells his crop in the city, which is about five kilometers from his neighborhood. He uses the bus or the bed of a truck for transportation.

The loan will be invested in paying off an outstanding loan with Fundación Campo with the remainder used to pay a work force to harvest his corn crop and to pay for the threshing machine. Sr. José expects to harvest 20 hundredweights (2,000 pounds) of corn from planting half a manzana of land (3,500 sq. meters). Consequently, he will sell his crop at a good price since corn production was low this year. In addition, he will avoid having the corn stolen from his fields.

Sr. José has two lots and wants to build houses for each one of his children so they can study at least through high school, and can work and support themselves economically. He is teaching them how to farm and, of course, inculcating in them moral values such as honesty, responsibility and love for their neighbors.

loans.use: to pay off an outstanding loan from Fundación Campo, with the remainder used to pay a work force to harvest his corn and to pay for the threshing machine.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley has been in the clothing business in the town of Naivasha for the last year. He is 42 years old, married to Ruth, and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all of his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock to sell in his business.

In the future, Stanley hopes to expand his business and become one of the leading business people in Naivasha.

loans.use: to add stock to his business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 28-year-old man who breeds cattle. He has been engaged in this business for the past 4 years. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with wife in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He usually buys small calves, raises them and resells them in 5-6 months at a more profitable price. Ahmad sells cattle for meat which is a very profitable business because meat is very popular in Azerbaijan and locals use it in everyday cuisine. His monthly income is 200 AZN. His wife helps him to run the business. Cattle breeding brings stable income to Ahmad’s family; it is the family's only income source. He needs additional capital to purchase more cattle to increase sales and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maimouna  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 et 39 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de poissons depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité du fait que ses enfants possèdent  des pirogues et qu’elle a la facilité de se procurer le  produit qu’elle commercialise. La satisfaction qu’elle procure à sa clientèle l’intéresse  beaucoup mais aussi les profits qu’elle réalise a travers son activité. Elle  est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons à revendre. Elle souhaite augmenter l’offre qu’elle propose à sa clientèle  et aussi diversifier la gamme de produits qu’elle vend. Son objectif final est d’accroitre ses revenus  pour mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Madame Maimouna living in Senegal. She is married and the mother of 10 children which range in age from 10 to 39-years-old. She has worked in the commerce sector, selling fish, for more than 10 years. She chose this activity because her children possess some canoes which gives her the means to procure the product that she sells. She takes great interest in the satisfaction of her clients but also in the profits that she makes through this activity. She has been a member of one of the local branches of the U-IMCEC since August 2011. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs, which she plans to use for the purchase of fish to resell. She hopes to increase her offerings to her clients and also to diversify the range of products that she sells. Her final goal is to increase her earnings in order to better the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Ayuen

texts.en:
Ayuen is a 29 year old a married woman who has three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling groceries in a store in bor, south Sudan for three years.

Ayuen has requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan to purchase chalk of sugar and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chalk of sugar and onion to sell.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a father of one and has been in active farming for 4 consecutive years in Kitale, in western Kenya.  His farm currently produces tomatoes, maize, beans and milk with the help of one farmhand.  Timothy is aged 38.

Timothy has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhdi Kilimo to help him set up a greenhouse where he will grow tomatoes. He says the greenhouse will enable him to produce quality product and more than double his farming income due to all-seasons production.  He adds the improved income will ensure his family is financially secure.

Timothy however lists lack of capital, high cost of production due to costly outputs and low market prices as some of his major challenges.

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse where he will grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es: El señor Nelson Javier a sus 36 años de edad se dedica a la compra y distribución de huevos a tiendas y mini mercados de un barrio localizado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín.  Gracias a esta actividad, consigue el sustento para suplir sus necesidades y apoyar económicamente a sus padres. Con el ánimo de ampliar su mercado y mejorar sus ventas, el señor Nelson Javier necesita pagar tres facturas a sus proveedores para que le puedan seguir suministrando los huevos para su venta y distribución y así poder abrir nuevos mercados y aumentar el número de clientes. El sueño del señor Nelson Javier es ver crecer su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Nelson Javier, who is 36 years old, buys eggs and distributes them to stores and markets in a neighborhood north of the city of Medellín. Thanks to this activity, he is able to meet his needs and support his parents.

Wanting to expand his market and improve his sales, Nelson Javier needs to pay three bills from his suppliers so they can continue supplying him with eggs to sell and distribute so he can open new markets and increase the number of customers he has.

Nelson Javier's dream is to see his business grow and give his parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay bills from his suppliers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells charcoal in Abuenu. She is married and has six children her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling charcoal for ten years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in order to feed their children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nelgen

texts.en: Nelgen, a widow and the mother of two, operates a farm growing corn and coconut to earn a living. She has been in farming for ten years and she earns well for her family. She took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to have an abundant harvest. She plans to expand the farm by having more plots of corn to ensure more income from her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to have an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Lalotoga

texts.en: It is a Lalotogas passion to make ice cakes and boiled eggs to sell.  She makes 50 ice cakes and 5 dozen eggs each day.  The ice cakes are sold in nearby stores and she makes her rounds selling the eggs.  It is also very fortunate for her that her husband works for Samoatel. He supports her by helping her prepare the ice cakes whenever he is available. Lalotoga makes $250 in profit, which helps her pay back the loan from SPBD and meet her family commitments.

loans.use: The loan will go towards purchasing cool aid, plastic cups, eggs, snacks, and ice pops.  She also needs to buy a pot and tray.

loans.name: Merina Ajuma

texts.en: Merina is an active member of PEMCI who has finished her third loan successfully, and intends to get a fourth one. Her previous loans have enabled her to engage in more profitable businesses, and she has also gained quite an experience. She is now a hawker and a farmer as well. With her fourth loan, she intends to invest in her farm and improve on her rice scheme for a higher production.

loans.use: To boost her farm produce

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria has a talent for working with her hands and is very ceative. She is married with four children; they were her motivation to start her own floral arrangement and balloon business three years ago. This is how she is able to to help her husband with the household and her children's educational expenses. The originality and experience that Flor puts into each one of her creations has helped her gain many clients and grow her business.

Fortunately, Flor has had more requests and needs a loan of 275 dollars to purchase materials for the production of arrangements. With this loan, she expects to meet the demands of her work and offer her clients the best service. She will pay off her loan in 4 months. This is a very important part of Flor's and her family's life, and they greatly appreciate your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor Maria tiene mucha facilidad para las manualidades y es muy creativa, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, quienes fueron el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio hace tres años con la elaboración de arreglos florales y de globos, de esta manera es como puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. La originalidad y experiencia que Flor deposita en cada una de sus creaciones le ha ayudado a ganar más clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Afortunadamente Flor ha tenido pedidos más grandes y necesita de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los arreglos, con esto espera cubrir la demanda por sus servicios y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella devolverá esta cantidad en 4 meses. Sé parte importante en la vida de Flor y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O., 54 years old, married, and mother of six children, sells provisions and drinks to people in her area. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Eunice has been in this business for 6 years and hopes to increase her business capital and thus her inventory with the loan of US$ 550 which will permit her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks for resale

loans.name: Myrian

texts.en:
Miryan G. is just 23 years old, living in Carapeguá, Paraguay, with her son of two years of age. Miryan lives with her partner, Oscar Lovera, for the past three years. To ensure a steady income, Miryan sells blankets and hammocks in the artesan market in Asuncion. Oscar also contributes to their small family by working in a company that produces leather. Both work very hard so that they will be able to provide a better life for their son and to also build and furnish their home.

Now, Miryan wishes to buy more of the merchandise to continue her way of life. The items she wishes to buy include: hand-made blouses, mosquito nets and fans. These items have been quite popular and now that the weather is getting warmer, the demand for them has increased. With the credit she receives, she will purchase these items.

loans.use: To buy hand-made blouses, mosquito nets and fans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Allah's Group

texts.en: I am Allah R., wife of Muhammad Yasin. I have six children: three boys and three girls. My husband sells crockery on his cart in exchange for money or used items. He earns $3 to $4 a day. I embroider clothes to order for one of my relatives. My husband now plans to expand his business and requires a loan for this purpose. Earlier, we invested a loan in this business, and our profits increased so that we could repair our house. My group members are: Waziran B. requires a loan for her dairy business. Sharifan B. needs a loan for her grocery store. Zarina B. plans to use her loan for her dairy business. Koser B. wants a loan to buy a cow. Jameela B. wants a loan to expand her beauty parlor.

loans.use: Expand crockery business

loans.name: İlhama

texts.en: Ilhama started this business one year ago. She was born in 1970 and lives in the Khachmaz region. Ilhama is single. She sells clothes, blankets, towels, etc. by retail. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy additional stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Kate May Carolina

texts.es:
The small business owner, Kate May Caroline N. M. is 59 years old and is originally from Bluefields. She is married, ethnically creole and is the mother of 3 children. One studies in secondary school and is the oldest of the three. Mrs. N. has been dedicated to the business of selling clothes and footwear in the shopping center in the city. As she is ethnically creole, she has many creole clients that prefer to buy from her, even though there are many similar businesses in the shopping center. With his small business, N. has been able to maintain an economical lifestyle. However, just like others in her business, she needs help to buy better inventory of fashionable clothes. She wants to buy 2 dozen women's blouses that cost $48 per dozen, 2 dozen children suits that cost $60 per dozen, 1 dozen pants that cost $102 per dozen, 8 pairs of sandals that cost $4 each, 1 dozen of one type of pants that cost $25 per dozen and 1 dozen of another type of pants that cost $95 per dozen.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

La microempresaria Kate May Carolina N. M. tiene 59 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, es casada, de la etnia creole, madre de 3 hijos, 1 estudia en secundaria y dos mayores de edad. La señora N. se dedica desde hace 15 años aproximadamente a la venta de ropas y calzados en el centro comercial de esta ciudad. Por ser de la etnia creole tiene muchos clientes de esa etnia que la prefieren a pesar que en este centro comercial hay otros negocios similares. Con este negocio la microempresaria N. a podido mantenerse economicamente pero al igual que otras microempresarias necesita de un financiamiento para poder comprar mayor inventario de ropas a la moda, por lo que quiere comprar: 2 docenas de blusas de mujer a US$ 84 dolares cada docena, 2 docenas de trajes de niños a US$ 60 dolares cada docena, 1 docena de pantalones Studio a US$ 102 dolares cada docena, 8 pares de sandalias a US$ 4 dolares cada par, 1 docena de pantalones Justo a US$ 25 dolares cada docena y 1 docena de pantalones Bring a US$ 95 dolares cada docena.

loans.use:
To buy 2 dozen blouses, 2 dozen children suits, 1 dozen paints, eight dozen sandals, 1 dozen of one type of pants and 1 dozen of another type of pants.
.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a budding entrepreneur and the proud mother of two school-going children. To make a living and provide food and education for her children, Miriam sells a collection of chic pants, shirts, blouses, and shoes. Recently, the entrepreneur took a loan from FSMA which she used to add new styles of shoes and slippers to her stock. The investment was successful and Miriam managed to attract new people to her business and increase her income.

With this second loan, the entrepreneur will buy new fashionable pants and shirts to add to her inventory. Miriam wants to keep working hard in order to provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing to supply her business

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Señora G. is married and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is 32-years-old and has 3 children, who are 2, 10, and 12. Her husband is a teacher at a high school. Her business is selling American clothing. She has 3 years of experience. She started her business with her own funds.

She would like this loan to finish constructing a wall for better security for her home. In the future, she hopes to start a store in her house, to finish constructing her house, and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. G., es casada y vive en el barrio Laureles Norte tiene 32 años de edad y tiene tres hijos de 2, 10 y 12 años de edad.Su esposo trabaja es docente de un colegio y aporta a su familia. Su negocio de ella es la venta de ropa americana tiene tres años de experiencia, comenzó su negocio con fondos propios.

loans.use: Construction of a wall to protect her home

loans.name: Favor

texts.en: Favor A. sells drinks and medicine. She learned this business over the course of three and a half years and has been in business since 2000. She is 42 years old and is married with 4 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more medicines and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more medicines and and drinks

loans.name: Mouhamadou

texts.fr:
Mouhamadou Diakhaté is a young man who has specialized in business since he quit his studies. He is single and without children and lives in Medina Falls neighborhood in Thies. He manages a hardware store, and his clientele is made up of masons from his neighborhood. With this loan, he plans to buy goods to build up his inventory and increase his income.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

mouhamadou diakhaté est un jeune qui est spécialisé dans le commerce depuis qu'il a abandonné les études .il est célibataire sans enfants et réside au quartier medina fall de thies .il gère une quincaillerie et sa clientèle est composée des maçons de son quartier.avec ce pret il compte acheter des marchandises pour renforcer son stock et améliorer ses revenus

loans.use: purchase of hardware goods

loans.name: Efosa

texts.en: Efosa A. is 36 years old and is married with one child.  He lives in Benin City, in the Edo state of Nigeria.  Having been trained as a motor mechanic, he works in Benin City and sells motor spare parts to people in his community.  In order to further expand his business and attract his customers, Efosa needs a loan of $1,025 to purchase more spare parts and attain further skills.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sales.

loans.name: Loa

texts.en:
Loa M., age 45, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been planting many kinds of vegetables, such as cabbage and long beans. She sells her crop at the market and earns about $7 per day. Her husband is a fisherman. Normally, he sells his catch to the market and makes $4 of profit per day. 

Loa is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to make two investments. She would like to invest $300 USD in her husband's business and invest $700 USD in her farm by purchasing more fertilizer, insecticide, seeds, and gas. She sees these investments as opportunities to increase her daily income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools for her husband and fertilizer, insecticide, seed and gas for her farm.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 54 years old and married with 5 children, sells garri, a Nigerian staple made from ground and fried cassava.  Going to the villages to buy already processed garri, she returns to the city to sell to her customers at a profit.  Mercy started this business in 1983 and has been working to expand with help from LAPO for the past four years.  A faithful and trustworthy borrower, she now seeks a loan of $425 to buy more garri to sell.  The more that she can purchase on each trip, the greater will be the productivity of her travel, and the resulting increase in profit will allow her to better support her family.  Mercy says, "God bless you, Kiva!"

loans.use: To buy more garri to sell.

loans.name: Elvia Lizeth

texts.es:
Elva Lizeth R. R. es orginaria de Linares Nuevo León, y cuenta con 19 años de edad. <

> Actualmente, Elvia solicita un crédito por USD$225 a un plazo de 3 meses, con la finalidad de comprar calzado para su venta. <

> Elva inició hace aproximadamente 3 años, cuando ella veía que otras personas ponían sus puestos cerca de su casa y tenían clientela, es por ello que se decidió cuando una amiga le prestó un catalogo para que ofreciera calzado y de está manera comenzó ofreciendo productos a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos. <

> Aunado a lo anterior, Elva tenía deseos de ayudar a sus padres con los gastos ya que enfrentaban una díficil situación económica. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Elva en su negocio de ventas por catálogo! <

>
texts.en:
Elvia Lizeth R. Rodriguez is originally from Linares Nuevo Leon and she is 19 years old.,/p>

Elvia is requesting a loan amounting to $225 US for a term of 3 months, and she will purchase shoes for sale.

Elvia started out approximately 3 years ago after she saw others setting up their booths near her home and she saw they had clientele. She made her deciion after a friend loaned her a catalogue from which to order shoes and that's how she started offering the products to her family, friends and neighbours.

In addition to this, Elvia also wanted to help out her parents with their expenses because they found themselves in a difficult financial situation.

I invite you to support Elvia on her catalogue business!


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales.

loans.name: Virgínia João

texts.pt:
Virgínia João H. é natural de Maputo e tem 36 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de um filho com 6 anos de idade, alem do seu filho sustenta também a sua mãe e sua irmã que vive com elas.

Virgínia estudou ate 8ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras para custear os seus estudos, situação criada pela morte do seu pai e ela ainda era muito nova, em 1997 casou se com o marido que veio a perder vida em 2007.

Virgínia vive de negocio que consiste na venda de frangos e miudezas, é dona de negocio  faz sozinha nao tem empregada. Onde destaca as miudezas que adquira a embalagem por 80 rands(200,00mt) e vende por 420,00mt, com isso tem um rendimento mensal de 10000,00mt. Para viirginia este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde o primeiro foi de 15000,00mt e aplicou neste negocio.

Assim constitui grandes sonhos para virgínia o melhoramento das condições habitacionais da família e crescer mais o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Virgínia João H. is from the city of Maputo. She is 36 years old, a widow and mother of a 6 year-old son. Also living with her are her mother and a sister - she provides for both of them as well. Her father's passing when she was very young created financial difficulties for the family, and Virginia had to drop out of the school while on the 8th grade. Unfortunately, in 2007, after 10 years of marriage, she also lost her husband. Virginia makes her living by selling chickens, and a small variety of assorted articles, without help from additional employees. She is able to purchase these small articles for 80 rands (200,00mt) and sell them for 420,00mt, generating a monthly income of 10000,00mt. This is Virginia's second loan request from Hluvuku and the first through Kiva. She applied the whole loan amount of 15000,00mt from the first loan in her business. Ultimately, she wants to fulfill her dreams: make improvements to better accommodate her family and help her business grow further.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of chickens and small assorted articles.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice E. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are currently in school. She has been manufacturing of palm oil for four years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. She produces the oil and supplies it to food vendors who use it to prepare their wares. She plans to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, containers to store the oil, and an electric milling machine to allow her to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Kingdom Trust Group; her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral and help one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and an electric milling machine for making palm oil

loans.name: Adjo Celestine

texts.fr:
Agée de 35 ans, Madame O. Adjo Celestine est une revendeuse de charbon qui sollicite son premier crédit au près de WAGES.  Avec ce crédit, elle va reconstituer son stock de charbon qu’elle vend au domicile à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis dix ans, donc elle est bien expérimentée.  

Nee a Lomé, Madame O. est mariée avec ISSA Iladji, un électricien.  Avec le revenu de son commerce, elle aide son mari de soutenir leurs 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Ms.Adjo Celestine O., age 35, is a retailer of charcoal who is requesting her first WAGES loan. She is going to use it to replenish her stock of charcoal, which she sells out of her home in Agoè, a district north of Lomé. She started this commerce 10 years ago, so she has a lot of experience.

Born in Lomé, Ms. O. is married to Iladji ISSA, an electrician. With the income from her commerce, she helps her husband support their four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 33 años de edad, tienen 03 hijos, y es casada; asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra y venta de maíz, su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de maíz.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de ganado vacuno (toros), los que engordará y venderá en la feria de Pilcuyo; ello le servirá para poder construir su casa en Chipana para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Las Brisas del Rio Blanco (The White River Breezes) community bank in the town of Chipana, in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province and Puno Department. Alicia is 33 years old, and is married with three children. She completed high school and for the past four years has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a women's advocacy organization, buying and selling corn. Alicia invested her first loan of 300 nuevos soles in the purchase of corn, but this loan of 3000 nuevos soles, an amount which she has promised to repay punctually in five months' time, is destined for the purchase of bulls. Alicia will fatten them and sell them at the Pilcuyo market. The profit will make it possible for her to build a house in Chipana for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulls

loans.name: Mansurboy

texts.en:
Mansurboy S. has got a mini-van and provides transportation. His usual itinerary is the Isfara-Khujand-Isfara route. Having been in this business for 2 years, he has gained much experience. The business is stable and generates the main income for Mansurboy’s family, allowing them to improve their living conditions. Currently his mini-van needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of 800 USD for purchasing spare parts for his car. Mansurboy thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 9 months with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts to repair his mini-van.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 22 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon. Hussein has owned a cassette, CD and DVD shop for a year. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan.

Hussein is special in his work because he is always aware of new releases. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When Hussein first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. is fifty-six years old. She is married and has two sons. Both of them have completed senior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
She works hard to make some income to help her husband provide for the family. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in all kinds of minerals and drinks – malt, coke, fanta, etc. She buys the minerals from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in the community market. She owns a shop in which she sells her products. Elizabeth also sells plastic products. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy her products in bulk.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama D. une commerçante Sénégalaise qui sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son entreprise agricultural qu’elle fait chez elle.  Elle a commencé de faire ce travail depuis des années.  Avec ce crédit elle va acheter 100 poussins, 7 sacs alimentaires, et des vaccines.  En plus, elle vend des tissus, le thioub (un type de tissu Sénégalais), sac à mains, et chaussures.  Elle a déjà reçu trois crédits auprès de l’IMCEC depuis 2006, et elle a tout bien remboursé.  Elle est âgée de 46 ans et elle est mariée.  Elle va utiliser les revenus de son entreprise pour régler les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariama D. is a Senegalese merchant who is requesting a loan to bolster her agricultural enterprise she has at home. She started doing this work a few years ago. With this loan, she's going to buy 100 chicks, seven sacks of feed, and some vaccines. In addition, she sells fabrics: thioub (a type of Senegalese cloth), handbags, and shoes. She has had three loans from IMCEC since 2006, and she repaid them all. She is 46 years old and married. She will use the revenues from her enterprise to cover day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, sacks of feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Pious

texts.en: Pious A. is married with 3 children and has received an education through junior high school. Since 2000, Pious has worked as a photographer selling pictures at Moree near Cape Coast. While Pious is employed as a photographer, his wife works as a baker.  Pious uses his income to pay for utilities and his children’s school fees. He will use the loan to purchase additional batteries, film, glasses, envelopes, and frames, which will enhance his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Pious plans to invest in farming and housing projects.

loans.use: Additional batteries, film, glasses, envelopes, and frames

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en: N. Faridah is a businesswoman, 34-years old, and the mother of three children. She operates a bar and she has been operating the bar for over five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase bar items such as beers, wines, spirits, sodas, etc to meet her customer demands. Having used her capital income to purchase land and construct rental houses, the loan will add capital and expand her business. Her future dream is to educate her children and purchase more plots of land to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase bar items such as beers, wines, spirits, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
"M. Trương Thị (20201010001) is a 26 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. M. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngân Cầu 01 (1).

M. is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, M. owns and operates a business providing cargo transport services to local community members. M. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. is requesting her first loan from SEDA, for 5.152.000 VND, which she will use to purchase equipment to improve her business. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002), a 28 year-old female, is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

2. Đào Thị V. A. (20201010003), a 36 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201010004), a 55 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005), a 48 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her food stall.

5. Nguyễn Thị CA. (20201010006), a 48 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

M. Trương Thị (20201010001) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. M. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngân Cầu 01 (1).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ vận chuyển hàng hóa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. M. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND. M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy. M. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. Đào Thị V. A. (20201010003) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201010004) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 5. Nguyễn Thị CA. (20201010006) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business.

loans.name: Ariel Ignacio

texts.es:
El microempresario Ariel Ignacio Salieron Obregón tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos, uno estudia en secundaria y otro se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. El señor Salmerón es dueño de un vehiculo (Taxi) con el cual brinda labores de transporte selectivo en esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Sin embargo por las condiciones de las vías (calles) los vehículos se dañan con bastante frecuencia lo que obligan a los dueños de estos a tener que darle mantenimiento con bastante frecuencia, por tal razón el conducto Salmerón requiere comprar algunos repuestos para su taxi. Por lo que esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

1 vulvo de freno el que le cuesta US 130, 1 radiador cuesta US 150, 2 focos delanteros US 70 cada uno, 4 llantas Rucyer US 60 cada una, 1 compresor para aire acondicionado cuesta US 190 y 1 vidrio delantero cuesta US 150.
texts.en:
Ariel Ignacio Salieron Obregón, an entrepreneur, is 43 years old and married. He has two children. One is in high school, and the other is in the university. Mr. Salmerón owns a vehicle, which he uses to provide taxi services in the city of Bluefield. Due to the road conditions, cars get damaged frequently. The vehicle owners, therefore, must perform maintenance frequently. That is why Mr. Salmerón needs to buy some replacement parts for his taxi. He will use the loan to buy the following: Brake repair that costs US 130, radiator that costs US 150, headlights that cost US 70 per light, 4 Rucyer tiles that cost US 60 per tire, compressor for the air conditioning that costs US 190, and front windshield that costs US 150.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part for the brake, radiador, 2 headlights, 4  Rucyer tires, air conditioner compressor and front windshield

loans.name: Luk

texts.en: Mrs. Luk E. is a villager in Prey Mei Lang, Thboung village, in Takeo province. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Som San, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer or to hire laborers to work in the field. In order to deal with this difficulty, Mrs. Luk E. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s use. Additionally, she wants to expand her child’s business by purchasing chairs and some ingredients for making the desserts that her child sells. She is forty-six years old and the mother of four childrE., one of whom is the dessert seller. Another attends the local school and the others stay at home to help with housework. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To support the rice field and to expand her child’s business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene G. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Irene is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Irene plants and harvests corn for sale. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Irene is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Irene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: mareme M. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1997.elle est spécialisée dans la vente de mangues et autres fruits saisonniers.elle sollicite un crédit de cent mille (100 000)frs pour augmenter son fond et diversifier ses produits.elle participe activement a l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mareme M. has been a client since 1997. She specializes in the sale of mangoes and other seasonal fruits. She is requesting a loan of one hundred thousand (100,000) francs to increase her capital and to diversify her products. She actively participates in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Emeliano

texts.en:
Emeliano A. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 51 years old. Emeliano is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emeliano owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Emeliano has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Emeliano joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emeliano is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emeliano from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina T. is a 49-year-old woman living in the village of Taklaron, Brgy. Malingin, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She is married to Eliseo T., who owns and operates a machine shop. They have a 12-year-old child who is currently in school.

Lina and her husband are entrepreneurs. Even before she got married, Lina already had her own general store, while her husband already had his machine shop. When they got married, it looked as if they would have a stable life, with both of them already having their own livelihoods. But sharp economic downturns can befall anyone. At one point, Eliseo wanted to give up his machine shop because he thought that he could no longer afford to buy the necessary spare parts for his machines and he was worried about the competition. But Lina encouraged him to go on and not to lose hope.

Because she was able to spare some of her capital from the general store to help her husband's business, they were able to survive that crisis. That event opened Eliseo's eyes to the fact that, in order to grow, they needed to have additional capital. When he heard about NWTF-Project Dungganon, he encouraged Lina to join, which she did in 2004. From then on she was able to borrow money to use as capital for both the general store and the machine shop, helping both businesses thrive.

On her 4th loan cycle, Lina expanded her general store and also purchased additional materials for her husband's machine shop. Their combined monthly net income from their businesses provides them with 12,000 pesos per month, which they mostly plow back into the businesses after setting some money aside for household expenses and savings for the education of their only child.

For her previous 14th loan cycle, Lina borrowed 19,000 pesos and this amount contributed to the continued success of the family businesses. She was able to pay everything back on time and in full. She plans to borrow 20,000 pesos for her 15th loan cycle, so that she can buy more items to sell in her general store. She plans to use the profits to rent a farm so that she can increase her income even further. She has high hopes for the future of her child.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: To purchase additional items for general store

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 41 años y vive con Cinthya, su pareja, con la que tiene 2 hermosos hijos; Rani de 5 y Amisha de 3 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia en el distrito de Ventanilla, al norte de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 7 años él se dedica a la electromecánica, es decir está capacitado para refaccionar diferentes aparatos, pero actualmente viene trabajando frecuentemente con vehículos. A Eduardo su trabajo le apasiona y siempre lo realiza con gran gusto, pero como él dice “No es nada fácil”, pues requiere de gran precisión y mucho esfuerzo. Felizmente lo realiza con vocación y eso provoca que sus clientes siempre se vayan muy contentos de su taller, con lo cual obtiene buenas ganancias. Para el futuro espera tener otro negocio que le sea igual de provechoso, él ha pensado poner una ferretería para así tener un negocio familiar.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos repuestos que le hacen falta para el acabado de los vehículos que le dejaron a reparar.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 41 years old. He lives with his partner, Cinthya, with whom he has two beautiful children: Rani, 5 and Amisha, 3. They live in their own home in the Ventanilla district, north of Lima. For the past 7 years he has repaired electric appliances although recently he has been working on vehicles. Eduardo is passionate about his work and always carries it out with great pleasure but, as he says, 'It's not at all easy" since it requires a great deal of precision and effort. Happily, he does it with dedication and that causes his customers to leave his shop happy which, in turn, leaves him with good profits. For the future he would like to have another, equally profitable business; he has thought of opening a hardware store so as to have a family business. This is his third loan with MFP and he has always been very punctual with his repayments. With these funds he will purchase some replacement parts that he needs for some of the vehicles that have been left for him to repair.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan has been the owner of a car painting shop since 1994, by which he earns income to help satisfy the needs of his family. He is a married man with four children who are still in school. Hassan is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy additional tools needed to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Mawena

texts.fr:
Son stock étant en baisse et pour pouvoir bien vendre en période de fêtes, cette dynamique femme revendeuse de pagnes sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 45 pagnes HI-TARGET, 20 pagnes JAVA, 10 pagnes PHOENIX.  Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer.
texts.en:
Her inventory being low and to sell more during the holidays, this energetic women who is a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 45 lengths of HI-TARGET pagnes, 20 of JAVA, and 10 of PHOENIX. She sells from place to place and supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children. The business she has allows her to do her financial share for her home.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth of different makes

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is Memuna K.. She is a 35-year-old married woman from Wilberforce, an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. She has three children: one boy and two girls, all in secondary school. Her husband is a teacher.

Memuna has been in LAPOSL for some time now and has taken one previous loan as a member of a LAPOSL Union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving from Kiva lenders.

Memuna sells her goods from her house in Freetown. She sells drinks, palm oil, and bags of rice. She expanded the inventory of her stall with the first loan she collected and she also decided to buy the same type of goods with this new loan.

Memuna says she will pay her children's school fees with the profit from this new loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for sale

loans.name: Ariston

texts.en:
Ariston L. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 51 years old. Ariston is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Ariston owns and operates a business venture in the food sector: operating a fishing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ariston has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ariston joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariston has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ariston is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ariston from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Wahida Ziba Group

texts.en:
This is the Wahida Ziba group, which is made up of four members. These four members have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.  

Wahida is the group leader. She is married and has eight children: four sons and four daughters. She runs an embroidery business in her home. She has two years of experience in this business. Wahida wants to buy some necessary things for her embroidery business. 

Zakia, another member, has a tailoring business and with this loan, wants to buy more clothes for tailoring. Through her income, she supports her family members and her purpose of getting a loan is to expand her business. 

The third member, Frishta, wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a car-parts shop. With this loan, Frishta’s husband wants to expand his business.

The last member is Ziba, who wants to take a loan for her son. He also wants to buy some good materials for his car-parts shop and wants to start his business in a new way to support all of his family members.
 
They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy items for her embroidery business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vendor. She is divorced and the mother of five children, some of whom are in school. This 55-year-old woman lives with her children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. As a single parent, Ama works hard to be able to provide for the family. She prepares and sells a local dish called kenkey from corn dough. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. Ama sells on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for 15 years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Abiodu

texts.en:
Abiodu is a 30 year-old single mother with a two year-old child. She sells drinks and groceries to make a living. She is very friendly and hard working. She hopes to expand her business by having a supermarket in the future. She will use this loan to buy more soft drinks and groceries to sell.

Abiodu is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus 2 hermanos. Cada día trabaja y se esfuerza por ser una mejor persona y próspera.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la atención en un centro de llamadas telefónicas (locutorio) ubicado en una galería comercial, aunque no es propio ella se esmera por atender muy bien y hacer buenos clientes, ya que sabe que la clave del éxito es la buena atención. Trabaja de lunes a sábado, durante todo el día, y el sueldo que recibe le alcanza para poder ayudar en los gastos de su casa. Le gusta mucho este trabajo porque en la galería donde labora se ha hecho muchas amigas y además interactúa bastante con el público asistente. 
Paralelamente vende cosméticos de una marca reconocida, siendo sus amigas del trabajo sus principales clientes, esta actividad que le genera ingresos económicos adicionales y a pesar de su juventud tiene muchas aspiraciones para salir adelante, especialmente tener su propio centro de llamadas y ser independiente.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda obtener el crédito para concretar sus planes. Rosa tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de accesorios para celular, los cuales planea vender en el locutorio, pues se ha dado cuenta que tienen bastante demanda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old and lives in her parent’s house along with her two brothers. Every day she works and tries to become a better, successful person. For the past year she has earned a living in a “locutorio” which is an establishment containing a number of telephone booths for public use, located in a commercial shopping center. Even though she is not the owner, she takes great pains to attend to her customers as she knows that the key to success is customer service. She works all day Monday through Saturday and the salary she receives is used to help with household costs. She likes this work a lot because in the shopping center where she works she has made many friends and also interacts a lot with the public. In addition, she sells well-known cosmetics mostly to her friends at work. This activity generates supplementary income. As she is young, she has great aspirations to be successful and hopes one day to have her own “locutrio” and be independent. This is her third loan with MFP and she is very grateful for all the people who have made it possible for her to obtain loans and help her plans materialize. Rosa is thinking of using the loan to buy cellular phone accessories to sell in the “locutorio” as she has noted they are in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en:
Hezekiah sells bags of maize in Oyo state, Nigeria, where he lives with his family. He is a hardworking man and he is so determined to excel in his business and family life. 

He hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more bags of maize to sell. He hopes to expand his business. He is married with three children and is 50 years old. He hopes to give his children a quality education. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr: G. Tété est née le 14 Juin 1967 à Pobè dans le département de l'Ouémé. Tété vit depuis 25 ans au quartier Agbokou, dans le deuxième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à KOYE Noel, Tété est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Tété a un autre enfant à charge. Tété vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Tété n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis 24 ans environs, Tété mène comme activité la vente de fagots de bois au marché de Agbokou, une activité qui lui génère des revenus lui permettant d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. C'est à Adjarra, à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo, que Tété s'approvisionne. Tété est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Tété sollicite un autre prêt afin d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux faire face à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Tété G. was born 14 June 1967 in Pobé in the Ouémé Department. For the past 25 years she has lived in the Agbokou neighborhood, in the second borough of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Noel KOYE, Tete is mother of six children, who have all attended (or are attending) school. She herself has only attended school at the primary level. She also takes care of another child, and lives together with her husband and children. The couple shares responsibility for family expenses. Tete has been selling bundles of wood at the Agbokou market for approximately 24 years. This revenue-generating activity ensures her family’s needs are met. She gets her supplies from Adjarra, a few kilometers from Porto-Novo. Tete is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted two loans that were correctly reimbursed. Faced with increasing requests from her customers, she is applying for another loan so that she can increase her stock supply and better meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood bundles wholesale

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar P. J.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 29 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Oscar has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2009, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
