Francisco Javier S. de 31 años es artesano de calzado el cual aprendió este oficio en su juventud trabajando en distintos talleres lo cual le ayudo a perfeccionar su trabajo. Luego de ello se independizo y empezó a prestar para ir forjando su taller con mejores condiciones.
S. son el crédito compra materiales como cuero, cuerina, Brasil, plantillas, suelas, pegas, hilo etc. para fabricar sandalias y zapatos que su esposa lleva a comercializar.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier S. is 31 years old and a craftsman who makes shoes. He learned this profession in his youth by working at different shops which helped him to perfect his skills. Francisco later became independent and opened his own workshop that has better conditions.

He will use this loan to buy materials such as natural leather, synthetic leather, brazilwood, insoles, soles, adhesives, thread, and other items used in making sandals and shoes that his wife will sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
Maqbool is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years.

She is a very kind lady. She stays at home and manages the domestic chores efficiently. Her husband is involved in a livestock business. He purchases the animals, takes care of them and then sells them. Maqbool helps him by taking care of the animals. She gives them proper food and water.

They have two sons and three daughters. Their daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Their sons are drivers by profession and drive auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles) and generate income for the family.

Maqbool has successfully repaid two loans to Asasah. Now she is applying for the third time to purchase the animals to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase animals to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng Y., 29, is married and resides with her husband and two young children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of about USD $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD $5 per day.

Y. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Mam Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Ba Srae village in Takeo province, twelve people make up this bank loan group. Mrs. Sophea M. is it's president, selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Born in 1976, she is a farmer who owns one and a half-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family. But her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Sophea M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to rent a machine to plow her field. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Prak, is a teacher. She is a mother of five children, three of whom attend local public school, while the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Verónica; ella tiene 34 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo la socia  estudio Turismo en un instituto superior; ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes desde hace 5 años y está aprendiendo mucho, ella quiere poner su propia agencia de viajes y turismo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una ahorrar y comprar con ello una computadora. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "THREE MARIAS" communal bank. The associate lives in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The associate is Señora Veronica. She is 34 years of age and lives in a shared home. She has 1 son. The associate is studying tourism in the higher institute. She has worked in a travel agency for 5 years and she is learning a lot. She wants to open her own travel and tourism agency. The associate requests a loan to open an account to buy a computer. The associate very much appreciates the loan offered since this permits her to grow her business and to improve her quality of life. She promises to make the payments according to the specified schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open an account to buy a computer for her work in tourism

loans.name: Toetu

texts.en:
Toetu Leia F. is 34 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Toetu has 2 years of experience in this business.  Toetu needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Toetu joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Toetu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Akossiwa Epse Egban

texts.en: Madame Akossiwa Epse Egban A. is 55 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. Madame A. has been selling maize since 1983. Today she sells her products at the Akodessewa Market in Lome. Madame A. is married to a mechanic and they have 4 children. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES of 200,000 CFA in order to purchase more sacks of maize that she will sell retail to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Buularhan

texts.en:
Buularhan S. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 40 and married. She has three daughters and a son; the older daughter studies at university and the other children are at school. When the collective farms broke up in 1995, Buularhan and her husband were given 1.7 hectares of land, so they have been growing rice and tobacco for fifteen years. Buularhan earns 5,000 KGS per month selling part of the harvest. This profit made it possible for her to save money to purchase cattle for breeding. Buularhan wants to use the money received from this loan to purchase fertilizers for growing tobacco and to cover family expenses. In the future, she plans to increase the number of cattle, start selling dairy products and save money to contribute to her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo P. is from the village of Rizal. He is 43 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Bernardo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Bernardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Bernardo is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his 8th from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Minieta

texts.en:
Minieta P. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamis City. She is 45 years old, married, and has three adult children.

Minieta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business, selling a variety of products to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In January 2010, Minieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.

Minieta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Used to purchased additional products to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, es soltero, hombre de buen carácter y muy pasivo, vive en la casa de su madre.Desde muy joven trabajaba como chofer del carro de su hermano, y con el apoyo de él compro su carro. Hoy en día trabaja arduamente desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, brindando servicio de taxi a todos los transeúntes de la calle, es así que viene pagando  las letras de su carro y hasta ahora le va muy bien, por ello, las veces que su hermano le pide favor no duda en dársela. Lo que más le gusta de su oficio, es servir a la gente oportunamente y a veces le piden realizar carreras a lugares muy lejanos, siempre y cuando sea algún conocido. En adelante, aspira tener su propia empresa de servicio de taxi en su distrito. Es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, considerando éste crédito muy útil para el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de otras llantas y en el mantenimiento técnico. 







Es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, considerando éste crédito muy útil para el progreso de su negocio.
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de otras llantas y en el mantenimiento técnico.
texts.en:
Jorge is a single man of good character. He is very peaceful and lives in his mother's house. Since he was very young, he has worked as a driver in his brother's car; with his support, he bought his own car. Nowadays, he works arduously starting very early until late at night offering taxi services to the passersby on the street.  He has been making the payments on his car and so far it is going very well for him. Because of this, when his brother has asked him for a favor he hasn't hestitated to do it for him. What he likes the most about his profession is serving people in a timely manner and sometimes taking people to far away places, as long as he knows them.  In the future, he hopes to have his own taxi service business in his district. This is his fifteenth loan with MFP. He is committed to making his payments on time and considers this loan to be very useful for his business' progress. He will invest it in purchasing different tires and on technical maintenance.  







Es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, considerando éste crédito muy útil para el progreso de su negocio.
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de otras llantas y en el mantenimiento técnico.

loans.use: To purchase tires and for technical maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel tiene 52 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de plástico y ganando  ubicada en su humilde vivienda, es una persona muy luchadora pues siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar la condición de vida de su familia. Por lo que su producto lo obtiene del salvador, compra de contado y vende contado Pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación por lo que ha sido una cliente muy responsable. Se siente contenta con este nuevo financiamiento para la compra de mercadería necesaria. Ella tiene la meta de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 52 years old. She sells plastic from her humble home. She is a fighter who is always looking for a way to improve her family's quality of life. She obtains her product from El Salvador. She pays for it upfront and sells it for cash. This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan from the Foundation and she has been a very responsible client. She is happy with this new loan to buy necessary merchandise. Her goal is improving her living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Linah Auma

texts.en:
Linah Auma is an industrious, twenty eight year old lady from the Nyamasaria area of Kisumu City, along the shores of Lake Victoria. Linah is married to Caleb Otieno and they have two children.

To make ends meet, Linah runs a Video entertainment hall where she shows various movies/videos at a small fee. This kind of entertainment halls are popular in most parts of Kisumu city. She has been doing this for the last five years and the sky is the limit for her. She is taking her first loan from KADET Limited which she will use to buy additional seats for her video hall. With this investment, she hopes to accomodate more people and earn more income and alsoprovide comfort for her clientele. Linah will use part of the profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to one day open a big video shop and also open more shops in other parts of the city. She is therefore looking for a Kiva lender to make her dream come to a reality.

loans.use: To buy additional seats for her video shop

loans.name: Yuliana Madeline

texts.es:
Yuliana de 30 años, es comerciante informal de ropa, zapatos, artículos de hogar. Vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 9 y 7 años  en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ya que en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 
 
Vende pantalones, blusas, ropa interior. Trabaja sola en diferentes horarios desde las 08h00am, una de las dificultades para realizar las ventas es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde recorre para vender la ropa y artículos de hogar.  Mientras que ella vende ropa su esposo trabaja como chofer para poder solventar los gastos de la casa. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones y ropa interior para surtir más la ropa. En el futuro quiere tener un local en su casa para pasar más tiempo con sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en: Yuliana is 30 years old and is an informal merchant of clothing, shoes and household items. She lives with her husband and four children, ages 14, 12, 9 and 7, in an urban area called Orquídeas (Orchids) since when it was discovered there were many flowers, and today there is a park full of these flowers. Yuliana sells pants, blouses and undergarments. She works by herself on different schedules starting from 8 a.m. One of her difficulties in running her business is the crime in the area where she sells her items. While she is out selling clothes, her husband works as a taxi driver so they are able to cover household expenses. With the loan, Yuliana plans to purchase blouses, pants and undergarments to increase her stock of clothing. In the future she wants to run a store out of her home so she can spend more time with her children.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, plastic items

loans.name: Berlita

texts.en:
Berlita, 58 years old, is from the town of Bunawan. She is married and has 8 children. Berlita is engaged in farming and particularly plants rice crops. She has been farming for more than a few years already. She was also able to put up a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products. She says the store helps in their daily needs.

Berlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Berlita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Cita

texts.en: Cita E. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cita owns and operates a business providing karaoke services (where customers pay 5 pesos per song) and a billiard hall to local community members. Cita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Cita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. Cita is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the billiard table. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Cita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the billiard table

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María Del Carmen R. Valdez desde hace varios años quedo viuda, por lo que  tuvo que trabajar para poder sostener los gastos de la familia, con el tiempo la pensionaron por la edad lo cual recibe cada mes su dinero. Para tener un dinero extra vende ropa usada y artículos para el hogar desde hace 12 años, al que en este momento desea invertir, para que sus ventas sean incrementadas por la época navideña.
texts.en:
María Del Carmen R. Valdez was widowed several years ago.  She had to work to be able to cover the family expenses.  In time she retired due to age, and she receives money every month. 

In order to have extra money, she has been selling used clothes and household items for 12 years.

She now wants to invest in merchandise so that her sales will increase during the Christmas season

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Q. M., tiene 58 años, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Carlos Q. M., age 58, is married. He lives with his wife and their children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. He has 3 children.

The members of the Narcisa de Jesus Rural Bank are located in the vicinity of San Temistocles, a part of Ventanas Canton. This rural bank is dedicated to agricultural work in the short cycles of planting corn and rice.

Carlos is engaged in farming and plants corn and rice. He buys supplies and sells crops in Ventanas and the market in Peña. He sells out of his house or the Ventanas market every day.

He is applying for the loan so that he can plant corn by purchasing raw materials and seed. The loan will help him economically by supplying his necessities. He confronts challenges such as pests and diseases and variations in climate. His dream is to buy a farm. He likes to watch television.

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials and seed.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. is from the town of Trento. She is 39 years old and married. She has 5 children aged 21, 19, 18, 12 and 10. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Mary Ann dreams for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Akashi

texts.en:
Akashi is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

Akashi has operated a beauty salon for the past four years; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Akashi faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business and establish a hairdressing college in the future. Akashi want to use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase manicure equipment and a hair dryer. She decided to join Yehu because of the variety of helpful products provided.

loans.use: to purchase manicure equipment and a hair dryer

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine H. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia, in the village of Kamo.  She is a hard-working farmer who has been raising cattle for the past ten years.  With her high school education she has developed a business plan to expand her business and increase the family income.  She would like a loan to purchase additional cattle and expects her net profit to grow by twenty percent.  Karine is also a mother of four children – a twelve year old daughter and three sons (seventeen, twenty and twenty-two years old).  Karine and her husband wish to save enough money to provide their children with down payments on homes. She is content with her life in the village and enjoys being near her relatives.

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, 49 years old, is a married woman living in the town of Aurora, Agusan Del Sur. She has six children, some of whom are still going to school. Marieta is engaged in farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice for more than 10 years. Marieta works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

Marieta currently needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She requested to borrow PHP 8000, which she will use to fund her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Divino Maestro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Maestro está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras las cuales son  María del Socorro F. López, Juana Mercedes Ramírez y Auxiliadora  de Fátima M.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora F. quien desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante.
Ella invertirá en perfumes, tintes, cremas cosméticos…etc.
Mientras M. comercializa ropa usada en la que invertirá el crédito y R. desde hace un año tiene una pulpería; ella inicio haciendo helados, hielos y chocobanano actualmente vende granos básicos, gaseosa…etc. y además vende ropa en la que invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The Divino Maestro group is made up of three hard-working women: María del Socorro F. López, Juana Mercedes Ramírez and Auxiliadora de Fátima M..  The group's coordinator is Mrs F. who has been selling cosmetics door to door for six years.  She will invest her loan in buying perfumes, dyes, creams, cosmetics, etc.  

Mrs M. sells used clothing and this is what she will invest her loan in.  Mrs R. has owned a grocery store for one year.  She started out making ice creams, ice and chocolate-covered bananas.  She currently sells basic grains, soda, etc.  She also sells clothes and this is what she will invest her loan in.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Mr. Raot Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of ten members who will use their portions for different purpoS. to improve their businesS.. Mr. Raot, who was born in 1957, has been selected by the other members to be village bank president. He is a tailor who earns some income to support his family while his wife, Mrs. Nhorn, is a farmer who grows rice on a 1.5-hectare plot of land. They sell part of the rice crop and keep the rest to support their family. In the rice field, they face problems because the soil is infertile. So to improve the rice product, Mr. Raot is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. The couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for rice farming

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a hardworking mother of 4 children. She has 4 children who are between the ages of 2 and 19 years old. Rose used to sell a few food stuffs in a basket from place to place but due to the loans she receives form her MFI she now has a permanent place. She sells a variety of food stuffs including green bananas, sweet potatoes etc. From that business she bought a cow and a small house .She is requesting a loan to purchase more food stuffs and make more profits. She plans to save all her profits until she can build a family house.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a house that she owns, and which has has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees, and to help pay for them she went into the business of selling charcoal to her neighbors three years ago. She supplements the income she makes there by also selling mahamri (or dumplings). Her main challenges are the seasonal nature of her business and high transportation costs. But she continues to dream of expanding her businesses, and is applying for a loan for Kshs 40,000 to buy more charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chipenyo

texts.en:
Chipenyo is a married woman with nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 3 years, Chipenyo has been operating a business selling dry fish.  She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation because of the increase in fuel prices. Chipenyo dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 20,000,  Chipenyo wants to purchase more fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy more dry fish to sell

loans.name: Enkh-Amgalan

texts.en:
Enkh-Amgalan, 37, is a professional driver.  He lives with his wife, mother-in-law and two children, aged 12 and 15, in his mother-in-law’s small house, in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Both of his children attend public school. His wife works as a separator at a local cashmere factory, while his mother-in-law is a retired and she stays at home. 

Enkh-Amgalan worked as a driver at a local public transportation company from 2002 to 2008.  Since 2008, Enkh-Amgalan has been running a transportation business using his family minivan.  He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes which lacks bus services. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another second car, due to safety regulations for transportation.  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT to purchase the second car.

He said “I wants to improve my business and then to be able to buy my own house”

loans.use: To purchase second car

loans.name: Edjromigbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EDJROMIGBE 2 est formé de deux personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mouniratou, est celle se trouvant à gauche de la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mouniratou est mariée à un certain Raoul, mais n'a pas encore d'enfant. Il y a plus de dix ans que Mouniratou exerce comme activité, la vente de friperies et de cartes de recharges téléphoniques ; ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de participer aux charges du ménage. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mouniratou désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Mouniratou sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe EDJROMIGBE 2, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group EDJROMIGBE 2 is composed of two persons who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is called Mouniratou and is the woman standing on the left in the photo. It's the first time that this group has requested financial help from  ALIDé in order to raise the level of their activities. 

Mouniratou is married to Raoul, but has not got any children yet. For more than ten years, she has been selling used clothing and rechargeable telephone cards. That allows her to support herself and help with household expenses. Wishing to better respond to the demand of her clientele,  Mouniratou would like to add to her inventory. In order to do this, she is requesting, together with the other person in the EDJROMIGBE 2 group, her very first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and rechargeable telephone cards.

loans.name: Concepción De Jesús

texts.es: Concepción de Jesús de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee un taller de costura en su residencia que le ayuda a mantener a flote su hogar; la localidad es muy concurrida de personas y últimamente se ha hecho de mas clientela, Concepción es una excelente costurera las personas la prefieren por que tiene los mejores estilos, buena calidad en el trabajo además de el mejor servicio y precios accesibles;  es una mujer entregada a su labor para ella el éxito no es un destino es un viaje y está dispuesta a caminarlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor para seguir fabricando prendas y satisfacer la necesidad del cliente. Concepción de Jesús tiene la esperanza que se cumplirán sus objetivos y lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Concepcion de Jesus is fifty-five years old and she lives with her son in a house of her own. She has a sewing shop in her house and it helps her maintain her household afloat. She is highly visited in her locale and lately she has seen an increase in customers. Concepcion is an excellent seamstress and people prefer her because she carries the better styles, and produces good quality work. She also provides better service and accessible prices. She is a woman who is devoted to her work. For her, success is not at destination, but a journey and she is ready to walk. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and it will help her to purchase fabric in wholesale to keep producing articles of clothing and to satisfy the needs of her clients. Concepcion de Jesus hopes that she will meet her objectives and to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in wholesale.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es: La Sra., Ivonne esta  casada tiene un hijo, su esposo es chofer de camión de carga, realiza viajes a diferentes departamentos de Bolivia, lleva días en carretera por lo que la Sra. Ivonne la mayoría del tiempo esta solo con su hijo , la Sra. Tiene su tienda en lugar muy céntrico para sus ventas, atiende de lunes a domingo  tiene una tienda bastante surtida donde ofrece variedad de productos para regalos de fiestas, el préstamo lo invertirán para la compra de variedad de productos para su posterior comercialización y a si de esta forma incrementar su  capital de y trabajo, la Sra. es una persona trabajadora agradecida con  la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Ivonne is married and has a son. Her husband drives a cargo truck and travels to different parts of Bolivia. While he spends days on the road, Sra. Ivonne spends most of her time alone with her son. Ivonne has a store in a centralized area where she generates her sales. She manages it from Monday to Sunday and keeps it stocked with a variety of products used for party gifts.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of various products for eventual resale. This will help increase her operating capital. Sra. Ivonne is a hardworking individual who is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of gift items.

loans.name: Marata Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Mme Marata Elisabeth est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 50ans et le moins âgé a 26ans.01 va à l’école et elle a 13 personnes en charge.

Elle revend du dolo depuis 35ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de kouritenga.Ses clients sont ses voisins, ses amis, et toute personne qui fréquente son cabaret.

Mme veut s’acheter 05 canaris de dolo.

Elle aide à entretenir ses petits fils avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne se doter d’une parcelle pour préparer elle-même son dolo.
texts.en: Ms. Marata Elisabeth is a widow and the mother of four children. The eldest is 50 years old, and the youngest is 26. One of them goes to school. Marata has thirteen persons to support. She has been a retailer of dolo (a type of beer made from millet or sorghum) for 35 years. She gets her supplies at the Kouritenga market. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and anyone who comes to the cabaret.   Marata wants to buy five dolo jars. With her profits, she helps take care of her grandchildren. Her ambition is to gain a plot of land for making the dolo herself.

loans.use: to buy five 'dolo' jars

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Мамлакат  честная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 5 детей. Её муж является трудовой мигрантом в России. Более 8 лет Мамлакат занимается купля продажей детской одежды и у неё богатый опыт. Она хорошо знает в узкие стороны своего бизнеса. Она мечтает о том, что когда то она расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальной прибыли. Мамлакат хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она хотела бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки подростковой школьной одежды. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mamlakat is an honest and trustworthy person. She is married and the loving mother of five. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. For over eight years, Mamlakat has been working as a reseller of children’s clothing, and so she has a lot of experience. She knows all about the finer aspects of her business. Her goal is to expand her business one day and eventually to maximize her profits. Mamlakat would like to expand her business. She would like to obtain a loan of 3,000 USD in order to stock up on school uniform for teenagers. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to stock up on school uniform for teenagers.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; ella es casada y tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende tomates,zanahorias,pepinos,lechugas entre otras verduras, la socia vende en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 3:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m y los días domingos lleva a lugares como los mercados de San Sebastian,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor como tomates, zanahorias y lechugas.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de maíz.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Juntos Podemos” (Together We Can) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

Jesusa, 43, is the member.  She’s married and has four children.  She works in her business selling vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, carrots, cucumbers and lettuce, among other vegetables.  She sells in Huancaro market from 3am until 5pm and on Sundays goes to such places as the San Sebastian markets.  Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the business selling vegetables and is asking for a loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, carrots and lettuce at wholesale.  The other group members sell crafts, vegetables, fruit, groceries and corn.  The member thanks those who share her dream and commits to make her payments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
la sra. Clorinda tiene 48 años de edad y cuenta con puesto de venta de verduras ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus productos los compra a los diferentes agricultores locales y otros que le visitan desde la ciudad de Danlí, con las ganancias que le genera dicha actividad cubre las necesidades y obligaciones que tiene en su hogar, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, 2 los cuales estudian en centros educativos públicos del municipio de las Trojes.     
La Sra. Clorinda utilizara el credito para la compra de verduras para surtir su negocio, este tipo de alimentos se vende muy bien ya que son saludables y muy sabrosos, casi todas las personas de esta comunidad comen verduras en el almuerzo y la cena.
texts.en:
Sra. Clorinda is 48 years old and manages a vegetable stand at her home. She buys her products from different farmers in the area and others who visit from the city of Danlí. With the earnings she generates, Clorinda is able to provide for her needs and meet the household obligations. She is a single mother with four children, two of whom are studying at schools in the town of Las Trojes.

Sra. Clorinda will use this loan to buy vegetables to restock her business. This type of food sells very well because it is healthy and quite flavorful. Almost every person in her community eats vegetables for lunch and dinner.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, onions, green chiles, lemons, carrots, cabbages, lettuce, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 31 and married with four children aged between 9 and 3 years. She has been in active farming for four years, producing eggs and vegetables for the local market.

Jane has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds for her business. She had previously acquired two loans of 25,000 KES and 50,000 KES and paid them promptly. She says the boosted poultry business will enable her to educate her four children.

She praises Juhudu Kilimo for the loan services and is focused on repaying the loan like the previous ones.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 34 años de edad es casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, platica la señora que ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lencería por catalogo desde hace 3 años dice que empezó con este negocio por que una amiga la invito y vio que si tenia buenas ganancias y eso la motivo a seguir adelante con este negocio. Comenta que a diario sale a vender a sus conocidas y gente que tiene negocios estables o tiene trabajos estables ya que vende subproductos en pagos. Juana esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de más productos que ella vende como Cremas, perfumes, lencería, cosméticos etc. la meta que tiene Juana es comprar mas productos para así tener un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, is married and has three dependent children.  She comments that she sells cosmetics and lingerie via catalogue.  She started this business three years ago because a girlfriend invited her and she saw that she earned good profits so she was motivated to stay in this business.   

She comments that she goes out every day to sell among her acquaintances and people who have stable businesses or steady jobs because she sells her products on credit with payment plans.  

Juana is asking for a loan to buy more products that she sells like creams, perfume, lingerie, cosmetics, etc.  Juana’s goal is to buy more products in order to earn a bit more profit.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Diwani

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Diwani works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Diwani is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture making business.

Diwani has sustained her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to achieve her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Fanny; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos. La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas,ella ya no se dedica al ngeocio de venta de papa helada poruqe no le da mucha ganancia,ella hace engordar y crecer a los animales y luego lo vende en los diferentes mercados,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como cuyes y gallinas al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower is Fanny. She is 38 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three children. She continues her business breeding animals like guinea pigs and hens. She no longer sells frozen potatoes because it wasn't very profitable. She feeds and raises animals for later resale at various markets. She works form 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She wants to grow and improve her animal breeding business. She is asking for a loan to buy animals like guinea pigs and hens in quantity. 

Fanny is thankful for the support given to her, and she is committed to repaying her loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy animals like guinea pigs and hens in quantity.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is from the village Zeda Sazano, West Georgia. She is 61 years old. Eter lives alone. She earns her living through agricultural activities. In particular, she owns two milk cows. She uses milk for cheese production and sells cheese in the village. Along with the dairy farm, Eter owns one hectare of land of which 0.4 hectare is used for maize growing. On the remaining 0.6 hectares of land, Eter grows vines. She sells harvested maize and grapes locally in the village. Her total average income is 180 Laris per month. 

Although Eter works hard during the whole day, her income is still not enough to save money for house renovation. Her house is already old, in bad condition and needs renovation. Eter has requested credit for the renovation of her house. This will allow her to improve her living conditions and enjoy a well-deserved rest in the evening hours, after hard work during the daytime.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Apollonga Atieno

texts.en: Apollongo Atieno is 53 years old, married, and has five children who range in age from 15 to 26. She runs a metal shop where she has sold windows, doors, and gates to new and frequent customers for the last ten years. She has one employee. The business faces the problem of fluctuations in the prices of metals. She wants a loan of KES 80,000 to buy materials for welding. In the future, Apollongo wants to be a supplier of welding materials. She describes herself as patient and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy more materials for welding.

loans.name: B

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié et père de 3 enfants dont 2 élèves.Il vend des produits ménagers dans son quartier. Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille .Il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 100 bassine, 100 seaux et 60 marmites. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man and father of 3 children, two of whom are students. He sells household products in his neighborhood. The earnings generated by his work allow him to provide for his family. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy 100 washtubs, 100 buckets and 60 pots. His goal is to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy 100 washtubs, 100 buckets and 60 pots

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: La señora María Dolores a sus 46 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 11 años, se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a la actividad de engorde de pollos y cerdos, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y es la que le permite generar los ingresos para su hogar. La señora María Dolores requiere de la compra de pollos y cuido que le permita suplir la demanda de fin de año y a su vez aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora María Dolores es construir la vivienda para sus pollos mucho más grande y darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores is 46 years old and mother of an 11-year-old son. She has spent most of her life fattening up pigs and chickens, which she learned from her mother and which allows her to earn income for her household. Maria Dolores needs to buy chickens and feed in order to fill the end-of year demand while at the same time increasing her income and improving her family's quality of life. 

Maria Dolores's dream is to build a much larger coop for her chickens and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: Buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Valencia - 26 Gpo. Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario esta conformado por tres componentes Katherine, Marina y Deyvi, la señora marina se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños vive en la casa de sus papas con sus dos hijas el esposo se fue a la republica de Argentina a buscar un futuro mejor para sus hijas, el destino del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de ropa al por mayor por esta época de navidad ya que tiene mucha venta, Deyvi es cerrajero tiene su taller en la ciudad de el alto y vive con su hermana en la zona de el Tejar, con el dinero del crédito comprar equipo de sonido.  Katherine se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio de la zona del Tejar el crédito esta destinado a la compra de víveres, todos son personas responsables y trabajadoras agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three members: Katherine, Marina, and Deyvi.

Sra. Marina sells children’s clothing. She lives at her parents’ house with her two daughters. Her husband went to Argentina in search of a better future for their children. Her loan will be used to buy clothing in bulk for the Christmas season since she has many sales during this time.

Deyvi is a locksmith who has his own shop in El Alto, where he lives with his sister in the District of El Tejar. The money from his loan will be used to buy sound equipment.

Katherine sells food from her home in the District of El Tejar. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients.

All of these individuals are responsible and hardworking. They are grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
Leonardo a sus 45 años de edad es responsable de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su esposa y su hijo de 14 años de edad, el cual desea continuar sus estudios hasta hacerse profesional.

El dedica desde hace varios años a la reparación de bicicletas desde su casa, pero ya lleva dos años en un pequeño local, independiente de su vivienda, desde el cual no solo se dedica a prestar dicho servicio, sino también a la venta de bicicletas.

Con el crédito el quiere adquirir más insumos para la reparación de bicicletas, para poder atender las diversas necesidades de su clientela.

Sueña con tener un negocio más grande, con mayor y mejor surtido, que le permita llegar a un mayor número de clientes, y a la vez mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonardo, 45 years old, is responsible for generating the income necessary for the support of his wife and 14 year old son, who wants to continue his schooling to become a professional.

He has been repairing bicycles from his home for several years.  For the last two years he has been doing this in a small shop, away from his home, where he not only provides repair service but also sells bicycles.

With this loan, he wants to acquire supplies for the repair of bicycles and be able to meet the varied needs of his customers.

He dreams of having a larger business, with more and a better selection, which will allow him to reach a greater number of customers.  This will both increase his income and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his bicycle shop.

loans.name: Agripino

texts.es: Agripino de 36 años de edad, está casado con Dida de 36 años, fruto de este gran amor tienen 3 hijos con los que viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Tarancato del distrito de Pichari. Agripino es un reconocido y respetado agricultor, quien tiene más de 18 años cultivando café. Nos comenta que durante su trayectoria como agricultor, muchas veces fue azotado por las inclemencias del mal tiempo donde varias cosechas fueron dadas por perdidas, pero supo salir adelante y continuo sembrando café en otras parcelas, de las que ahora cosehca una buena producción. Él está feliz  por los logros que viene obteniendo hasta el momento, dice en un futuro quisiera tener una tienda de agroquímicos, ya que este negocio esta siendo rentable en esta parte del país, por el que Agripino no cesa de trabajar hasta lograr su objetivo. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Agripino agradece  a su banco comunal por haber permitido formar parte de ellos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de abono para fertilizar su terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Agripino, age 36, is married to 36 year old Dida.  They have three children with whom they live in their own house.  The house is in the Tarancato community in the Pichari district.  Agripino is an established and respected farmer.  

He has been growing coffee for over 18 years.  During his time as a famer he has often been hit by the harshness of bad weather.  Several harvests were lost.  However, he knows how to get ahead and continue planting coffee on other fields, from which he now harvests a good production.

He is happy about what he has achieved and is getting so far.  In the future he would like to have an agrochemical store because this business is profitable in this part of the country. Agripino does not stop working until he achieves his objective.

This will be his first loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his payments on time.  Agripino is grateful to his communal bank for allowing him to be part of them.  He will use the 1,000 soles to buy manure to fertilize his farm land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeu is in three businesses: rice husbandry, pig-raising and the rice trading business, whereas her husband is a rice farmer as well as a fisherman. She has five children, three of whom live together in Pouk district, while the other two are working as laborers in a neighbor country.

With the sum of $1,000, Oeu will buy two head of buffalo for her farming project. For her future prospects, she wishes to expand her rice-selling store to attract more clients to buy her rice produce.

loans.use: to buy two head of buffalo for her farming project.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 24 years old and married with one child. 

He runs a hardware shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for one year and employs three people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tiles to sell.

loans.use: to buy tiles to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and lives in San Antonio, Ozamiz City. She is married with three school-aged children. 

Lorna has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 4 months. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

location.town: Ozamis-San Antonio, Ozamis City, Mis. Occidental

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
Ugiloy is the perfect business lady. She knows all aspects of business very well. Her experiences always help to her to be the best among her competitors. 

She has two businesses, with which she helps her children and her husband. The first and main is selling food products. The second is keeping livestock, which she has done for 30 years.

Ugiloy wants to develop her business, and that’s why she is asking a loan for buying livestock. She is awaiting your help.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a country woman, and mother of 9 children. She has had to go through a lot of adversity in her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to get ahead, and to continue progressing with her family. She is a wise farmer, whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. Jane farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past 20 years she has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Jane has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making a profit selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Jane mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy another motorbike. Jane is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge which has caused her to suffer many losses. Perishable products, such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market in order to fetch a high price. Through this loan, Jane is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Jane feels relieved to know that there are institutions, such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Jane will never suffer losses due to delay in the delivery of her produce to the market. She will also increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. This will provide her with increased income. Jane is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone who will ride the motorbike and help with farm work. With your loan, Jane will improve her living conditions, and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future. Support a hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: To buy another motorbike to deliver products to the market

loans.name: Van Tha

texts.en:
C. Van Tha is 37 years old and he works as a motor taxi driver in the city. He typically earns about $3.75 a day. His wife sells rice in the market and earns about $3 per day. C. Van Tha and his wife have two daughters and one son. Their oldest daughter works in a factory and earns about $60 per month. Their younger daughter attends school, and their young son stays at home. 

C. Van Tha is requesting a loan of $700. He would like to use $500 of the loan to change his motor bike into a motor bike that pulls a passenger cart, called a tuk tuk. The tuk tuk can hold more people, which allows for a potential increase in income. He would like to use the other $200 to make repairs on their home. 

After he is able to finish paying off this loan, C. Van Tha would like to borrow again to help his oldest daughter set up a stand in the market. She would like to have a stand where she can sell clothing, and would much rather do this than work in the factory. C. Van Tha is excited about the opportunities that this loan will provide to him and his family, and is happy to be able to increase his business and repair his home.

loans.use: Change motorbike into tuk tuk, and repair home

loans.name: Rohamah

texts.en: Rohamah is married with two children ages 21 and 9. Having a small store that provides various snacks and household goods is Rohamah’s business. She has requested her second loan from MBK for $75. This loan will be used for buying more goods for her store. The profit earned from her store is primarily used to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.en:
Norma is married and she has five children, the oldest of whom is 38 and the youngest 23. Her husband is an employee at a company, and with five children the household expense is very high and her husband's salary is insufficient. For that reason, she looked for work, but nobody hired her, so she decided to open her own business in her home with a minimal investment, taking advantage of the family's experience because her relatives knew the business. Little by little her business has been improving, and she has been able to help with the economic sustenance of the family. They have been able to continue little by little educating their children and offering them the necessities like food and clothing.

At present, Norma is requesting a loan for the amount of $750 for the purchase of equipment for her business, and also for working capital. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. This will help her to offer better service to her customers, to have more stock, and to offer a variety of products that are much in demand in her business. She thanks you very much for the support you offer, which will help her get ahead and improve her quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Norma esta casada y tiene cinco hijos, el mayor tiene 38 años de edad y el menor 23, su esposo es empleado de una empresa y con cinco hijos el gasto familiar es muy alto y el sueldo de su esposo es insuficiente, por ello, ella buscó empleo pero nadie la contrataba, por ello decidió abrir su propio negocio en su domicilio con una mínima inversión, ya que contaba con la experiencia familiar por que sus familiares conocían el negocio. Poco a poco ha ido mejorando con su negocio y con ello poder ayudar en el sustento económico de su familia y han podido poco a poco ir educando a sus hijos y brindarles las necesidades básicas como alimentación y vestido.

Actualmente, Norma está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para la compra de equipo para su negocio, así como también para capital de trabajo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, esto le ayudará a brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener un mayor stock y variedad de productos que se demandan mucho en su negocio. Agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para sacar salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To acquire equipment

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Ms Amalia S. is 49 years old and married with three children. Her husband owns a carpentry shop in their home that provides an income to sustain the family. Their three children attend a public high school in the city. They also help their mother and father with their businesses.

Amalia has always been a self-starter. She started her own business selling clothes door-to-door. After some years of saving, she was able to start a small business in the city's municipal market where, today, she owns a butcher shop.

Work is going very well, but she has hopes of developing the business. She hopes to acquire meat in larger quantities, in this way she can receive important discounts and also offer a greater variety of product. To acquire these larger quantities, she asks for a loan of 400 dollars, which she pledges to pay off.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amalia S., tiene 49 años ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su marido tiene una carpintería en su casa que les proporciona ingresos para el sustento D. la familia; sus tres hijos están estudiando, ellos asisten a un colegio público D. la ciudad, no obstante ellos también ayudan a su madre y a su padre en sus oficios.

Amalia siempre fue una mujer muy emprendedora, ella empezó vendiendo ropa D. forma ambulante; luego D. unos años D. ahorro pudo montar su microempresa en el mercado municipal D. la ciudad, donD. hoy día es dueña D. una carnicería.

A ella le va muy bien con su negocio, por lo que tiene deseos D. seguir ampliándolo, para ello ella desea adquirir carne D. los frigoríficos al por mayor, pues D. esta manera consigue importantes descuentos y también más variedad en sus productos, el monto que necesita es D. $ 400 y se compromete a devolverlos mensualmente.

loans.use: To purchase cow meat in large quantity

loans.name: Herlina

texts.id:
Herlina is a mother of two. In order to take care off her children and to add to the income of the family everyday, she has started selling food at a snack bar. She has diligently occupied herself with this work since before she was married, knowing how to cook many things. Herlina is very confident with her abilities. The borrowed capital which she would receive from DINARI will be used by Herlina to renovate her snackbar, aka the building, so that it can be bigger and the seating capacity will be greater. With her loan of 500,000 Rupiah, Herlina can earn 60,000 to 80,000 Rupiah in profit per day, and from those gains, Herlina will be able to add to the needs of her family every day, and also to the needs of her children's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Herlina adalah ibu dari dua orang anak, untuk menghidupi anak-anaknya dan menambah perekonomian keluarga setiapharinya Ia berjualan Makanan dengan membuka warung makan. Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak belum menikah maklum dalam hal masak-memasak Herlina sangat senang dengan bakatnya ini. Pinjaman modal yang diterima dari DINARI digunakan oleh Herlina untuk merenovasi warungnya alias rumahnya sehingga bisa lebih besar dan daya tampung pelanggan lebih banyak. Dengan modal 500.000 rupiah Herlina bisa meraup keuntungan 60.000 – 80.000 rupiah/harinya dan dari keuntungannya itu Herlina bisa memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarga setiapharinya dan juga kebutuhan pendidikan anak-anaknya.

loans.use: To renovate her food stand and buy cooking ingredients - untuk merenovasi warung makan dan membeli bahan makanan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola belongs to the Community Bank "La Familia", and lives in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 54, a single mother to one son, who she adores and who is the most valuable thing God has granted her. Her income was not enough, however, so Lola, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, decided to invest in the purchase of toys for the Christmas holidays, Christmas decorations and clothing for women and men.

She currently sells clothing and accessories for Christmas decorations from her home, where her clients come to buy products since they trust her good taste in what she sells.

With a loan from Manuel Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy clothing for men, women and children, as well as save part of it for an emergency. As she says...a cautious woman is worth twice as much.

Lola is very content to be part of Manuel Ramos and very grateful for the advice and guidance she received from them. They have been great friends and guides who have known how to teach her well.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lola pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Familia”, vive en Jr. Alfredo Eglinton 171, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo que es su vida y su adoración, lo más valioso que Dios le dio en esta vida, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza, es así que Lola, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos decidió invertir en la compra de juegos para fiestas navideñas, adornos navideños y en ropa para damas y caballeros.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios para decoraciones navideñas en su misma casa, donde llegan sus clientas para adquirir sus productos ya que confían en el buen gusto que tiene Lola con sus productos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropa al por mayor (para damas, caballeros y niños), además tiene la costumbre de ahorrar para alguna emergencia que pueda presentarse, ella dice que........ mujer cauta vale por dos.

Lola está muy contenta por pertenecer a Manuela Ramos, además agradecida de los consejos y la asesoría que recibió de sus promotoras de crédito, las que fueron grandes amigas y guías que supieron orientarla bien.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 38-year-old Amina M.. She is married with two children, aged 14 and 17.

In 2000, Amina established a catering business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional ingredients in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her catering business in bulk.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. P. has sold fish in Preak Ho Market for over 20 years and her husband is a construction worker. They have been married since 1985 and have eight children; six sons and two daughters. Both daughters work in the garment factory and the sons are in school. They live about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Even though Mrs. P. and her husband were not able to finish primary school, they are friendly and clever in their business.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $800 to buy a motorbike for her husband so he can drive her to the market and drive himself to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Maria Pilar's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Maritza and Edilbert have been members of a communal bank, "Musuq Rumi" which means "New Stone" in Quechua (a tribal name and language of some native Latin Americans) for 3, 2, and 3 years, respectively.

Here, they learned to save, be punctual, invest their money and take care of their children.

Maria is a citizen, 24 years old, and has 2 children. Maria knits beautiful sweaters. She makes her pieces with her hands and with a weaver that she bought 1 year ago. She sells her pieces to stores.

Next to Maria is Maritza, who is 28 and married with 2 children. Maritza has a store where she sells grocery items and vegetables. The store is located in her mother's home. In addition, Maritza sells clothes for the military.

Meanwhile, Edilberta is married, 52, and has 4 children. She knits sweaters and satchels by hand. Her pieces are sold to families, neighbors and at stores.

Maria, Martiza, and Edilberta need a loan of 200 soles, 400 soles, and 400 soles, respectively. The loans will be used to invest in wool, linen, caps, polos.

Their savings will be used for their children's education. Their dreams are that their businesses will grow, their children will become professionals, they will be able to buy some land and have their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Maria, Maritza y Edilberta pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Musuq Rumi” que significa “Nueva Piedra” en quechua, hace 3, 2, 3 años respectivamente.

En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser puntuales, como invertir el dinero y como tratar a los hijos.

Maria es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Maria teje bellas chompas, sus trabajos lo hace a mano y también con una maquina de tejer que fue adquirida hace 1 año, sus productos lo vende a tiendas.

Por otro lado Maritza es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Maritza tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, ubicada en casa de su mama. Además Maritza vende ropa para militares a crédito.

Mientras que Edilberta es casada, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Edilberta teje chompas y carteras a mano, sus productos los vende a familiares, vecinos y también a tiendas.

Maria, Maritza y Edilberta necesitan un préstamo de 200 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, hilos, gorras, polos.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán en los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Maria, Maritza y Edilberta son que sus negocios sean mas grandes, que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar un terreno y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Maria, Maritza and Edilberta need loans of 200 soles, 400 soles, and 400 soles, respectively, to buy more linen, wool, caps, and polos.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.en:
Rosa Elia is 46 years old. She has two children, ages 16 and 20. Her husband, Arnoldo, works as a taxi driver. Four years ago, Rosa was worried about her family, because her husband's increases weren't enough to support the family. Rosa is an enterprising woman, and she decided to make some handcrafted articles for home-interior decoration. After that she learned how to make some handcrafted jewelry. This was just one year ago, but this business is giving the family more money. Now she has started to teach others how to make what she makes, so she has also become a teacher.

In order to have more merchandise she needs a loan of $475. With your help, she will buy some merchandise to make more products and increase her clientele. She promises to repay in six months. You can be part of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Villa Florida Group

texts.en:
“Villa Florida” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Villa Florida” is located at approximately 3,500 meters above sea-level, in the community of Huanchos, in the district of Paucarbamba, province of Churcampa. The main activities of the population are the growing of corn, potatoes and wheat, and also raising cows, bulls and sheep. In the small town the population have some shops and proviD. several services.
