loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos aún estudiando.  Julia solo estudió la primaria.
Junto a su esposo, la señora se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacunos, ovinos, también se dedica a venta de granos de la Región como quinua y cañihua.
Hace poco que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  ella requiere un préstamo de   S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que utilizará para comprar tres arrobas de quinua, cañihua para venderlo en Ilo.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien trabaja haciendo transporte en mototaxi en Puno.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y abastecerla con todos los insumos necesarios.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medallion) located in the Pomata district in Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is 38-years-old, married, and has four children who are still in school.  Julia only attended primary school.  Alongside her husband, she works raising animals such as cattle and sheep and also works selling grains from the region like quinoa and cañihua (a nutritious grain closely related to quinoa).  

A little while ago she worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement.  She needs a loan for 300 nuevo soles.  This is money that she will use to buy three sackfuls (11.5 kilograms each) of quinoa and cañihua to sell in Ilo.  In the business her children help her and her husband, who works with a mototaxi in Puno, helps her also.

What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans.

loans.use: to buy three sackfuls (11.5 kilograms each) of quinoa and cañihua (a nutritious grain closely related to quinoa).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a single parent taking care of one child. She has been through junior high school. Victoria displays toffees, biscuits, Milo (cocoa powder) and other types of provisions on a table for sale. Victoria will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy, age 47, is a married woman who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house, and the other two are attending school. 

To make a living, Mrs. Tuy has run a small business by selling some fresh fish which she gets from her husband fishing and also buy from other domestic fisherman in low price.   
From this business activity, the humble couple can earn around $4 per day to use in the daily expenses. Mrs. Tuy will be using a loan to purchase some plank for construction a new wooden house. With this loan, Mrs. Tuy said that she is very grateful to all lenders that support her family so she can use some loan fund to add with her current saving to build a new house.

For her future plan, She will buy a new boat to assist her husband business, to purchase build a bigger house and the most important thing, Mrs. Tuy hopes to use most of her income to support her children to finish at least high school level.

loans.use: to purchase some plank for construction a new wooden house.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Judith  es una mujer D. 48 años D. edad, ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Las Hormiguitas “la cual la integran 08 personas   entre hombres y mujeres, responsables y trabajadoras.
Judith se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, ese negocio comenzó gracias a que una  amiga le motivo para iniciar su propio negocio, poco a poco y con su carisma Judith ha podido captar  más clientes y D. ese modo ha mejorado sus ganancias. Judith  es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo el cual ha sido su motivación para seguir adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo Judith ha apoyado en su educación y mejorar su vivienda. Con  el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para invertir en sus productos comprando talco, colonias, cremas entre otros productos. A futuro Judith le gustaría tener restaurante donD. ofrezca variedades D. platos.
texts.en:
Judith’s a 48-year-old woman that belongs to the “Las Hormiguitas” (Little Ants) communal bank which has 8 members, both men and women, who are responsible and hardworking.

Judith sells beauty products, a business she started thanks to a girlfriend who motivated her to start her own business.  Little by little and with her charisma, Judith has managed to secure more customers thus improving her profits.  

Judith has a spouse and a son who is her motivation to continue forward.  Thanks to Judith’s efforts she is helping with his education and to improve her house.  With the goal of continuing to grow she is asking for a new loan to invest in her products buying talc, cologne and creams, among other products.  In the future, Judith would like to have a restaurant offering a variety of dishes.

loans.use: to buy creams, talc and perfume.

loans.name: Selvin Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Selvin Mauricio se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de transporte (taxi) y en su casa tiene una pulpería en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, su pulpería es atendida por un familiar mientras el todo los días sale desde muy temprano a la calle a buscar clientes que llevar en su taxi.
Selvin utilizara el credito para compra de computadora de su carro, tiene problemas con la misma y el carro esta fallando, en estos momentos lo tiene parado y no puede estar sin percibir esas ganancias ya que son las que utiliza para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Selvin Mauricio been in the taxi transportation business for four years. He has a grocery store in his house where he sells all sorts of household goods. His family runs the store while he goes out early every day looking for passengers to taxi. 

Selvin plans to use his loan to buy a computer for his car because his has problems and the car is breaking down. At this point the car is not working and Selvin can't be without the income because he needs it to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a car computer.

loans.name: Pancha Laxmi

texts.en:
Pancha Laxmi is 42 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 26, 22, and 21.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Pancha Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene como actividad la venta D. dulces, refrescos, chocolates otros en su kiosco que esta ubicado dentro D. las instalaciones D. una institución publica del departamento D. La Paz, esta actividad la desarrolla D. lunes a viernes, constituyéndose en la principal fuente D. ingreso para ella y su familia que esta compuesta por ella y sus dos hijas, solamente son tres personas  ya que su esposo falleció hace dos años, cuenta la Sra. Martha que la perdida D. su esposo fue un golpe para ella pero supo salir adelante por el bienestar D. sus hijas, el destino del crédito es para la compra D. material D. construcción para la construcción  D. una habitación en la casa donD. vive ya que será para su hija  mayor que próximamente contraerá matrimonio, la Sra. Martha es un dedicada a sus hijas a pesar D. su trabajo siempre vela por su bienestar, ella es muy trabajadora y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha has a business selling candy, soft drinks, chocolates, and other items from a kiosk located next to the facilities of a public institution in the Department of La Paz. She operates her business from Monday through Friday. It is the main source of income for herself and her family, which consists of Martha and her two daughters. There is only the three of them because her husband died two years ago. The loss of her husband was a huge blow to Martha, but she has been able to move forward for the sake of her daughters’ welfare.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials for building a room in the house where she lives. It will be for her older daughter who is getting married soon. Sra. Martha is very dedicated to her daughters despite having to work constantly to proviD. for their welfare. She is extremely hardworking and shows her appreciation for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room for her daughter.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, a 40-year-old married mother of six children, two of whom attend school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling RTW clothing in the Philippines for eight years. Now requesting  a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like pants, blouses, shoes etc. to sell, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like pants, blouses, shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jhannina Jhaqueline

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhannina es socia del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, vive  en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  desde diciembre de 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy amable, gentil y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Jhannina tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 14 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo  labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Jhannina es consultora en la venta de productos Yanbal, actividad en la que lleva 4 años, trabaja 4 días a la semana sin un horario fijo. También trabaja para su hermana en la entrega de dulces a diferentes lugares, lleva un mes en esta actividad. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal.
 
Su meta es comprarse un terreno y sacarles adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhannina is a member of the Emprendedores del Futuro Communal Bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has named a World Heritage Trust site in December of 1999.  The city has great architectural and natural beauty, and its friendly, kind, and warmhearted people preserve the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Jhannina is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 19, 15, and 14 and who go to school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a builder.  They own the home they live in.

Jhannina is a sales consultant for Yanbal products.  She has been doing this for four years, working four days a week without a set schedule.  She also works for her sister delivering candy different places.  She has been doing this for one month.

This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank and she plans to use her loan to buy Yanbal brand cosmetics.

Her goal is to buy land and get her children ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal brand cosmetics

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a business-lady who runs a beauty salon.  Her husband runs a taxi business.  She used her previous loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair dryer.  Since then, she has been able to provide her services more efficiently. She has also added one employee to assist her in her business.

Damaris has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair blow dryer and chairs.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer and chairs

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and one school-aged child. She has been working as a hairdresser and beautician from her home since 2006. She is much endowed at her work and has her loyal customers. As for her husband, he has been working as a salesman in a local company for the past seven years to supplement the family’s income. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a variety of cosmetics and hairdressing supplies so that she can comply with the demands of her customers. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with five children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the other three have completed school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Mwanatumu has operated as a small scale farmer keeping farm animals and also crop farming for the past ten years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 90,000 she wants to purchase a motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es: La señora Luz Mery a sus 44 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia y tiene de dos hijos de 26 y 15 años de edad. Es propietaria de una pequeña tienda la cual pudo adquirir gracias a un primo quien le presto el dinero para comprar surtido para su negocio. La tienda le permite a la señora Luz Mery obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. La señora Luz Mery requiere de la compra de surtido tal como granos, aceites, detergentes y productos de aseo personal, que le permitan mejorar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Luz Mery es brindarle educación a sus hijos y tener su tienda bien surtida y con muchos clientes.
texts.en: Luz Mery is 44 years old and is a single mother with two children, who are 26 and 15 years old. She owns a small store, which she was able to purchase thanks to a cousin who lent her the money to buy various products for her business. The store allows Luz Mery to earn enough income to support her household. Luz Mery needs to buy a variety of products like grains, oil, detergent and personal hygiene products, which will allow her to improve her sales as well as her family's quality of life. Luz Mery's dreams are to provide her children with an education, to offer a wide variety of products in her store, and to have many customers.

loans.use: buy a variety of products like grains, oil, detergent and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Yony; continua con su negocio de elaboración de pan para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes, la socia compra diferentes productos para la elaboración y fabricacion de de los panes productos como manteca, harina, azucar, levadura, el pago del horno y ella misma los elabora, la socia desea continuar su negocio y poder enviar los panes a la selva de perú donde tienen gran acogida; la socia en esta ocasión desea el credito para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.
texts.en: Yony continues with her business of making bread and distributing it to her customers. She buys different products for making and the bread, such as shortening, flour, sugar, yeast, and pays for use of the oven. She makes the breads herself. She wants to continue in her business and send the breads to the jungle in Perú, where they get a very favorable reception. This time she would like the loan so she can buy ingredients for making her breads.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Luis Javier; el tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares, el socio tiene un stand  en un  centro comercial del Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y accesorios para celulares.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Javier belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Ccoyllorty Cachimayo" located in the district of Cachimayo, in the Anta province and the department of Cusco.  
 
Señor Luis Javier is 23 years old and single.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling cell phones and cell phone accessories.  He has a stand in a shopping mall in Cusco.  He works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm.  He wants to get ahead through this business.  His dream is to expand and improve his business selling cell phones and accessories.  He is requesting a loan to buy cell phones and cell phone accessories.   

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: purchase cell phones and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Edilberto está casado con la Sra. Ilda  hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos menores que aun están en la escuela primaria.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en Ciudad del Este. Se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como empleados. Gracias al trabajo que están realizando  educan a sus hijos y le dan el sustento diario. El Sr. Edilberto además de la despensa trabaja como constructor de obra.
El solicita el crédito a kiva y la fundación paraguaya para la compra de arroz, fideo, azúcar y otros insumos de primera necesidad para abastecer su local. Agradece por la oportunidad que les da la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
Edilberto has been married to Ilda for several years. They have 4 minor children who are still in primary school.

Together they opened a small store located in Ciudad del Este. They started with a little capital that they obtained from other jobs that they did before as employees. Thanks to the work they are doing, they are educating their children and supporting them. Edilberto, in addition to the store, works in construction. 

He is asking for the loan from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya to buy rice, pasta, sugar and more basic necessity items to stock his locale. He is grateful for the opportunity given to them by Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, sugar and more.

loans.name: Badinya De Solico Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tonia Foo est né depuis la création du banc villageois Soliko le 02 Avril 2007. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Lao,(assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53ans, est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, elle a aussi à sa charge 05 de ses petits fils. Elle vendeuse de divers produits alimentaires (kola, thé, sucre) qu’elle achète au marché hebdomadaire. Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter du sucre, du thé et de la kola destinés à la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire de ses petits fils et enfants.
texts.en:
The group Tonia Foo was created at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois Soliko on April 2, 2007. It consists of 13 women who live in the same village and whose main activity is small trade.  

Mrs. Lao (sitting at the far right) is the head of the group. She is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She also takes care of 5 of her grandsons. She has been selling various food items such as kola, tea and sugar for several years. She buys her merchandise at the weekly market. 

She will use this loan to buy sugar, tea and kola for resale. The profits earned will allow her to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their children and grandsons with respect to food and tuition.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea and kola for resale.

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 year, marriage, and has six children; four of them are still in school. 

Aman heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old and lives in Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Gloria catches and sells fish for a living and has been doing this for 17 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

In the future, Gloria hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 64 years old and has seven children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though John is the only one featured in the picture, he is actually representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

John started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2011. He did so because he wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year, he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

John’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mrs Út is married with 2 children in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 
Her circumstances is the most difficult in this group. Her husband and two children are Agent Orange victims. She must work hard everyday to foster her family and weak mother-in-law. Her main income is from agriculture work rising baby poultry, in addition, she farms rice and vegetable for more income. Now she want to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in future, but the main hardship that Út faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan from THanh Hóa microfinance institution.
With the business profit, Út hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, husband and mother-in-law, and to improve quality life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
My name is Guadalupe H. and I produce as well as sell tortillas. I have had my business for 5 years and I have many clients, as I am located near to another large business. My tortillas sales generate an income enough to support my family and my goal is to increase production so as to increase sales. With the added earnings I would remodel my home and give a better education to my children.

Mi nombre es Guadalupe H. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que tengo mi lugar de venta cerca de una empresa, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darles un mejor estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood and matches

Compra de harina de maiz, agua, sal, cal, leña, fosforos

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. O. owns a business that offers printing and copying services, a field he has worked in for more than 20 years. He is a married father of 4 children. Through Prisma, he plans to use the loan money to buy materials like ink, paper, printer parts, etc. so that his company can fill customer orders. This economic support will help him increase income and afford his family a more comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. O. es propietario de una imprenta y labora en este campo desde hace más de 20 años. Es casado y padre de 4 hijos, el dinero que le pueda proporcionar Prisma lo utilizaría en la compra de materiales como Tinta, papelería, repuestos para sus impresoras, etc. para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes. Este apoyo económico le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y brindar más comodidad a sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy materials in order to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 46 years old. She was born in Parras, Coahuila but when she was young her family moved to Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon on account of her father's job. Their financial circumstances allowed her only a secondary education, but this hasn't held her back. She took to sales when she was young and started her own business, at first selling goods out of catalogs, then little by little saving up so she could open a grocery store. Through hard work and dedication she has succeeded. She has four children and she has taught them the value of hard work. At this time, Silvia is asking for a loan of $475 to buy merchandise. She would like to offer her customers more variety. With your help, she can achieve great things. She and her family appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Silvia tiene 46 años de edad, ella nació en Parras, Coahuila, desde muy pequeña, por cuestiones de trabajo de su padre, tuvo que cambiarse de domicilio a la ciudad de Guadalupe, Nuevo León. La situación económica de sus padres solo le permitió terminar la educación secundaria, lo cual no a sido un limitante para ella, ya que desde joven empezó a desarrollar su gusto por las ventas e inició su propio negocio, primero con la venta de productos por catálogo y poco a poco fue ahorrando para lograr poner su tienda de abarrotes que con base en mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante.

Ella tiene 4 hijos, a los que ha enseñado que el trabajo constante es lo básico para obtener mejores oportunidades. Ahora Silvia necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Silvia podrá hacer grandes cosas con tu ayuda, ella y su familia agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira`s mother used to be the one who was in business, and Zamira only helped. After finishing school and not having found work, however, Zamira began to spend all her time working at their market stall. One year ago their whole inventory consisted only of Tajik galoshes. Gradually Zamira has been able to expand her business so that their inventory now includes ready-made dresses and notions.

As Zamira is only 20 years old and not yet married, she lives with her parents and her business is one of the sources of income for her family.

Zamira is trying to increase the profitability of her business and consequently, one year ago, she took a loan from MicroInvest. She says this has given a boost to her business and provided her the opportunity to make additional profit.

To purchase goods, Zamira goes to wholesale markets in Istaravshan and Karosuu, Kyrgyzstan. To travel to Karosuu it is necessary to take roundabout roads because on the way, there is a border with Uzbekistan. Travel across that border is forbidden for citizens of Tajikistan. But Zamira manages to go to Karosuu anyway, because goods are cheaper there.

Now it's the summer season and Zamira wants to further expand her inventory. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to be repaid over a period of 12 months. (The lady in the photo is Zamira`s mother.)

loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila is a married woman with three children whose husband is a truck driver. However, in spite of that, his job is very tiring, it keeps him away from home, and he makes very little money. In addition, he is losing a lot of time that he could spend with his children and attend their events at school. Domitila isn't defeated by this obstacle and always tries to raise her children well and continue moving forward. Therefore, she looked for a job that wouldn't take her out of the house all day so she could be with her children so they wouldn't feel so alone and so at the same time, she could make some money. This was how she started to sell shoes from a catalog. Little by little, she has been looking for new customers so that she can contribute to the expenses in the absence of her husband.

Lately, the situation in her house has become very difficult because her husband's trips have been longer, keeping him away from home for longer periods of time. Because of this, she had to use her earnings to feed her children and today she has no money to be able to restock with new products to sell. Therefore, Domitila is asking for a loan of $375 that she will pay back in in 6 months. She will use this money to buy merchandise for the winter season. WIth your help, Domiltila will be able to help her family during this time of need.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Domitila, es una mujer casada y con tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer de trailer, sin embargo a pesar de que el trabajo de su esposo es muy desgastante y se la pasa fuera de la casa, el dinero que gana es muy poco, además de que pierde todos esos momentos que pudiera pasar con sus hijos, y asistir a sus eventos escolares. Domitila no se deja vencer por este obstáculo y siempre trata de sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo tanto buscó un trabajo que no le quitara todo el día, para poder convivir con sus hijos y no se sientan tan solos, y obtener ganancias al mismo tiempo, así fue como comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, y poco a poco a ido buscando nuevas clientas, para que ella pueda aportar a los gastos que suceden en ausencia del esposo.

Estos últimos días, la situación en su casa se a vuelto muy difícil, porque los viajes de su esposo se hicieron más lejos y los días que se queda fuera del hogar son más. Así que tuvo que utilizar sus ganancias para darle de comer s sus hijos y hoy no tiene dinero para poder surtir nuevos productos que ofrecer, Por lo tanto Domitila está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y ese dinero utilizarlo para comprar mercancía para la temporada de invierno. Con tu ayuda Domitila podrá sacar adelante a su familia de esta temporada de escasez.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth belongs to the Communal Bank Las Activas, she lives in Asentamiento Humano Señor D. los Milagros Jr. Pachacutec Mz A1 Lt. 06, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 52 years old and mother of 7 children, her husband is a motocycle-taxi driver, but the income doesn't meet the household expenses. So Elizabeth, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles (US$100.00), decided to put a small chicken retail stand in the Bellavista market.

Because of her business she gets up at 1 AM to go and purchase the chickens in order to be able to sell them starting at 5 AM. Sales normally finish at 1 PM, then she goes home to rest and prepare to do it all again the next day.

With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos for 1000 Soles (approximately US$334), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will increase her usual purchase, now she will buy 70 chickens daily, and thereby increase her income.

Elizabeth is very happy to see her business prosper, as that is an important achievement for her, and thanks to this success she has helped her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Señor D. los Milagros Jr. Pachacutec Mz A1 Lt. 06, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad y es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Elizabeth, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) deciD. poner una pequeña tienda D. venta D. pollos en el mercado Bellavista.

Debido a su negocio, se levanta a la 1 D. la mañana para ir a comprar las javas D. pollo y así poder iniciar la venta D. los mismos a partir D. las 5 a.m. La venta, normalmente termina a la 1 p.m., luego se dirige a su domicilio para descansar y prepararse para la rutina del día siguiente.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000 (US$ 334.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, incrementará la compra habitual D. pollos, ahora comprará 70 pollos a diario, D. esta manera incrementará sus ingresos.

Elizabeth está muy contenta D. ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, gracias a éste ha alcanzado el bienestar D. su familia.

loans.use: Purchase butchered chickens

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny has been back from Brazil for six months, here he worked as a tailor next to his wife; he returned to Bolivia in order to care for their young child. He works on his own making clothes, this is their main source of income. They live in the Villa Santa Rosa zone of El Alto city.

The credit he requests is to purchase a sewing machine which will help him keep up with the demands of his job.

This is his first credit with Impro, the evaluation he received allowed him to get the necessary credit.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhonny hace 6 meses que volvió de Brasil donde trabajo como costurero junto a su esposa; por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo retornaron a Bolivia para trabajar por cuenta propia como confeccionistas de prendas de vestir, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su familia; vive en la Zona Villa Santa Rosa de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para comprar una maquina recta de coser misma que le ayudara para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Jhonny.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine for his workshop

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam (his son is pictured) was born in 1958,  has 2 children and lives in Khachmaz region. 2 years ago Islam and his son started a business selling phone accessories.  Now this family needs a loan of $725 to buy additional phone accessories to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Hiệu, 37 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund for nine years. She’s been taking out loans from the Fund to invest in her glove making business. Her steady income is convenient for the weekly repayment plan. Her daily income is from 3 to 4USD. Her youngest son, 10 years old, helps his mom after school somewhat. She is applying for a loan of 325USD to buy material. She lives with her husband and two children in Ý Yên, Nam Định.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Hiệu, 37 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 9 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trong các năm tham gia, chị thường sử dụng đồng vốn vay vào việc mua vải may găng tay. Đây là một công việc mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên rất thuận lợi cho việc trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập từ việc bán găng tay mỗi ngày khoảng 3-4USD. Con út của chị Hiệu năm nay lên 10 tuổi, ngoài giờ đi học cũng giúp đỡ mẹ ít nhiều. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay thêm 325USD về mua vải. Chị Hiệu hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy clothes to make gloves

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Five years ago, Alejandro C. started selling jewelry through catalogue. He had to do this because he could not find a job and he needed an income to cover his expenses. Thanks to his hard work, he has made his business grow and currently has very good sales.

He is now requesting a loan for US $475, which he will pay in 6 months, to buy merchandise to sell and show, because given the nature of his business, many customers make up their mind when they see the jewelry physically and not through the catalogue. With your support Alejandro will be able to keep his business going.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandro C. hace 5 años inicio la venta de joyería por catalogo esto tuve que hacerlo debido que no encontraba trabajo, y necesitaba un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos. Gracias a su empeño ha hecho crecer su negocio y actualmente tiene buenas ventas.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para venta y exhibición ya que dada la naturaleza del negocio, muchos clientes se deciden hasta que ven las joyas físicamente y no por catalogo. Con tu apoyo Alejandro seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Brigido

texts.es:
Brigido Jimenez is 54 years old and has been married to Maria Margarita Gaona for 47 years. They have eight children, two of whom are still in school. The others are older and work in the neighbouring country of Argentina.

For 35 years Brigido has been selling local traditional handicrafts such as bedspreads decorated with embroidery and povvy (a special Paraguayan sewing technique), and hammocks. He transports them to sell in Ciudad Del Este, a city located about four hours from Carapeguá.

His beautiful products are much sought after, especially by the tourists who visit our country. His wife is an artisan, and she makes the blankets, hammocks, and bedspreads which Brigido sells. Because of this highly valued and demanding work, he has been able to buy a motorcycle which he uses to take his merchandise to market. He has also purchased a car so that his family can travel in comfort, and he can make his sales even on cold and rainy days.

He is asking for a loan to buy cotton thread of various colours so that his wife can continue making her beautiful crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Brigido Jimenez tiene 54 años de edad está casado hace más de 31 años con la Sra. Maria Margarita Gaona de 47 años de edad, tienen 8 hijos dos en etapa escolar y los otros todos ya mayores de edad y que actualmente se encuentran trabajando en el vecino país Argnetina.

El señor Brigido hace 35 años que se dedica a la venta de productos artesanales y que son tradicionales de la zona como sobrecamas elaborados de hilo y poyvy (técnica de costura paraguaya) y hamacas que lleva a vender por la zona de Ciudad Del Este que es una ciudad que queda a cuatro horas de viaje desde Carapeguá.

Sus productos son muy queridos y apreciados, especialmente por turistas que visitan nuestro país. Su esposa es artesana y ella elabora las frazadas, hamacas y colchas para que Brigido las venda. Gracias a este trabajo honrado y sacrificado, pudo comprarse una motocicleta lo cual utiliza para vender sus mercadería, además también compró un auto para la comodidad de su familia y de sus ventas en los días de frío y lluvia.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de algodón de distintos colores con los que su esposa podrá seguir trabajando elaborando sus hermosas artesanías.

loans.use: To buy coloured cotton thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Funds will be invested to purchase various items to boost a grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz and her family work day and night at the chores required of people who farm and raise livestock, chores that she's been doing for 12 years. She has two children and her hard work is for them. Farming chores are difficult and tiring because they require working the soil in the hot sun and tending to the needs of farm animals. All this work for a woman on her own is exhausting but Luz has to do it because it is how she supports herself and her children. In order to improve her crop production, she needs to buy seeds, fertilizer and other things. Feed for the animals that she's raising, for example. Put your trust in her work and give her your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Luz, una madre de familia que trabaja constantemente en las tareas de agricultura y ganadería, labor a la cual se viene dedicando 12 años de su vida. Ella tiene dos hijos y ellos son el motivo de su esfuerzo diario. Las tareas del campo son arduas y muy cansadas ya que tiene que labrar la tierra bajo en sol extenuante y por otro lado sacar a pastear su ganado. Todas estas labores para una mujer sola son agotadoras, pero Luz debe hacerlas porque de ello depende el sustento de su casa. Para mejorar la producción de sus cultivos ella necesita comprar más semillas, abonos y demás. Además de la alimentación para los animales que ella cría. Confía en su trabajo y bríndale tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve quality of farm crop.

loans.name: Abimbola

texts.en: Abimbola T. is 35 years old and married with two children.  She learned this trade for two years before setting up her own business in 1993.  Abimbola sells soft drinks, and she is also a hair stylist.  She needs the loan amount of $600 to buy more materials like hair oil, relaxer, hair extensions, and weaves for hair styling.  Abimbola said this will prevent customers from going elsewhere.  She figures that in the long run this will go a long way to increase her profit margin, as one need not depend on only one line of business.

loans.use: To purchase more hair styling materials

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru:
Мирзоев Амриддин молодой, но уже преуспевающий предприниматель. Ему  20 лет и он  холост. Амриддин торгует мужской одеждой на рынке "Панджшер"  г. Душанбе. У него 5 лет опыта в этой деятельности и начал бизнес со своим другом.  В его ассортименте большой выбор одежды для молодого поколения.  Строгие, деловые сорочки и стильные, спортивные одежды для мужчин. Этим делом он помогает своим родителям, внося свой вклад в семейный бюджет.  
Файзулло нужны средства для приобретения межсезонных мужских одежд и он хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Amriddin M. is young, but is already a successful entrepreneur. He is 20 years old and is a bachelor. Amriddin sells men’s clothing at the “Pandzhsher” market in Dushanbe. He has 5 years of experience in this area and started the business with his friend. He has a large selection of products targeted at the young generation. He sells conservative, business shirts and stylish sportswear for men.

Amriddin’s business allows him to help his parents and to contribute to the family budget. He needs a loan in order to purchase mid-season men’s clothing; he would like to take out a loan for 2000 somoni for a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca es casada y madre de 2 hijos de 04 y 06 años. Ella inició el negocio como apoyo hacia su esposo, ya que el trabaja como empleado en una empresa y en ocasiones es difícil solventar los gastos del hogar con un solo sueldo, es por eso que inicio su negocio de venta de zapatos, al principio vendiendo sobre pedidos pequeños y posteriormente surtió pedidos por quincena de mas cantidad.

Actualmente necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses tener surtido de zapatos y promover mas los tenis para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and mother to two children, ages 4 and 6. She began her business as a support to her husband as he works as an employee in a business and on occasion it is difficult to meet their household expenses with just one income. Therefore she began her business selling shoes, at first selling through small orders and later she fulfilled larger quantity orders every couple weeks. Today she needs a loan for US $325, which will be repaid in 3 months, to stock her shoes and sell more athletic shoes for the upcoming winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru:
Каюмова Зулфинисо, ей 48 лет и она замужем. У нее 3 детей. Зулфинисо начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. В бизнесе она вот уже 13 лет. Она торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района детскими одеждами. В ее ассортименте имеются спортивные костюмы, джинсовые брюки и костюмы, футболки, свитера и джемпера. С наступлением осени увеличивается спрос на осеннее - зимнюю форму, чего у нее мало. Прошлогодние остатки товаров в меньшем количестве и Зулфинисо хочет обновить свой товар. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Зулфинисо хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3000 сомони чтоб закупить осенний товар, спортивные костюмы.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso K. is 48 years old and married. She has three children. Zulfiniso started her own business selling children's clothing and has been in this business for thirteen years. She sells on the Muboriz market of the Gissar region. Her inventory includes sports wear, jean pants and suits, t-shirts, sweaters and pull-overs. With the coming of autumn the demand for the autumn-winter clothes increases and she does not have very many in stock. She only has last year's leftovers in small quantities and Zulfiniso wants to update her inventory. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon and from suppliers from China.

Zulfiniso wants to get a loan with the help of Kiva for 3000 somoni (USD$900) to buy autumn merchandise and sports wear.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sports wear

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem M., 42, and her husband are farmers in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, growing rice and raising pigs on a plot of land behind their house. They have three children, all students. They started planting rice in 1999, and their output is just enough to support their family members. This couple grows rice twice a year, first during the rainy season, which requires six to seven months before harvesting, and second during the dry season, which requires three to four months.

Khem M. is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Kokou Mawuenyégan

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, Monsieur A. Kokou Mawuenyégan est né à Fiokpo dans la préfecture de Kloto. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il est actuellement domicilié à Kpémé. Il arrive à joindre les deux bouts en s’adonnant au commerce de produits et médicaments génériques. Il est à noter qu’il a une bonne réputation et une bonne maîtrise de la gestion de son activité.
Il sollicite un financement pour l’achat d’autres produits génériques recherchés par sa clientèle. Cela augmentera son chiffre d’affaires, son revenu et lui permettra d’assurer la scolarisation et l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou Mawuenyégan A., 43, was born in Fiokpo in the prefecture of Kloto. Married and the father of 4 children, he presently lives in Kpémé. He manages to make ends meet by selling generic medicines and such. It should be noted that he has a good reputation and a good mastery of the management skills necessary for his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy other generic products his clientele has asked him for. This will increase his turnover and allow him to pay the school fees and assure the future of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of generic medicines

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Grace sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at the sea side in Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman. Grace uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save towards a house which she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Lludy

texts.es:
La señora Lludy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el futuro II”, vive en el Jr. Tomas Villacorta Nº 371, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 niño, es conviviente su pareja se dedica a la docencia en una institución publica. Lludy con el primer prestamo de S/300 decide invertir en abarrotes para venderlos a los vecinos del lugar.

Actualmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega poco surtida, donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, además productos de belleza, lo que genera ingresos diariamente que le permiten pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/.700.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara 1 saco de arroz, aceite en caja, detergente de todos los tamaños y marcas, frutas y verduras para surtir un poco más el negocio.

Lludy manifiesta sentirse mejor por la oportunidad que le da Manuela Ramos para crecer como mujer y empresaria que es lo que desea ser en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ms. Lludy is a member of the “Mujeres para el futuro II” (Women for the Future II) microfinance institute. She lives in the Tarapoto district of the department of San Martin. She is a 26-year-old mother with a one-year-old son. Her live-in partner works as a teacher in a public institution. Lludy decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan in purchasing provisions to sell them to the local residents.

She currently has a mini market in which she sells only a few goods, such as basic need items and beauty products, which generates a daily income for her that helps her repay her loan punctually.

With this 700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, a box of cooking oil, assorted brands and sizes of detergent, fruits and vegetables in order to better stock her business. Lludy states that she feels good about the opportunity to grow as a female entrepreneur—which is what she wants to be in the future—that Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, cooking oil, detergent, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Asrop

texts.id:
Asrop sudah terbiasa bangun pagi hari untuk mempersiapkan barang –barang yang menjadi dagangannya. Memasak nasi,sayur dan aneka lauk-pauk untuk berjualan dipasar pagi .kemudian bergegas menuju kepasar Jembrana dengan menbawa sepedaa motonya.Asrop biasa berjualan nasi bungkus di pasar pada pukul 5.00 sedang pulang dari jualan setelah barang dagangan sudah habis terjual,biasanya pada pukul 9.00 wita juga sudah ada dirumah untuk membatu kesibukan istrinya yang mempunyai usaha warung kecil dirumahnya.

Yang menjadi pelanggan warung nasi Asrop di pasar jembrana adalah sesama pedagang yang biasa berjualan bersama dipasar.
Setelah dapat melunasi pada pinjaman terdahulu kemudian Asrop kembali melanjutakan pinjamannya.Yayasan DINARI masih tetap melayani pinjaman sepanjang masih memerlukan dana untuk keperluan usaha warungnya. Dari hasil keuntungan usahanya Asrop dapat membiayai anaknya terakhinya yang sudah sekolah pada tingkat atas.
texts.en:
Asrop is used to getting up early to prepare goods for his trade. Cooking rice, vegetables and a variety of side dishes to be sold in the morning market then hurry to the market Jembrana using a motorcycle. Asrop usually sells wrapped rice in the market from 5 and return after having sold all his goods usually at 9, then back home to help his wife with the small stall at home. The customers of Asrop rice stall in the market Jembrana are his fellow regular traders in the market. After repaying the earlier loan Asrop once again continue her loan. DINARI foundation is still providing loan during the period when funding is required for his stall business. From the profit Asrop is able to pay for his youngest child’s education, now in high school.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Fenm Vayanor “Valiant Women” Group

texts.en:
The “Fenm Vayan” or “Valiant Women” Group is a made up of twenty-five male and female entrepreneurs, twenty of which are taking out a second loan.

After successfully repaying their first loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses.  Their businesses range from used clothing and jewelry, food sales, to charcoal production and sales.

Jina J. is one of four representatives of the group. She is married with two children, ages 7 and 1.5 years old.
She sells used footwear and used clothing that she buys in bulk from the Dominican Republic to sell in her local marketplace.  Jina used her first loan to increase her inventory because there is more of a profit margin when she buys in bulk.  She dreams of expanding her business to to sell in multiple cities and hire employees.  On behalf of Jina, Fenm Vayan, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: Buy used clothing, sandals, shoes, and jewlery.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
El negocio de la señora Patricia C. es un pequeño salón de belleza ubicado en la ciudad de Chinandega donde lo atiendo todos los días y brindando los servicios de estilista y cosmetóloga a sus clientes tales como niños, damas y caballeros en general.

Ella se ha destacado en su comunidad por ser muy conocedora en el ramo de la belleza y es por esta razón que los clientes le buscan. Por este motivo es que ella comprometida con dichos clientes busca la manera de cómo suplir sus necesidades y brindar un buen servicio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo como lo son peines, cremas, gelatinas, guantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Patricia C.'s business is a small beauty salon located in the city of Chinandega. She attends to it everyday, offering stylist and cosmetology services to her customers, such as children, women and gentlemen in general.

She stands out in the community for being very knowledgeable in the beauty field, which is why customers come to her. For this reason she is committed to serving her customers, looking for ways to better meet their needs and offer the best service possible. She has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan, so that she can buy work materials such as combs, creams, gels and gloves, amongst other things.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work materials

loans.name: Saiburkhon

texts.en:
S. Saiburkhon is 50 years old and married with three children.

Nine years ago, Saiburkhon decided to start his own business selling carpets. He began his own business with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients, and his business keeps growing.

In order to increase the range of his carpets, he now needs a loan of $3000 which he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repay this amount within 12 months. Be a part of this business and of Saiburkhon's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 18 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina D. is 28 years old and comes from Gradačac. She is employed in a boutique and besides that, she resells clothes and shoes at the market and on order. She has been our client for a long time; this will be her third loan through WWI.

Nermina used the first loan to purchase poultry for resale; the second one was invested in clothing inventory. She is a young girl who wants to earn for her later life and provide a good life standard for herself. Nermina requested 500 KM to by clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Obid

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Махкамов  Обид мужчина, который берёт кредиты для расширения своего дела. Он занимается производством и продажей мясных шашлыков. На сегодна Обид открыл ещё одну точку и готовит здесь домашний плов, он на снимке готовит плов. А шашлык готовит его сын. Следующий кредит хочет использовать для закупа риса большой партией по оптовой цене.
texts.en:
Obid M. is a man, who obtains loans to expand his business. He is involved in making and selling shish kabobs. Obid also opened another stand, where he cooks home-made pilaf. The photograph shows him cooking pilaf. His son prepares shish kabobs. Obid wants to use his next loan to purchase a large stock of rice at a wholesale price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of rice

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es: La Señora Silvia Sánchez M. es mujer una casada. Tiene 44 años de edad. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 23 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicia con muy pocos ingresos, pero con mucha ganas de sobresalir, por lo que viajaba a los diferentes departamentos ofreciendo sus productos en una camioneta, y así surge su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su deseo es comprar una vivienda propia ya que no tiene nada que dejarles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia Sánchez M. is a married woman. She is 44 years old. She has four children under her care. To make a living, she sells fruit and vegetables. She has worked in the business for more than 23 years. She started with little income, but a great desire to succeed. As she traveled to many different areas offering her products from a truck, her business advanced. The loan that she requests is for working capital to purchase products. She hopes to purchase her own home, since she doesn’t have anything to leave to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 45-year-old married man with four children. In 2008, he decided to open his own furniture carpentry shop to satisfy the needs of the market in his village. Today, Khalil is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase tools in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools in order to expand his business

loans.name: Morufatu

texts.en: Morufatu is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She has a shop where she sells provisions like noodles, sugar, milk, candies, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells toffees, biscuits and gari at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. Aba has no educational background. She is married and has five children.

Aba has been selling toffees, biscuits and gari since 2007. She is responsible for paying the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more toffees, gari and biscuits for resale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy more toffees, gari and biscuits for resale at the market

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1 un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles font de la vente de condiments alimentaires, de bazins, de chaussures, du bois de chauffe, des pagnes wax et divers autres articles d’alimentation et sont à leur premier prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 paquets d’articles divers pour l’alimentation, 6 emballages de condiments alimentaires,  10 pièces de pagnes wax, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 5 complets de bazins teintés et 1 douzaine de chaussures. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 37.500 FCFA qui servira d’épargne, de besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women who are on average 38 years old, have 3 children, and live in monogomous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali. They sell seasoning, damask, shoes, firewood, Wax brand pagnes (brightly colored fabric used for wraps), and various other food items. This is their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution. With their loan, they plan to purchase 5 packets of various food items, 6 packages of seasoning, 10 lengths of Wax pagnes, 1 truckload of firewood, 5 dyed damask suits, and 1 dozen shoes. They get their supplies in the Sikasso market and in the neighboring villages. They sell in the city of Sikasso in the markets and in a traveling manner in the neighborhoods. They sell for cash, retail, or on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. They each plan to make a monthly profit of 37,500 CFA francs for savings and family needs, and the other portion will be reinvested in the group's activities. They plan to have more capital to better satisfy their customers and to be able to build a sales area.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items.

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.es:
Luisa es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Santa Rosa.

Su esposo se dedica eventualmente a la pesca y, por lo difícil que es sostenerse con esta actividad, hace cinco años Luisa decidió apoyar a la economía familiar con el negocio de la venta de pescado fresco; empezó a vender pescado en las calles de forma ambulatoria y poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo, ahora ella lo vende en los pueblos de la región que no tienen acceso al mar y esporádicamente lo vende también en la ciudad de Tumbes, a seis horas de viaje desde la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Usualmente cuando viaja a Tumbes distribuye algunos pedidos que le solicitan con anticipación, pero la mayoría de veces lo vende en el mercado de la zona. Ella va a comprar su mercancía en el terminal pesquero de su distrito de dos a tres veces por semana, también vende pescado seco – salado el cual procesa en el mismo terminal.

Actualmente sus hijos están por terminar el colegio, Luisa desea brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior, pero los ingresos económicos que perciben de su negocio no le abastecen para lograr su deseo, es por ello que planea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado para procesarlo y venderlo, por lo que está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella desea seguir trabajando junto a su esposo para comprarse un auto y utilizarlo como vehículo de transporte de pasajeros en una empresa de automóviles que cubre la ruta Chiclayo – Santa Rosa.

Luisa ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa en otras oportunidades y en todas ellas ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, por tal motivo es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 42-year old mother who lives with her husband and four children 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in the Santa Rosa district. Her husband works from time to time as a fisherman, and since it is difficult to support a family with this activity, Luisa decided five years ago to support the family finances with a business selling fresh fish. She started to sell fish in the streets, and little by little her business grew. Now she sells in the towns of the region that don't have access to the sea and sporadically she also sells in the city of Tumbes, which is six hours from the city of Chiclayo. Generally when she travels to Tumbes she distributes some advance orders, but the majority of times she sells in the area market. She goes to purchase merchandise in the district fisheries terminal two or three times per week; she also sells salted dried fish that are processed there. Currently her children are about to finish school. Luisa would like to provide them with the opportunity to study in a university, but the income that her business generates is not sufficient to achieve this desire. For this reason she is planning on expanding her business with the purchase of more fish to process and sell, financed by a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 nuevos soles. She wishes to continue working with her husband so that they can buy an automobile and to use it to transport passengers in a transportation business that covers the Chiclayo-Santa Rosa route. Luisa has worked with Edpyme Alternativa on other opportunities and in all of them she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments, and for this reason she is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fish to process and sell

loans.name: Djabor

texts.en:
A. Djabor is a 53 year old married man with 4 children. After finding it very difficult to get a job and needing to generate an income, he started his own small business selling groceries 5 years ago. Djabor began by selling a small selection of basic products and added to his inventory as he gained more customers. His business has expanded greatly thanks to his efforts and he was recently able to purchase a larger refrigerator. Djabor is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to purchase additional merchandise to stock his store and meet his customers' demand. Your support will help improve his life and expand his business. Thank you! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, moreover, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Unfortunately, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing more food to increase the range of items sold in his store

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
ELIZABETH ROSAR. A. P.; de 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 20 años. Ella integra D. grupo “Amigas Unidas” junto con 6 integrantes mas, quienes son muy entusiastas y emprendedoras.
Desde hace dos años, la Sra. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de pescado en el Mercado “La Hacienda”, en el puesto que alquila y el cual bautizó con el nombre de “Pescados y mariscos Charito”. Nos menciona que éste trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que debe madrugar todos los días sin excepción para dejar listo el almuerzo y salir a comprar los pescados y mariscos en el mercado mayorista. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien se queda al cuidado de sus hijos que ahora ya son jóvenes y también la apoyan tanto en el negocio como con los quehaceres de la casa.
Con su trabajo, ha logrado comprar su terreno, donde ha podido levantar poco a poco la casita en donde viven actualmente y sobretodo el pago de estudios universitaR. de su hija mayor.
Su mayor deseo es adquirir un puesto en el mercado donde trabaja para dejar de pagar alquileres y comprar un taxi que pueda alquilar y le de otro ingreso. Ella se está proyectando, ya que su hijo menor el próximo año debe iniciar sus estudios universitaR..
texts.en:
ELIZABETH ROSAR. A. P. is 36 years old, married, and has two children aged 17 and 20 respectively. She is a member of the “Amigas Unidas” group along with 6 other members, who are all very enthusiastic and entrepreneurial. Two years ago, Mrs. Elizabeth decided to start selling fish in the “La Hacienda” Market in a rented booth, which she named “Pescados y Mariscos Charito.” She says that this work is very burdensome, because she has to get up very early every day without exception in order to have the lunch ready and to go buy fish and shellfish in the wholesale market. Her husband helps her, staying to care for their still quite young children, helping with the business, and doing the household chores. With this job, she has been able to buy some land, where she has been able to build, little by little, the house in which her family currently lives, and she has been able to, above all, pay for her eldest daughter's university tuition. Her greatest wish is to buy a stand in the market where she works so she can stop paying rent and buy a taxi she can rent, which would provide additional income. She is already planning how she will pay for her younger son's university tuition when he starts next year.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a Motorbike for Taxi Transport

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
D. Altantsetseg is 56 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Altantsetseg  and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger." Her husband is retired and collects a pension of 123,000 tugrugs (~$80 USD) every month. Her daughter is 23 years old and recently graduated college with a degree in clothing design. 

Altantsetseg and her daughter are seamstresses. They design and produce a variety of clothes to meet their customer's needs. Altantsetseg started her business in 1999. She has built a stable business over the last 10 years and has become an experienced clothing designer and seamstress. Currently, she has two sewing machines to keep up with her quick growing business. She is a very motivated woman and works hard to improve her business and support her family. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a 450,000 tugrug loan to purchase fabric and supplies so she can make dresses for the upcoming New Year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and supplies for her clothing design business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun S., age 47, and her husband, Mr. Sas Hout, age 47, were married in 1987 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of the children have full-time employment and the other two attend school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Savoeun has been working for a NGO since 1992, while her husband has been working in a garment factory for four months. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to pour a concrete foundation for her house and build a brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: To pour a concrete foundation and build a brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old and married with three children who are currently schooling. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Lydia is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. She does all kinds of hairstyles, like plaiting, perming and fixing of weavons (extensions), etc. 

She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc., to avoid shortages and poor service.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted fish in bulk

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Leonor,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años D. edad, nuestra socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. 27, 25, 23 años D. edad, Nuestra socia  es docente D. inicial, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la docencia, ella disfruta mucho D. su trabajo pero está entrando al retiro, ella ahora desea comprar leche fresca y lo venderá, se va a dedicar a este negocio D. compra y venta D. leche.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Leonor belongs to the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank. She lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, 45 minutes from Cusco. She is 54, married, with 3 children ages 27, 25, and 23.
