She is an early education teacher, balancing her household activities with teaching. She very much enjoys her work, but she is beginning retirement. She wants to buy fresh milk to sell, she plans to have a business buying and selling milk. She appreciates this opportunity and commits herself to make every payment according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie D. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for twelve years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Madame D.'s main activity consists of raising sheep which she sells at the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. With this loan, she will buy ten lambs. The revenues from this activity allow her to cover the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase ten lambs

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR EDSON SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA Y EN ESPECIAL POLLOS A LA BROASTER, EL SEÑOR EMPEZO COMO AYUDANTE DE COCINA EN UN RESTAURANTE MUY CONOCIDO DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA (LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, ES LA CAPITAL DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA Y DE LA PROVINCIA CERCADO SIENDO EN LA ACTUALIDAD LA TERCERA CIUDAD EN IMPORTANCIA ECONÓMICA DE BOLIVIA. SE ENCUENTRA SITUADA EN EL CENTRO DEL PAÍS, LOCALIZADA EN EL VALLE DEL MISMO NOMBRE EN MEDIO DE LA CORDILLERA DE LOS ANDES.)

CONSIDERADA COMO LA CAPITAL )EL VINO A NUESTRA INSTITUCION EMPRENDER SOLICITANDO UN CREDITO YA QUE NUNCA ANTES HABIA TRABAJADO CON NINGUNA INSTITUCION, Y DESPUES DE REALIZADA LA EVALUACION DE LE OTORGO UN CREDITO CON TAZA PREFERENCIAL CON EL PRIMER CREDITO ABRIO UN PEQUEÑO PUESTO DE VENTA DE COMIDA, TRABAJANDO CON NOSOTROS SE HIZO CAPÌTAL PROPIO Y AMPLIO SU PUESTO DE COMIDA QUE AHORA ES UNA TIENDA DE VENTA DE POLLOS, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR UNA BROASTERA GRANDE QUE MUCHA FALTA LE HACE AL SEÑOR EDSON.  EL SE SIENTE FELIZ DE TRABAJAR CON EMPRENDER YA QUE LE ABRIMOS LAS PUERTAS PARA TRABAJAR CON NOSOTROS Y ESTA AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Edson sells food and specializes in broasted chicken. He started as a kitchen assistant a well-known restaurant in Cochabamba. (Cochabamba is the capital city of the Cochabamba department and the Cercado province. It’s the third most important city in Bolivia. It’s located in the center of the country, in the valley of the same name, in the Andes corridor.) He came to our institution, Emprender, to request this loan. He had not worked with an institution before, but after our evaluation, his loan was approved and given preferential status. He used the money from his first loan to open a small food stall. Working with us, he was able to create his own capital and he expanded his stall, which is now a store that sells chicken. He plans to use the money from this loan to buy a large broaster which he needs. He is happy to be working with Emprender, since we opened our doors to him. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him when granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a chicken broaster

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla Y. is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Chy Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also owns a coffee shop where she can make a small income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Ngory Ny, is a construction worker who receives a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Phalla Y. is now requesting a loan to buy an ox to add to the old one and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy a cart and a plow for supporting her farming. Mrs. Phalla Y. is the mother of a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 36-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has 4 dependents living with him. He has been working as a mechanic for the past 13 years. He has been renting a shop for his work since 2007 and is specialized in repairs for all models of BMW vehicles. This type of work is important in Lebanon because many people have BMW cars, which they often buy second-hand and so they require greater maintenance work. His customers include neighbors and friends from his community. 

Jaafar is requesting a loan of US$ 2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. Jaafar will continue to develop his business, but will use this loan primarily to make much needed repairs to his home.

loans.use: To develop his business and primarily to make repairs to his home

loans.name: Losalina

texts.en:
Losalina N. is 35 and married with five children (ages 3 - 10).  She owns a business baking & selling cookies in the local community.  Losalina has one year of experience in this business.  Losalina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase baking equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Losalina joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Losalina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Elyas

texts.en:
Elyas is a 42-year-old married man. He has owned a sports-clothing shop since 2005 and has many years of experience in this occupation. He sells all type of sports clothes and shoes, as well as sports accessories.

When he first started, Elyas challenged some financial issues. He decided on opening his shop because he saw a need in his region for such a shop. His clients can be anyone, but mainly they are his friends and neighbors.

Elyas has already taken advantage of a first loan from Al Majmoua and he's pleased with his decision to take his second. He has been very punctual with his repayments and has repaid his entire loan on time. 

Today, Elyas has chosen to take a new loan of $3,000 to increase his selection of sports clothes in order to increase his sales and so his income. He hopes to further expand his business by opening a second sports shop.

loans.use: To increase his selection of sports clothes

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de abarrotería. Inicio desde muy joven pues su Mama se hacía cargo del negocio y debido a crisis económica Ana no pudo asistir a clases, pues su Mama le enseño este negocio que le serviría para un futuro y pudiera mantenerse, pues Carmelina siempre le ha puesto mucho empeño a su actividad, pues le gusta y además compartir con sus clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, ingredientes, tortillas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Carmelina is 39 years old and her business is the sale of groceries. She started very young because her mother was in charge of the business and in debt from the economic crisis. Ana could not go to classes, so her mother taught her the business that would serve her for a future and could support her. Carmelina has always dedicated much persistence to this business because she likes and shares with her clients. The loan is for the purchase of rice, ingredients such as tortillas and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene G. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old. Arlene is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice (retailing in kilos) in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products (rice) to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products (rice) to sell.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Meyevi

texts.en:
Madame Meyevi H. is 37 years old and lives in her hometown of Lome, Togo. She is married to a policeman.

Meyevi is a seamstress and has had her own shop, called Juliene Couture, since 2003. She also has two employees who work for her.

Meyevi would like to expand her business and to this end she has taken a loan of 350,000 CFA in order to purchase different kinds of fabrics that she uses to make her dresses. Offering different kinds of fabrics will satisfy her existing customers better and hopefully attract new ones.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other supplies

loans.name: Tayagbah Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tayagbah” group from Makeni. They are women with small-scale businesses who are based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Nanah B. who is age thirty-two and was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children – one of her children is attending primary school, another is in secondary school, and the last is not of school-going age.

Nanah sells rice, palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), vegetable oil, Margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), etc., and has been running this business for ten years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy more rice, palm-oil, vegetable oil, Margi, etc., wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm-oil, vegetable oil, Margi, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 2 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Begnena, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro,(2ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide, le pois de terre, le sésame et le haricot. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AWA T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environ 1,3 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues sur place, au niveau de la ville de Dioïla  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice de 80.000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi 2 is made of up of 10 married women with an average age of 36 and 3 children. The majority live in polygamous famiilies in Begnena, one of the villages in the Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organise their winter business activities. The crops cultivated are pearl millet, peanuts, bambara groundnuts, sesame and beans. This is their fifth loan and all of their previous loans have been duly repaid. With this new loan, Awa T. intends to purchase the agricultural products, supplies and equipment and to cover the labour costs required to cultivate approxiamtely 1.3 hectaires of peanuts and beans. The products are sold on site, in Dioila town after the harvest to a clientele of both men and women. After the harvest she hopes to make a profit of approximately 80.000FCFA.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Main d’œuvre, intrants et petits équipements

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador P. is from the village of Bacnor West. He is 22 years old and is single. Dominador owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, offering tricycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Dominador joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair his vehicle in order to provide better service. Dominador is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to repair his vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be his 2nd from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY A TABLE AND INGREDIENTS FOR HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Shirinbeyim

texts.en: Shirinbeyim M. is 53 years old. She is selling souvenirs, home products and cosmetics in a central local shop. Shirinbeyim has been in this business for five years already. During these years, the business turned into a successful one, allowing Shirinbeyim to support herself and her family. Now Shirinbeyim is planning to increase her stock and to purchase more home products plates at wholesale. With this purpose, she requests 1000 AZN. Shirinbeyim thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more home products.

loans.name: Friendship Group

texts.en:
Kumba S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Friendship. She is 36 years old, single, and has four children whose ages are between 6 and 18 years. She was able to attend school only through 12th grade due to financial difficulty. She also cares for two siblings.

For 15 years, she has been selling drinks (liquor) and water in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more crates of drinks and sacks of water. 

She describes herself as a friendly, very hard-working woman whose goals are to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks and sacks of water

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
Sofronia C. is from Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has two adult children.

Sofronia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sofronia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC.

Sofronia is now requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn O., photographed with one of her grandchildren, is from the town of San Francisco. She is 45 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is happy about her decision. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel R. is 26 years old, single and has one school-aged child. He is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin province on the Mindanao islands. Ronel operates a habal-habal or motorela service for local community members. Ronel has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ronel joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Ronel is requesting a new loan, his first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed for maintenance of his service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for maintenance of his service

loans.name: Jenny Ann

texts.en:
Jenny Ann R. is a married woman who lives in La Castellana, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and pig fattening business.  Her husband Jolo , who is 37 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 3 children who are between the ages of 7 and 12 years old.   

Jenny Ann  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jenny Ann  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP,  increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy stocks for the store so that she could continue to save up for future education of her children.  Jenny Ann  R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of items to sell.

loans.name: Videlmina

texts.es: Videlmina, de 40 años, vive con su pareja Francisco, y sus pequeños hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace dos  años, por circunstancias de la vida, ella empezó a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, a  inicios su bodega era muy precaria; no tenía mostradores ni vitrinas, por ello decidieron unir los ingresos de su  esposo con las ganancias de la bodega, con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida. De esta manera han ido invirtiendo de a pocos para terminar con los acabados respectivos de su casa, además han logrado comprar vitrinas para  su negocio. A ella le gusta dedicarse al comercio, asimismo le gusta dedicarse a las labores  del hogar. Lo que anhela en la vida es que sus hijos sean profesionales por ello trabajara con mucha dedicación  hasta lograrlo.Este es su tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y será muy responsable como siempre, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  mayor cantidad de abarrotes en general para tener en su almacén y de ese modo su negocio sea más atractivo.
texts.en:
Videlmina is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner Francisco and her young children in her own home.  Two years ago, through circumstance, she started selling groceries.  At first her grocery store was very unstable.  She didn't have any counters or display cases.  For this reason, she decided to put together her husband's income and the profits from her store in order to improve her quality of life.  In this way, the couple have been gradually investing in finishing some work on their home and they have also managed to buy some display cases for her business.

Videlmina likes to work in sales.  She also likes to do her household chores.  What she longs for in life is for her children to become professionals and she will work with a lot of commitment to achieve that.

This is Videlmina's third loan with MFP and she will be very responsible as ever.  She is happy with the work her community bank does because all the members are responsible people.  She plans to invest the money she has requested in buying a larger quantity of general groceries for her store.  This will make her business more attractive.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a natural fruit-juice making stand for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her husband also helps cover the family's basic needs. The major challenge Mamuna faces in her business is high transport costs. She hopes to be self-reliant in her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to pay school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Misandika S&c Group

texts.en: Amos would like a loan to purchase sugar, rice, radio batteries, and soap for resale. He runs a retail shop. He is a married man with ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of educating his children up to university level and making his family self-sustainable. He is a member of Misandika Savings and Credit group where each member guarantees the other in accessing credit.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, rice, radio batteries and soap for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw material to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with one child who attends school. For the past 4 years, Rose has been selling clothes from home, which contributes to her source of living. She also sells window curtains, adding to her income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of curtains and bed sheets to sell. Rose decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of curtains and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 41-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her eldest is 17 years old. Gloria is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 15 years. She sells her harvest to the people in her community.

Gloria has requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizer and other supplies. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

Gloria wishes to have a stable business and for her children to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Kijubwe Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Joy T. is 52 years old, married and has seven children with three in school. She is also the leader of Kijubwe Women’s Group in Ntungamo. Joy has sold fish from Rubaare market and at other market places for at least 24 years. She usually buys the fish from fishermen and sells them at a profit. She is focused and energetic, which has enabled her to succeed.

Joy is able to make 70,000 UGX from her sales of fish as well as 50,000 UGX from banana sales in weekly income. Before her current business, she sold a local brew, waragi, but she does not regret the move now. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for resale leading to increased prosperity and growth.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Azim

texts.en:
K. Azim is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. From the time he was young, Azim was learning to work in the small business of cattle and sheep breeding. He sells them in the market of Isfara and he has been in this business for 10 years. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason, Azim is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni. He wants with this loan to buy sheep and cattle. Azim is thankful for your support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle and sheep

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 51 years old, married to Elisabeth, and does not have children. He owns a retail shop.  He has been in this business for four years and earns a profit margin of KES.20,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his fifth loan of KES. 50,000.  He plans to buy more items such as cooking oil, flour, sugar, bread, and tea leaves for sale. He has paid his previous loans well and in good time.

In the future, he intends to grow his business and own a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more stock, e.g., cooking oil, flour, sugar, bread and tea leaves

loans.name: Vun

texts.en: Vun, age 32, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia where she sells food, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family is also assisted by her mother who sells fried noodles, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Vun has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more products to expand her food-selling business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more products to expand her food-selling business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 58 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in Gango, Ozamis City.

Patricia produces and sells seaweed to earn a living and has had a business for 5 years. Each month she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase materials for her seaweed production.

Patricia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her seaweed production business

loans.name: Alihonou Pierre

texts.fr: Alihonou Pierre  est né le 20 Décembre 1974 dans une ville du Bénin. Alihonou Pierre est marié à Médédji, une revendeuse.  Le couple a quatre enfants , tous vivant à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Alihonou Pierre  vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Alihonou Pierre  assure en grande partie les diverses charges de la famille, mais se fait aider parfois par sa femme. Alihonou Pierre  n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, mais a appris ensuite le métier de forgeron, activité qu’il exerce depuis quinze ans et qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille. Dans le but d’augmenter sa production et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Alihonou Pierre  sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit lui servira ainsi à acquérir des matériels de travail indispensable à son métier.
texts.en: Alihonou Pierre was born on December 20, 1974 in a city in Bénin.  He is married to Médédji, a retailer.  The couple has four dependent children, some of whom are in school. Alihonou Pierre lives with his wife and children.  For the most part, he is responsible for the family’s expenses, but is sometimes helped by his wife.  Alihonou Pierre only attended elementary school, but subsequently learned the blacksmithing trade, a profession he has practiced for fifteen years and that enables him to support his family.   Alihonou Pierre’s goals in requesting a second loan from ALIDé are to increase his production and to better meet customer demand.  He will use this loan to purchase materials essential to his trade.

loans.use: To buy aluminum and iron

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Nestor provides motorola or habal-habal (motor cycle taxi) services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the service. Nestor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the service

loans.name: Las Palomas De Agua Dulce Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Palomas de Agua Dulce, está conformado por la señora Graciela que va a comprar con su préstamo ropa para dama (pantalones, blusas, faldas) y para caballero (pantalones y camisas), la señora Flavia Paula va a comprar paquetes de colonias para dama y caballero y paquetes de Topperware para el hogar, la señora Virginia va a comprar artículos de regalo (bolsa, juguetes, pelotas, portarretratos y ramos para graduación), él señor Lázaro va a comprar semilla de maíz por bulto para sembrar y abono químico por bulto, la señora Marisol, va a comprar carnes, verduras, cebolla y cilantro. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por ayudarnos con sus prestamos y que sigan apoyando a más personas para que sus negocios sigan creciendo y las familias esten mas unidas”.  

La señora Marisol tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión libre con su esposo, ellos tiene 3 hijos Levit de 6 años de edad está estudiando el 2º. Año de primaria,  Alexandra de 3 años de edad y Oscar de 9 meses de edad, ella vende taquitos de suadero y carne enchilada en la casa de su mama los dias sabados y domingos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar carnes, verduras, nopales y bolsas para surtir su negocio, ella inicio su negocio hace un año, este negocio  era de su mama pero se lo heredo. Ella le ayudaba a su mama a preparar los taquitos y a atender a los clientes asi aprendio a preparar los taquitos, su esposo le dio dinero para comprar los insumos e iniciar con el negocio de venta de taquitos los sabados y domingos; ella está contenta con este préstamo que recibirá de FRAC porque va a comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar los taquitos y tener a sus clientes mas contentos, su negocio es importante porque le ayuda a mejorar económicamente, a ella le gusta cuando que la gente esté satisfecha con el trato y la atención que les proporciona, ella se siente orgullosa cuando le dicen que sus taquitos están sabrosos y regresan los clientes a consumir los taquitos, ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir en los insumos y poco a poco se va ampliando el negocio, para lo que necesite su hijo en la escuela y para algo que falte en la casa. 

Ella tiene la esperanza de construir su casa en un terreno que tiene en Jaloxtoc y que su negocio siga creciendo para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Palomas de Agua Dulce (Sweetwater Doves).  It consists of Graciela, who with the loan will buy women’s clothing, pants, blouses, skirts, and for men, pants and shirts.  Flavia Paula will buy packages of cologne for men and women, and Tupperware packages for the home.  Virginia will buy gift items, bags, toys, balls, frames, and graduation bouquets.  Lázaro will buy seed corn in bulk to sow, and chemical fertilizer in bulk.  Marisol will buy meat, produce, onion, and cilantro.  The group’s members would like to say to Kiva and the Reality Foundation “thanks for helping us with loans, and may you continue to support more people, so that their businesses continue to grow, and their families will stay together.”

Marisol is 25 years old, and lives with her common-law spouse.  They have 3 children, Levit, 6 years old, who is the second grade; Alexandra, 3 years old; and Oscar, 9 months old.  She sells “suadero” tacos (brisket), and chili tacos from her mother’s home on Saturdays and Sundays.  She requests a loan in order to buy meat, produce, nopal (cactus), and bags to stock her business.  She started her business a year ago.  It was her mother’s business, but she inherited it.  She used to help her mother prepare the tacos and serve customers, and thus learned to prepare tacos.  Her spouse gave her money to buy supplies and start up the business selling tacos on Saturdays and Sundays.  She is happy with the loan she got, because she will buy supplies needed to prepare tacos and keep her customers happy.  Her business matters, because it helps her financially.  She is happy when people are satisfied with the service provided.  She feels proud when they tell her that her tacos are tasty, and they come back for more tacos.  She uses the earnings to invest in supplies, and gradually is expanding her business, for things that her son needs in school, and things needed at home.  

She hopes to build a house on a piece of land she has in Jaloxtoc, and for her business to continue to grow, in order to provide a better life for her children, and for them to have what they need.

loans.use: buy meat, produce, nopal (type of cactus), and bags.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single parent taking care of five dependants. She makes tea and serves it with fried eggs and bread at Effiakuma, which is near Takoradi. She has operated her business for 5 years. She explains that her typical customers are those who were unable to eat their breakfast at home in the morning.

Grace will use the requested loan proceeds to purchase beverages for her business. Grace plans to reinvest any additional profits from an expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional beverages for her business.

loans.name: Génèse Plus Group

texts.en:
Génèse Plus ("Génèse" means "Genesis" in English) is a community bank chaired by Isabelle. It is composed of 11 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Génèse Plus is in Lubumbashi, which is a city located in Southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo. Lubumbashi was not spared the crisis and multiple wars that hit the DRC during the '90s decade. It is from the 2000s until today that the informal sector took off.
 
Isabelle is a dressmaker. She has been part of the microbusiness world since 2000. She started her business by selling palm oil and stopped it because of transportation difficulties. Today, she operates her sewing workshop downtown Lubumbashi. Besides sewing, she also sells second-hand clothing. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC, and she has already received eight loans and has repaid them correctly. 

She intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her businesses by purchasing a second-hand clothing bundle as well as supplies such as lining, fabric and zippers for her sewing business in order to increase her profit. 

Currently, her businesses bring in a profit of US $105 every week. Isabelle is 52 years old, married and the mother of eight children. Four of them attend school. Her dream is to open a sewing item store in her environment. She is very happy to be MFI HOPE’s client.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her businesses by purchasing a second-hand clothing bundle as well as supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios lo conforman Arcadia Gertrudis, Marlin y Coralia del Socorro tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Arcadia, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa (pantalones, blusas, etc.).

Este negocio lo inició hace 30 años como costurera independiente atendiendo pequeños trabajos de confección, ahora recibe pedidos en el mercado y de gente particular los cuales entrega por lo general los días viernes de cada semana. 

Asimismo Marlin es costurera y realiza trabajos de corte y confección y Coralia tiene una venta de refrescos, hielo, helados y otros productos en su casa.
texts.en:
The Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios solidarity group consists of Arcadia Gertrudis, Marlin, and Coralia del Socorro, three hard-working and driven women.

The group coordinator is Arcadia, who makes and sells clothing (pants, blouses, etc.).  She started this business 30 years ago as an independent seamstress taking care of small sewing jobs.  Now she takes orders in the market and from private individuals, which she generally delivers weekly on Friday.

Marlin, also a seamstress, does dressmaking jobs.  Coralia has a business selling soft drinks, ice cream, and other products in her home.

loans.use: to buy primary materials such as cloth, threat, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Daisy Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Daisy Xiomara se ha dedicado desde hace vario tiempo a la venta de abarrotaría, en su negocio atiende a sus clientes de lunes a domingo desde las 7 AM a las 5 PM, vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar al por mayor y al detalle.

Sus clientes son los amigos y personas que visitan a diario el mercado, Daisy tiene una buena forma de atender o tratar a sus clientes, es por esta razón que la prefieren y sus productos se le venden rapido.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, desea tener mas surtido su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.

Su sueño es que su hijo que esta en los estados unidos este muy bien.
texts.en:
Señora Daisy Xiomara has worked for quite a while selling groceries.  She tends to her customers from Monday through Sunday, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.  She sells everything related to basic family needs at wholesale and retail.

Her customers are her friends and people who visit the market daily.  Daisy has a good way of tending to and treating her customers, and for this reason they prefer her, and her products turn over quickly.

The loan will be used for the purchase of groceries.  She wants to have her business better stocked to generate greater earnings.

Her dream is that her son, who is in the United States, does well.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, powdered milk, cereal, oats, honey, cookies, coffee, bread, sodas, fritters, spices, salt, soap, disinfectants, batteries, candles, gas, matches, and eggs.

loans.name: Maria  Concepcion

texts.es: La Sra  Concepción es una persona muy  responsable que se preocupa   día  con día  por  salir  adelante,  actualmente  ella   vive  con  su  hija  la  cual  se  encuentra  muy  contenta  por  que   acaba de adquirir   su  casa es por  ello  que   acudieron  con nosotros   por  que  desean  levantar  las  bardas de la  vivienda a  donde  se  irán  a  vivir   y  ya  no pagaran  renta,  es  por  ello  que  se están agradecidas  por el  apoyo   brindado para  la realización de  su   proyecto  ya  que   ven en el crédito la posibilidad  de  vivir  cómodamente  y  proteger su  domicilio  de la  inseguridad.
texts.en: Concepción is a very responsable person who worries everyday about getting by.  Currently, she lives with her daughter who finds herself very content because she just acquired a house.  It if for this reason she came to us because they want to raise protective walls around the home where they are going to live and where they will longer have to pay rent.  For this, they are grateful for the support provided for the termination of the project since they see that with the loan is the possibility of living comfortably and protecting their residence from insecurity.

loans.use: to construct a protective wall around their home.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat) at Elmina. She cooks food like banku, fufu and kokonte (starchy recipes using plantain, cassava, yam and corn). She is married and has 5 children.  Her husband is a trader. She assists her husband to take care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy food items to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Esmeralda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Esmeralda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Las Primaveras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Primaveras. Formado a finales del mes de setiembre, son de la ciudad de Pilar. Se da inicio al grupo luego de realizar cuatro visitas de conformación. Durante la formación del grupo se mostraron bastante contentas por acceder al grupo, ya que nos han adelantado las ideas de negocios que tienen y las actividades comerciales que realizan a diario para solventar los gastos del hogar y mantener el negocio. Las integrantes del comité se destacan por el sacrificio y las ganas de progresar, muchas de ellas son madres solteras y luchan diariamente por el sustento de sus hijos y familiares.
Una de las miembros es la señora Gladys. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, trabajo que le trae buenos ingresos. Dice que tiene muchos clientes, ya que la mayoría son vecinos del barrio, tiene muy buenas ventas en especial los fines de semana, que es cuando la mayoría de las personas están en sus casas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra bebidas, como ser cervezas y vinos. Los mismos tienen mucha salida, por lo que quiere tener un buen stock de los mismos.
texts.en:
Las Primaveras Group. Formed at the end of the month of September, they are from the city of Pilar. Initiation into the group is made after four formation visits. During the formation of the group they showed themselves to be sufficiently happy to join the group, since they shared their business plans with us as well as their daily commercial activities which are carried out to cover household costs and business maintenance. The members of the group are characterized by sacrifice and a desire to progress. Many of them are single mothers and struggle daily to provide for their children and relatives.

One of the members is Gladys. She mentions that she sells all kinds of beverages - work which brings her a good income. She says that she has many clients. Given that the majority are from her neighborhood, she has very good sales especially on weekends, which is when most people are at home.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of beverages, such as beer and wine. These sell well, so she wants to have a good stock of them.

loans.use: to purchase wine and beer to supply their store.

loans.name: Peter Morlai's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  This school, established in 1978, is staffed with six teachers and has about 200 pupils. The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their mere salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-six-year-old Peter is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Makeni. Peter is married and has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Peter has served in the teaching profession for 34 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 38 years-old and married with one child. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Alexander manages his two hectares of rice field in their village. He is happy that he has maintained his farming business for ten years. Alexander wishes to maintain his business and increase it with the area he plants.  

Alexander practices farming and is able to finance his farm by borrowing from traders. However, he knows that traders have high interest rates. He has no choice because he needs to maintain his business and gain income for his family. Alexander wants to lessen his costs, so he prefers to ask for a loan from Kiva partner ASKI in the amount of P35,000 in order to buy needed farm materials.  He plans to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay farming labor costs.

Alexander will ensure that he will gain a higher income so that he will maintain the business and invest in his agricultural land.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for farming labor cost.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Alberto a sus 28 años de edad es padre de tres hijos de 6, 4 y 2 de edad, se dedica desde hace más de 4 años a la venta de mercancía, esta labor la realiza en los pueblos cercanos a la ciudad de Medellín. El señor Luis Alberto trabaja solo, su metodología es viajar cada 15 días a cobrar y llevar más mercancía a los diferentes pueblos donde tiene sus clientes. El señor Luis Alberto desea comprar surtido referente a la época de navidad y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y a la vez mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El señor Luis Alberto sueña con tener su propio almacén con gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Alberto is 28 years old and the father of three children (ages 6, 4, and 2). He has been selling merchandise for more than four years. Luis conducts business in the towns near the city of Medellín. He works alone. His routine includes traveling every 15 days to collect payments. This allows him to bring more merchandise to different towns where he has customers.

Sr. Luis Alberto wants to buy merchandise for the Christmas season so that he can increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life. He dreams of having his own store with a wide variety of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Bernardina;  La socia tiene 55 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 4 hijos de 27, 20, 19, 15 años de edad; La socia trabaja vendiendo papa al por mayor de sus cultivo en la feria dominical, también la socia compra y venta de animales menores como gallinas ponedoras de huevos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 20 gallinas ponedoras para incrementar el negocio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru". The community bank can be found in the district of Urcos in the province of Quispicanchis in the Cusco department.
The member's name is Bernadina. She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children of 27, 20, 19, and 15 years of age. She works selling potatoes in bulk in the Sunday market and she also buys and sells small animals such as laying hens. She is requesting a loan to buy 20 laying hens to grow her business.
She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments according to the timetable.

loans.use: to buy 20 laying hens to grow her business.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad, originaria de León, de 59 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene un hijo. Ella es comerciante, su nivel de estudio es bien básico pues solo finalizo el sexto grado de la primaria. Pero no ha dejado de buscar como progresar en la vida. Inicio su negocio de venta de comida en el año 1979. Con capital propio, sus primeros platillos fueron sopas en especial su famosa ¨Sopa de res¨ después vendió arroz aguado otro plato tradicional en la cocina nicaragüense este platillo tuvo mucha aceptación por parte de sus clientela tanto así que hoy en día es muy solicitado. Toda esta experiencia que tiene en el arte culinario la obtuvo cuando trabajo de cocinera en un restaurante, de ahí le surgió la idea de poner ella misma su negocio de vente de comida, pues gracias a esas negocio ha sobrevivido ella y su hijo quien le ayuda en el negocio. Hoy en día vende en el mercado central de la ciudad de León lleva 32 años dedicándose a esta actividad.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de arroz, verduras, carnes, leña, aceite para elaborar sus deliciosos y apetecidos platillos. A ella les gustaría ir mejorando su casa poco a poco en especial la cocina que es donde se elaborar sus comidas, darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio para hacerlo mas atractivo al publica donde se brinde un buen servicio y las personas se sientan muy a gusto de estar ahí disfrutando la comida.
texts.en:
Trinidad, 59, is from León and single, and she has a son.  She is a merchant who got only as far as 6th grade in elementary school.  But that does not stop her from seeking ways to get ahead.  She started her food business in 1979 with her own capital.  The first dishes she offered were soups, especially her famous "Beef Soup".  Then she sold rice soup, another traditional Nicaraguan dish that became so popular among her customers that today it is number one on the list.  

Her expertise in culinary art was obtained working as a cook in a restaurant.  There she got the idea to set up her own food business which has provided her and her son with enough income to survive.  Currently she sells her goods at the central market in the city of León.  She has been in business for 32 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, vegetables, meat, firewood and oil to make her delicious specialties.  She enjoys fixing up her house little by little, especially the kitchen which is where she cooks.  She wants to make her business more attractive to the public, offering good service and a place to enjoy her food.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables, meat, firewood and oil.

loans.name: Zoila Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999, Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ciudad que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 22, 20, 19 y 18 años de edad, su primer y último hijo trabaja y le ayudan económicamente, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente y su tercera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia y vive arrendando.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palito), esta actividad la realiza hace 25 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. En su casa también cría aves para la venta.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne, salchichas, papas, aceite, etc. para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es comprarse un terreno para construir su casa
texts.en:
Mrs. Zoila is a member of the communal bank "Cristo del Consuelo" and lives in the city of Cuenca, which in December, 1999, was designated as a World Heritage Site.  The city is a mix of colonial and modern and its people maintain their parents' culture and traditions.

Zoila, 43, is a single mother of four children, ages 22, 20, 19 and 18.  Her eldest and youngest sons work and help her economically.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently and her other daughter attends school in the city.  They live in a rented house.

Zoils earns a living selling "chuzos" (meat on a stick) and has been in business for 25 years.  She workins Sunday to Sunday and has no fixed work schedule.  She also raises chickens that she sells.

She has been a member in the communal bank for four years.  The new loan will be used to buy meat, sausages, potatoes, oil, etc., to continue with her business.

Her goal is to buy land and to build a house.

loans.use: To buy meat, sausages, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en uno de los barrios de la ciudad de Caaguazú, son 22 mujeres quienes se agruparon para formar un  comité solidario, las mismas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espiritu emprendedor y de ayuda mutua. Actualmente estan en el 10° ciclo fortaleciéndose día a día para llegar a la meta y cumplir sus sueños y objetivos.
Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene una pequeña peluquería en la cual trabaja todos los días, comenta que siempre tiene muchos clientes, lo cual le ayuda de sobremanera, ya que gracias a esto tiene los medios necesarios para poder mantener a su familia. Su objetivo es ir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando en la casa.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación para comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, baños de crema, tintes y demás insumos. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que esta recibiendo por parte de fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed in one of the neighborhoods of the city of Caaguazú. They are 22 women who got together to form a solidarity group. They are very hard-working and responsible women, who have a spirit of enterprise and helping one another. Currently, they are in their 10th loan cycle, getting stronger day by day, in order to reach their goals and fulfill their dreams and objectives. 

Gloria is a very hard-working woman, and has a small hair salon, where she works every day. She says that she always has a lot of customers, which helps her greatly, because thanks to this she has the means necessary to be able to support her family.

She is applying for the Foundation's help to buy supplies for her hair salon, such as shampoo, rinses, cream rinses, dyes, and other supplies. She is thankful for this opportunity for progress that she is receiving from Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, rinses, cream rinses, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Étoile Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe ÉTOILE sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
MARIAM fait le commerce de pagnes dans ce groupe de femmes ÉTOILE,    elle se tient  au milieu en position debout.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 15 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako.  Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of Étoile Group are mainly married women, who average 32 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou II, a working-class neighborhood in Sikasso (Third Administrative Region of Mali).

They are seeking their sixth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mariam is a member of this group who sells pagnes (colorful African cloth). She's the one standing in the middle in the photograph.

She intends to use her loan to buy 15 pieces of pagnes Wax at the Grand Market in Bamako. She resells them for cash, at a fixed spot at the Grand Market in Sikasso, as well as at her home, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 11.500 (ca US$ 22), to be used in part to repay the loan, and in part to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of "pagnes Wax" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Brenda mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo menor de 15 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 5 años. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 9 años, el crédito lo solicita para comprar mercadería de ropa como faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, camisetas, camisolas, talladores, trajes de niñas, trajes de niños, faldas jeans, etc. Meylin mujer de 31 años su negocio es la venta de variedades como ropa y zapatos y María joven de 24 años y su negocio es una pulpería.
texts.en:
It is a group composed of three women with small businesses, one of whom is Brenda. She is 41 years old, single and has a 15 year old son. Her business is the sale of clothing and cosmetics, which she has been doing for 5 years.

Brenda has been a member of the banking institution for 9 years now. She will use the loan to buy clothing products, such as skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, T-shirts, camisoles, brassieres, dresses for girls, suits for boys, jeans, etc.

The other members of the group are Meylin, a 31 year old woman who sells varied products like clothes and shoes, and María, who is 24 years old and has a general store.

loans.use: To buy new clothing products for sale, such as skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, T-shirts, camisoles, brassieres, dresses for girls, suits for boys, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Melba Liduvina

texts.en:
My name is Melba C., and I have a store in my house. I sell canned goods and spices to add flavor to the meals. I distribute them to stores in the city where I live. I’ve been in this business for several years, and it allows me to cover my family’s expenses, and to support my three kids’ education. During Christmas season, sales go up, and I don’t have enough money to stock up and satisfy the demand.

Loan Use: Purchase spices, saffron, cinnamon, cloves, garlic powder, black pepper, etc.

Mi nombre es Melba C. cuento con un negocio en mi casa de habitación, de embasado y venta de condimentos el que es utilizado para dar el buen zason a las comidas, el que distribuyo de manera ambulante en todas las pulperias de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de estudio de mis hijos (3) para la epoca de navidad las ventas aumentan y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda

loans.use: Compra de Especias, achiote,azafran, canela, clavos de olor, ajo en polvo, sonsome, pimienta y otros.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and has five children. She has been trained by Rafode in business management and loan use, and has managed this business for the last three years.

Given the loan, she plans to diversify her business by stocking fresh milk. Therefore the capital will be used to buy a cooler and stock. The profits will be used to educate her children and finish building her house.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stock.

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Starting from childhood looking after his family's livestock, Sulton dreamt about his own farm. His father instilled love of animals in all his children and nowadays they are all in business with livestock raising and fattening. Together with his elder brother, Sultan would go to all the neighboring markets to buy bulls and cows.

A year ago Sulton got his first loan of $300. Having added his own money, he bought 12 young bulls of the same breed for himself from neighboring Kyrgystan. As it turned out, the bulls were of tribal breed, so after 4 months of their sale, it turned out that Sulton had doubled the money he had received. From that time on, he constantly buys and raises this breed. All his family is engaged in his business. Sulton's son already knows all the details of this business and helps his father.

Now Sulton is planning to modernize and expand the place he keeps his animals. He needs $ 1200 to do this. Sulton will add his savings and prepare the place, as he intends to expand his business even more.

loans.use: Expansion of business place

loans.name: Muzambil

texts.en:
Muzambil is 25 years old, married, and has 2 small children. For several years she has been selling children's clothes in the central market of Isfara city. Her husband works in administration at the same market. Their two incomes support the household. Muzambil's mother-in-law helps her by looking after the children while Muzambil is at work.

Muzambil's inventory is quite varied and includes children's clothes for every age group. The goods she sells are high quality; that's why she always has regular customers.

Muzambil has been a client of MicroInvest since December 2005. The loans she has received have been essential in her attempt to increase the volume of her business. She used to purchase her goods from the nearest wholesale markets, but now she goes to Karosuu of Kyrgyzstan Republic to do her buying. This allows her to make additional profit on her sales.

Now Muzambil is requesting a loan of $1200 so that she can further expand her business.

loans.use: expand her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đỗ Thị Tuyết is 45 years old. She is a member of TYM fund since 2001. In the beginning the loans were of small amounts so she could only use it to buy goods to resell. The profit margin was small, it was difficult. As a side job, she offered child care service for the families in her neighborhood. The demand was so great that the idea of opening a child care center was germinated in her head. She consulted her family members about this and decided to do so. At first, there were a lot of obstacles: lack of capital, lack of material and especially the paperwork procedure from the Education Ministry was lengthy and complicated. It also took a lot of effort and time to attend "child care education" classes to obtain the permit. After a few years of hard work and dedication, everything was set in place. She gained trust and support from everyone including the Education Ministry and her customers. Her husband is very supportive, everyday he goes to the market to buy grocery to prepare food for the kids. The child care center is quite neat, there are 5 classes under the supervision of 5 teachers specialized in young children education. There are about 100 kids attending the child care center. Ms Tuyết is a examplary member for the Xuân Hòa branch of TYM fund. She requests a loan of 750 USD to buy toys for her child care center

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Cô Đỗ Thị Tuyết, 45 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2001, lúc ban đầu vay vốn nhỏ cô chỉ bán hàng nước nên nguồn thu nhập còn rất khó khăn. Ý tưởng nảy sinh từ khi cô chỉ nhận trông giúp hai ba trẻ ở trong khu tập thể, thấy nhu cầu gửi trẻ của các gia đình rất nhiều cô đã bàn bạc với gia đình mở lớp tư thục, công việc khi đó gặp rất nhiều khó khăn, thiếu vốn, thiếu cơ sở vật chất … và nhất là xin giấy phép của UBND phường, Phòng giáo dục Thị xã, đặc biệt là việc tham gia lớp bồi dưỡng giáo viên mầm non. Sau nhiều năm kiên trì thì mọi việc đã trở nên thuận lợi, chính quyền và nhân dân rất tin tưởng và ủng hộ cô, đặc biệt là chồng cô, hiện tại chồng cô hàng ngày giúp cô đi chợ mua thức ăn cho trẻ. Cơ ngơi của cô đã khá khang trang với 5 phòng học, 5 cô giáo chuyên môn và gần 100 trẻ. Cô Tuyết đã thực sự là một trong những thành viên điển hình của phường Xuân Hòa nói riêng và chi nhánh 3 Phúc yên nói chung. Chị Tuyết đang làm đơn xin vay 750 USD để mua đồ chơi cho trẻ trong trường của mình.

loans.use: Buy toys for her child care center

loans.name: Elis

texts.en: Elis is 33 years old and has a 14 year old child. She has  been selling food at her small stall and also selling cosmetics on credit. She previously closed down her business due to  being short of capital. Now she is starting her business again and could earn US$5 per day. She really needs a loan to buy more goods and hopes that she can earn more income to support her family needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru:
Abdugaffor H. is 34 years old, he has a secondary education. He is married and has 3 children. Abdugaffor has been selling mens shoes for the past 10 years. He is renting a space in the Yavan town market which is called Tidjorat. He is planning to use his loan towards purchasing of a new assortment of shoes for the winter. The loan will also provide the residents the ability to buy shoes in their own town because the next closest market is located more than 80 kilometers from the town of Yavan.

Abdugaffor is planning to pay off the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайтов Абдугаффор, возраст – 34 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Абдугаффор уже в течение 10 занимается продажей мужской обувью. Для этого он арендуют торговую точку на центральном рынке города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести новый ассортимент зимней обуви. Данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать зимную обувь у себя в районе, так как близлежащий рынок находится на расстояние более 80 километров от города Явана.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes for the winter season

loans.name: Ruksara

texts.en: Ruksara was born in 1962, is the mother of one child. and lives in Khachmaz town.  2 years ago she opened an Internet cafe where she teaches students how to use computers, computer programs, and the Internet.  Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy another computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am 33, married and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. I reside with my family in the mid-size town of Multan, Pakistan. My husband has a grocery store where he sells all kinds of goods that consumers use daily. He feels that his business can do even better if he increases the inventory in his store, but he lacks the needed financing. You can help us do this through this loan.

There are several other women in my group who would like to have loans: Alia sells garments; Naheed A.’s husband is a jeweler; Saira Y. is divorced and operates a beauty salon; Humaira F. will invest her share of the loan in her family’s yarn machines.

loans.use: Increase inventory in the grocery store

loans.name: Nurul Masita

texts.id:
Nurul Masita sells various delicacies like cookies and small cakes that are individually wrapped. The ingredients are purchased in Kerobokan Market in the evening. Then those ingredients are cooked the next morning. She then delivers the finished products to local kiosks around her home and local market. Nurul's husband works as a contract construction labor who earns about $40 per week if he has work. Nurul has two children, one in middle school and another in grade school. The earnings from her business is used to pay for her children's school tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Nurul Masita mempunyai usaha berjualan jajanan basah seperti kue-kue dan makanan siap saji yang sudah dibungkus dengan kertas makanan. Bahan-bahan untuk membuat makanan diperolehnya dari pasar Kerobokan pada waktu sore hari, kemudian bahan-bahan tersebut diolahnya pada pukul 05.00 pagi hari. Setelah semua masakan telah siap jajanan basah dan makanan siap saji tersebut di antar ke warung-warung yang ada di sekitar rumah Nurul dan sebagian lagi di jual di pasar Kerobokan. Nurul mempunyai suami yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan yang berpenghasilan 350.000 rupiah/minggu dan itu didapat jikalau ada proyek bangunan yang harus dikerjakan. Nurul mempunyai dua orang anak yang sedang bersekolah di SMP dan Sekolah Dasar, usahanya sebagai penjual jajanan basah dan makanan siap saji untuk menopang biaya sekolah anak-anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Ingredients

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Señor Jorge Téllez lives in the Ríos de Ticuantepe neighborhood. He is married, is 38-years-old, and has one son who is in school. His wife is a secretary and works.

He makes a living by farming and has 20 years of experience. He started with his own money, and he will use this loan to purchase agricultural supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Jorge Téllez, vive en el barrio los Ríos de Ticuantepe es casado con 38 años de edad, le tienen un hijo actualmente estudia su esposa es secretaria y trabaja.

Se dedica al cultivo agrícola tiene vente años de experiencia comenzó con su propio dinero, y el préstamo lo quiere invertir para la compra de insumos agrícolas.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives with her daughter and mother in rented accommodation in Street D in the neighbourhood of Las Lomas in La Paz. Her job is recycling garbage. She sorts it according to demand: cardboard, glass, paper, used clothes etc, which she then sells by the kilo. Her mother helps her with this work, and they manage to get by if they live very frugally.

With this loan, Maria will have enough capital to buy a special machine to cut up the clothing. A machine would make this work a lot easier. Her previous credit history with IMPRO is good, and she qualifies for another loan. She has been a client of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en alquiler en la calle D de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de la Paz con su hija y su mama; ella se dedica al reciclaje de basura, es decir que ella recicla basura y la selecciona según le pidan cartones, botellas, papel y ropa usada, etc., para luego vender por Kilo. Este trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de su madre y con este negocio pueden mantenerse y cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que la ropa usada la tiene que cortar y para eso necesita una maquina especial para cortar, lo cual le facilitará su trabajo. Su antecedente crediticio con IMPRO es bueno por lo cual puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To buy a special machine to cut up the used clothing she receives through her recycling business and then re-sells by weight.

loans.name: Eleitino

texts.en: Eleitino T., 60, is married with four children. She's the centre chief of their community of 14 ladies, with only 2 members who are inactive. Her business is going really strong, with the support of her children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Eleitino’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her grandson's school fees.

loans.use: Eleitino would like to purchase pesticides and chemicals for her plantation.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old and is married with five children. She is a very hard working woman and is dedicated to minimizing poverty. She is a serious business woman and works in trade. She has been successfully trading maize, beans, peanuts and charcoal for the past ten years. It is her family's primary source of income. Beatrice wants to use the loan to buy larger supply of products  to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current country's food crisis. She is a member of the trust group Platinum. Platinum members guarantee one another as social collateral and provide support for themselves to help repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger supply of maize, beans, peanut, eggs and charcoal.

loans.name: Semka

texts.en:
Semka lives with her family at the village Doborovci, near the town Gračanica. Her husband has a full-time job working in Croatia. He can earn about 1500 KM. Semka has one cow and she sells milk and milk products. She can earn about 300 KM doing this. She has two children, 14 and 19 years old, and both of them are going to school.

This is Semka's first loan in the amount of 1200 KM and her intent is to buy one more cow in order to increase milk production. With bigger milk production she will increase the monthly income for her household.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Claudia Liliana

texts.es:
Claudia inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su marido con los gastos de los estudios de sus pequeños hijos de 6 y 4 años, además de los gastos del hogar. Comenzó su tienda de abarrotes hace más de 2 años en su domicilio, pero sus padres tienen muchos años de ser comerciantes de abarrotes y carnicería.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su negocio, ya que esta tomando un curso de belleza y quiere dividir la tienda para en un lado establecer un salón de belleza
texts.en:
Claudia started her business to help her husband pay for their children's education -- they are 6 and 4 years old -- as well as the household expenses. She opened her grocery store in her home over 2 years ago, but her parents have been business owners of both a grocery store and butcher shop for years.

She needs a loan of $750 US ($1 US = 3 soles, approx.), which she will repay in 6 months, to remodel her business. She is taking a beauty course and she'd like to open a beauty salon on one side of the space.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel her business

loans.name: Kimhun

texts.en: Mrs. Kimhun Y., 53, is a rice farmer, and her husband, Mr. Oem Phalla, 54, is a horse cart taxi driver. The couple have five children and live in Speu Kert Village, Kompong Cham Province. Kimhun earns around $1.50 per day while her husband earns $2 per day. Two of their children are married and the rest are single.
