Kimhun now requests a loan of $400 to buy one more horse to improve her husband's horse-cart business.

loans.use: To buy one more horse to improve horse-cart business

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhim B. was born in 1968 and now lives in Trapaing Sla Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a 40-year-old widow with three children. One child is a teacher who makes a small salary to support the household. Another one is employed in a garment factory and the third has emigrated to work in Malaysia.

Mrs. Sokhim B. is a farmer and owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from working on her plantation, she is also a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. With the rest of the loan, she will buy food and medication for her animals.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Messavi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur de trente deux ans d’âge est un revendeur de produit d’alimentation générale est un monsieur qui lutte beaucoup pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux des autres membres de sa famille. Il est célibataire et réside dans le quartier de tokoin doumasséssé où il exerce ce commerce. Monsieur K. a déjà obtenu un crédit de chez WAGES qu’il a remboursé régulièrement selon les échéances et sans difficultés. La demande ayant  augmenté surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année, il sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour répondre à la demande avec l’achat de 05 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huiles, 10 cartons de spaghettis et 10 cartons de lait.
texts.en:
This 32-year-old gentleman sells general food products and he struggles a lot to meet not only his own needs, but also those of his family members. He is unmarried and lives in the Tokoin Doumasséssé area where his business is. Mr. K. has already taken out one previous loan with WAGES which he is repaying according to the payment deadlines with no problems. Given that demand has gone up, particularly during the periods of the year-end festivals, he is requesting this loan so he can satisfy his customers’ needs by purchasing five sacks of rice, 10 jugs of oil, 10 cartons of spaghetti, and 10 cartons of milk.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. Celestina is 56 years old and is married, with six children, two of whom she still supports. Celestina sells different kinds of lumber to builders. She employs several workers, who cut the wood to size. 

Celestina is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy a truckload of tornillo and eucalyptus wood. Each truckload costs between 2800 and 3000 soles, so this loan will pay for most of the wood she needs. Her goal for the future is to proviD. well for her two youngest children, who are still dependent on her.

loans.use: Buy a truckload tornillo and eucalyptus wood

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora” vive en Martínez de Compañón Nº 1345, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 44 años y es madre de 4 hijos, 3 son mayores de edad y 1 todavía depende de ella. Es soltera.
Victoria con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra de gaseosas, refrescos, para venderlos en un local ubicado en su domicilio. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con una bodega de venta de abarrotes, en un lugar acondicionado de su domicilio, lo que genera ingresos diarios para pagar las cuotas del banco con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 2.000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara 2 sacos de arroz, fréjol de todas las variedades, detergentes de todos los tamaños y marcas, azúcar en saco, jabón en caja  y además bebidas gasificadas.

Victoria manifiesta estar muy agradecida con el banco por el apoyo brindado y por la oportunidad de crecer como mujer.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the “Maria Auxiliadora” Community Bank and lives in the Tarapoto district of San Martín. She is 44 years old, single, and the mother of four children. Three of her children are grown, while one is still dependent on her.

Victoria has been working with the bank for eight years. She invested her first loan, for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $95), in the purchase of soft drinks to sell from a shop in her home. She has since developed her shop into a well-equipped grocery store which generates enough income to enable her to repay her loans on time.

With this loan (for 2,000 nuevos soles [US $625], to be repaid in six months), Victoria will buy 2 sacks of rice, a variety of beans, various brands and sizes of laundry detergent, sacks of sugar, cases of soap, and soft drinks.

Victoria is very grateful to the bank for their support and for the opportunity they have given her to grow as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en: Hussain is a 30-year-old married man, living in A. Shwaifat in Mount Lebanon. He has owned a barbershop for the past year, after working for 10 years in the field. Today, he wants to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy a new vapor machine for the hair and skin to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.use: Buy a new vapor machine for the hair and skin

loans.name: María

texts.es: Con muchos años de trabajo, María y su esposo lograron adquirir una casa donde vivir y un medio de trabajo con el cual solventarse, y a sus 68 años, sigue con la misma vitalidad de seguir adelante junto su familia. El empeño que siempre tuvo al realizar sus diversas actividades le ayudó a desempeñarse  adecuadamente en su trabajo actual, pues obtuvo mucha experiencia, y hace 3 años tuvo la posibilidad de adquirir dos motocarros, y desde entonces se dedica a la administración de los ingresos diarios del servicio de transporte de pasajeros que realizan. Sus hijos son los que trabajan manejando las motos y en algunas ocasiones las alquilan por día. Estar pendiente de este negocio no es muy difícil, pues solo tiene que controlar las horas de salida y servicio, y sobre todo ver si el vehículo está siendo utilizado cuidadosamente. Y para no sentirse inactiva, María también vende comida en la puerta de su cada, retomando sus habilidades como vendedora, sin dejar de lado la administración de sus motos. La permanencia de doña Maria en MFP es de 7 años y este es su treceavo préstamo, lo que la llena de alegría, pues el compartir con sus compañeras es grato, por el bonito grupo de trabajo que conforman. El dinero que solicita esta vez es para el mantenimiento de sus motos y para la compra de utensilios y víveres para retomar la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Through many years of work, Maria and her husband were able to have a house to live in and a means of employment to support themselves. At 68 years of age, she continues to have the same vitality to get ahead together with her family. The drive she always had to perform her different activities helps her to carry out her current work and she has gained a lot of experience. Three years ago she had the opportunity to acquire two motorcycles and since then has been administrating the daily income from their passenger transportation service. Her children are the ones who drive the motorcycles and occasionally they rent them by day. Keeping an eye on this business is not very difficult, as she only has to control the hours the vehicles leave and their service, and above all see that the vehicle is being used carefully. So that she does not feel inactive, Marian also sells meals from her front door, using her abilities as a saleswoman while not neglecting the administration of her motorcycles. Doña Maria has been with MFP for 7 years and this is her thirteenth loan. This makes her happy, as sharing with her fellow members is pleasant because they make a nice working group. The money she requests this time is for maintenance of her motorcycles and to buy utensils and supplies for the sale of food.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for motorcycles and investment in a food business

loans.name: Elencith

texts.es:
La señora Elencith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Jr. Nereo Cabello cdra. 01, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que todavía dependen de ella.

Se inicio con S/. 500.00 por iniciativa propia, emprendió su  propio negocio de preparación y venta de almidón. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de preparación y venta de almidón, ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son los panificadoras de la comunidad y de otras ciudades de la región.
Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 que cancelara a un  plazo de 04  meses, invertirá comprando 20 sacos de yucas. Al mismo tiempo también se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, y parte del dinero lo invertirá en materiales de construcción.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Elencith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Elenctih belongs to the Commuanl Bank "Corazón de Jesûs" ("Heart of Jesus"). She lives in Jr. Nereo Cabello cdra. 01, San José de Sisa District, San Martín Department. She is married, 27 years old, and is mother to two children who still depend on her.

She started with a loan of 500 soles by her own initiative. She started her own business preparing and selling starch. She has worked with her Communal Bank for four years.

Today she continues with the same business of preparing and selling starch. Her business is located in her house, where her main clients are industrial bakers in the community and other cities of the region.

With the loan of 2000 soles, which will be paid back in four months, she will invest in buying 20 sacks of yucca. At the same time, she also rents out rooms, and she will invest part of the money in construction materials.

She makes the financial decisions in her business. As a borrower, she personally feels more independent, secure, and responsible than before.

Elencith is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 20 sacks of yucca and constructional materials

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 31-year old engaged man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon. Bassam has been working as a car painter and repairer for eight years. He has requested a loan of $3000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Bassam does his work well and he is trustworthy. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started, he had to face competition. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing a paint oven for his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est conducteur de taxi à Wome. Agé de 48 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il désire avec ce crédit faire la révision générale de sa voiture et payer un nouveau moteur. Il avait déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à la FECECAV et avait promptement honoré son engagement. Ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Kokou A. is a taxi driver in Wome. At 48 years of age, he is married and the father of 3 children. He wants to use this loan to have his car overhauled and pay for a new motor. He has already had a loan from FECECAV and promptly repaid it. This loan will allow him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: have his taxi overhauled and pay for a new motor

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en: Nazih, a 39-year-old married man living with his wife in Al Hadath in Mount Lebanon, has been working as a DJ and party organizer since 1994.  With 14 years of experience in the field, Nazih is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a musical instrument.

loans.use: To purchase a musical instrument.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en: Zita C. is from the town of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old, married, and has two adult children. Zita owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Zita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijas; Daniela de 5 años y Mayori de 2 en la casa que le cedieron sus padres. Tras haber sufrido un terrible accidente hace 20 días atrás, Alicia ha quedado con heridas en su cuerpo y en el rostro, por eso se cubre la cara con una chalina para evitar que el sol genere mayores infecciones. Antes de este accidente trabajaba diariamente en las chacras de sus padres y de suegros; últimamente, con su esposo, decidieron sembrar papas y arvejas dejando a sus pequeñas al cuidado de su madre. A ella le gusta mucho el labrado de la tierra ya que lo  realizó desde muy pequeña y ahora que está descansando por sus dolencias se aburre mucho en su casa. Desde entonces, su esposo solo viene trabajando en los cultivos y ella espera  pronto poder recuperarse para realizar las cosechas, ya que es la época más trabajosa, pero una vez pasada esa temporada siente tranquilidad hasta la próxima siembra. Su deseo a futuro es poder adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, pero su esposo trabajó en los ciclos pasados en su banco comunal y demostró pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Cabe mencionar que Alicia acude a todas las reuniones en compañía de su esposo, ya que son muy comprometidos en los trabajos de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicitan lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y algunas medicinas para su recuperación oportuna.
texts.en:
Alicia is 27 years old and lives her husband and their two daughters, Daniela, 5, and Mayori, 2, in a home given to her by her parents. After suffering a terrible accident 20 days ago, Alicia was left with injuries to her body and face, which is why she covers her face with a scarf to block out the sun and stave off worse infections. Before the accident, she worked daily on the fields of her parents and in-laws. Ultimately, she and her husband decided to plant potatoes and peas of their own while they left their daughter in the care of Alicia's mother. Alicia really enjoys working on the land because it's something she has done since she was very little, and now that she is recovering from her ailments at home she is very bored. Since then, her husband has been the only one working on the crops, and she hopes she'll be able to get better soon so she can help with the harvest since that's when the most work is required, but once it passes everything relaxes until the next planting. Her wish for the future is to be able to acquire her own land to cultivate. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and her husband has worked with loans in the past with his communal bank and has shown himself to be punctual with his payments. With the money Alicia is currently requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers and some medicines for her speedy recovery.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph A. is married and has four children. His wife is a fishmonger. Joseph has no educational status.

Joseph sells fresh fish at Elmina, which he has done since 2000. Joseph uses his income to pay school fees and other expenses.

Joseph will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to further his children’s education and also to save the rest.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda S., 29, is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, where she is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Cresilda owns and operates a business venture selling food snacks in the local community. Engaged in this business for over a year, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cresilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP in order to expand the business. This loan will be her first, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Xiomara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Xiomara está formado por tres productores y vendedores de verduras y frutas; Ellos provienen de  la ciudad de Masaya, de zonas aledañas donde el principal rubro es el cultivo de las tierras.

Rosa Esther M. D., es la coordinadora del grupo, a sus 39 años es una productora de frutas y verduras, que conoció ADIM hace 3 años y desde entonces ha mejorado los ingresos por sus productos.

Ella distribuye sus productos en el mercado oriental de Managua. Está muy contenta con su trabajo, tiene nueve ciclos de estar trabajando con el grupo Xiomara y han sido muy responsables con sus créditos por que sus negocios son muy  buenos. Su crédito lo invertirá en lo que cosecha de esta temporada.

Rosa Esther M. D. distribuye en el mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua y Elsa María M.  distribuye en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The group Xiomara consists of three farmers who grow and sell fruits and vegetables. They come from the city of Masaya where the main line of work is agriculture.

Rosa Esther M. D. is 39 years old and is the group coordinator. She is a fruits and vegetables farmer who has worked with ADIM (micro-finance institution) for three years and, since then, has increased her income.

She sells her products at the oriental market in Managua and she is very happy with her work. She has had nine loans with the Xiomara group. They have been very responsible with their loans and their businesses are doing very good. They will invest this loan in this year’s harvest.

Maribel Del Carmen S. sells her products at the Roberto Huembes market in Managua and Elsa María M. sells her products at the market in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This year's harvest

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions like toothpaste, bathing soap, body cream, milk, etc.

Rose hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.fr: Nicolas H. est un homme âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Badou, une ville située à 110 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un revendeur de café et cacao. Il exerce cette activité plus de 10 ans.  Avec ce crédit, Nicolas préfère faire le stock de ces produits en vue de les revendre au moment de pénurie vu la chute du prix du café et du cacao. Avec ces bénéfices, il souhaiterait exporter lui-même ces produits en créant sa propre société qui sera dénommée « ELAGNO ».

loans.use: achat de café et du cacao

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
“Do your best and God will do the rest.” This is what Rosario believes in life. She knows that God will help her with her business only if she will do her part as a businesswoman. Rosario is 51 years old and married to Noli, a known laborer in their village. They have four children; three of them are already studying. Their family lives in the village of Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. 

Rosario has been engaged in the poultry business for two years. She buys dozens of chicks from Cauayan City and sells them after 45 days. She is now asking for the support of Kiva lenders for the maintenance of her business. For this, she would like to borrow a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos that she needs to purchase more chicks and a food supply for their growth.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel Jáuregui es un soldador desde hace 6 años el su negocio llamado “Taller de Soldadura Jáuregui”   esta ubicado en su domicilio para estar cerca de la familia. El piensa en el porvenir y el patrimonio de sus hijos, es por ello que el trabaja con mucha dedicación para darles mejor calidad de vida. El en la herrería hace variedad de trabajos como protecciones para las ventanas, puertas, portones y otros. Ahora el esta requiriendo de una maquina para soldar por que la tiene ya ha tenido mucho uso el cual  se esta deteriorando y empieza a fallar. El viene a nuestra institución para pedir el apoyo para obtener el capital que esta requiriendo para comprar esa maquina para no detener el trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel J. has been a welder for 6 years in his business called "Taller de Soldadura J.". It is located in his home in order to be close to his family. He is thinking about the future and the inheritance of his children. For this reason, he works with a lot of dedication in order to give them a better quality of life. In his workshop he does a variety of jobs, such as making window protectors, doors, gates, and other things. Now he requires a welding machine, because the one he has is deteriorating and beginning to fail, due to a lot of use. He has come to our institution requesting the support to obtain the necessary capital to purchase this machine, in order to not stop his work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Francis Lisebeth

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Francis C. se ha dedicado desde hace doce años a la actividad de venta de queso y cuajada obteniéndolo de la materia prima que es la leche y vendiendo todos los días en su localidad.

Cuando inició en el negocio, ella vendía ambulantemente pero obtuvo un lugar que aunque no presta las condiciones necesarias logra realizar sus ventas desde las cinco de la mañana hasta que se le acaba el producto.

Ella ha solicitado el crédito con el fin de comprar los productos lácteos para continuar ofreciéndolos en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Sra. Francis C. has worked for twelve years selling cheese and curds. She makes her products from raw milk and sells them every day from her vending post.

When she started her business, Francis sold her products as a traveling merchant but having a retail space has not always provided the best conditions for making sales. She begins selling her products at 5am until she runs out of inventory.

She has requested this loan so that she can buy more dairy products. This will allow her to continue selling her products in León.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Sullcataca Alta sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Como segunda actividad  se dedica al cultivo de papa y otros en su propiedad.

Su esposa le colabora con el cuidado de su hogar y el ganado.

  
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Gerardo raises cattle, and he sells the milk that his herd produces to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). He lives in the Sullcataca Alta community in the sector of Laja, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz, located three hours outside the city of La Paz. As a second job, he also grows potatoes and other things on his land. His wife assists him in caring for their home and their herd. This loan will be used to buy a better breed of cattle, and thereby increase his milk production and his income as well. This is his first loan with Impro, and the initial assessment qualified him to be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Jessielyn

texts.en: Jessielyn M. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Jessielyn is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Jessielyn owns & operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconut in the local community. Jessielyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Jessielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessielyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jessielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is 40 years old and married with four children. He sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He is a focused, hard worker. He sells for long hours to enable him to meet the demands of his customers. His wife sells groceries to help make a living.

Dauda hopes to expand his business in the future. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with a son. He is a small businessman from Beregovo where he sells electric appliances. Yuryi runs his business in a small vending store which he also uses as his office. He started this venture 6 years ago. Presently, Yuryi has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Yuryi is seeking a 7,000 Grivnya loan to purchase additional electric appliances for future sale in his store. He is hoping to generate additional income as a result. Yuryi is very knowledgeable in financing, management and branding. All these skills help him run his business efficiently and further expand his trade.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Javier es soltero, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Javier tiene equipos de sonido que alquila para diferentes eventos, además Javier tiene un grupo musical llamado Son Caribe.
Javier necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mas equipos.
Los sueños de Javier son ampliar su negocio, tener mas equipos.
texts.en:
Javier is a member of the Communal Bank “Trigales” (Wheat Fields). He is 39 years old, single, and has two children. Javier has sound equipment that he rents out for different events. In addition, he has a musical group called “Son Caribe” (Caribbean Sound).

Javier needs a loan of 1500 soles to invest in more equipment. His dreams include expanding his business and having more equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional sound equipment

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Maria Guadalupe C. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a terminar la construcción.
Nuevamente está solicitando otro préstamo para terminar los acabados del interior del cuarto que realizo.
Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como subgerente.
texts.en:
Maria is very thankful for the previous loan which helped her complete her construction. She is now asking for another loan in order to finish the interior of the room she built. She plans to repay the loan with the income she receives from her job as an assistant manager.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete room interior

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina V. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de productos y artículos para dama por catalogo.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. Tiene un hijo pequeño bajo su responsabilidad y a quién le quiere dar lo mejor. 
Le esta haciendo falta mercancía para tenerla en exhibición y desea también empezar la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo ya que muchas de sus clientas le están pidiendo que venda. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía e iniciar el negocio de la venta de ropa, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. 
Desea tener un mayor ingreso para darle lo mejor a su hijo, planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Martina V. has sold catalogue women's articles for over three years. This business is her family's source of income; she has a small son under her care for whom she wants to provide the best. She is lacking merchandise to have on display and she also wants to start selling clothing and new shoes because many of her customers are asking for these items. She is asking for funds to buy the merchandise to be able to start the clothing and shoe sales business because she currently lacks money for such an investment. She hopes to have higher earnings to provide the best for her son; she plans to repay the loan with profits fro the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Maximo Cesar

texts.es: El  Sr. Máximo Cesar Venegas P.  El es trabajador activo del Instituto Nicaragüense de Turismo él se desempeña como ayudante de mantenimiento tiene once años de trabajar para esta empresa, es padre  de un hijo en edad escolar, es Acompañado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera llegar a terminar de construir su casa porque esta es la única forma de llegar a tener una vivienda con un techo digno
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo Cesar Venegas P. has worked for the Nicaraguan Tourism Institute as a maintenance assistant for 11 years. He has a school-age son and has a partner. He has had three loans with CEPRODEL and with each one he has made home improvements, thus being able to finish building his home as this was the only way of being able to have a home with a decent roof.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a truck load of stone

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 25-year-old single man living with his family. In 2008, he decided to open his own phone shop after five years of experience selling mobile phones and mobile accessories. In addition, he has prepared a speciA. corner of his store to sell perfumes to gain extra profit. Wassim is very confident with his decision to start his own business and he's thankful for the revenue which allows him to ameliorate his life situation. Wassim is requesting $1,000 to expand his shop by buying more mobile phones and perfumes to attract more clients.

loans.use: buying more mobile phones and perfumes

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 54 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Fidel de 56 años, que es agricultor, y de sus 3 hijos menores que le ayudan en el trabajo diario. Bajo el cielo azul de la sierra, esta trabajadora mujer empieza cada día con su faena agrícola, se despierta con los primeros rayos de sol y se dirige hacía sus campos para cuidarlos y darles mantenimiento. Elena, siembra papa, alverjas y habas, cuando es época de cosecha, su esposo la ayuda a recolectar la producción. Luego ven recompensada su labor cuando venden toda su producción a los diversos mayoristas de la zona, que cargan todo para venderlo en la ciudad. Según manifiesta, el trabajo en el campo no es tan complicado ya que todos los miembros de su familia trabajan en conjunto para salir adelante. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora, planea  aumentar su siembra de alverjas, ya que el precio de esta legumbre se mantiene estable en el mercado. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, además manifiesta su satisfacción de trabajar con todos los integrantes de su grupo comunal pues son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas y solidarios en las reuniones.
Elena tiene planeado invertir el crédito, en la compra de semillas de alverjas y papa de buena calidad, además de guano y fertilizantes para asegurar su siembra y obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Elena is 54 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband Fidel (age 56), who is a farmer, and their three young children who help them with the daily work. Beneath the blue mountain sky, this hardworking woman begins her farm work each day. She wakes up when the first rays of light appear and heads to the fields to look after and maintain her crops. Elena grows potatoes, peas, and beans. During the harvest season, her husband helps with gathering the produce. She is later rewarded for her work when she sells her crops to different wholesalers in the area, who in turn distribute her products throughout the city. According to Elena, the work in the fields is not complicated since everyone in her family helps each other to move forward. Being an enterprising woman, she plans to increase her planting of peas since the asking price in the market for this legume remains stable.

This is her third loan with MFP. Elena expresses her satisfaction with the work of all the members of her Communal Bank since they are very punctual with their loan payments and remain unified during their meetings. Elena plans to invest her loan in the purchase of high quality seeds for planting peas and potatoes. In addition, she will acquire bird droppings and fertilizers so that she can enhance her crops and obtain a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, bird droppings, and fertilizers

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is widowed with six children and all her children go to school.  She lives in a four-room house where she stays with only her children. She rears all types of chickens, i.e. broilers and layers. She owns a poultry farm in Kyebando Nsooba Kawempe Division with about 600 chickens, both layers and broilers. Tereza sells both at wholesale and at retail and gets around 20 customers a day.  Tereza wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more bags of poultry feed and 200 chicks. She has been in this business for over 10 years and with MCDT for 12 years. Tereza doesn’t have any side job. Her major customers are nearby shops and families.  Tereza works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and an increase in the price of poultry feed.  She aspires to own 1,000 chickens and a delivery van. Tereza decided to work with MCDT because it was helping poor women. She stays in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and 200 chicks

loans.name: Mamele

texts.en:
Mamele S. is 50 and married with nine children (ages 12 - 30).  She owns a business selling rice products in the local community.  Mamele has one year of experience in this business.  Mamele needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Mamele joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mamele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: 
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old man from Lebanon who, in 2009, started working as a television and electronics repairer. He decided on doing this business since he had gained experience in this field of work. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial issues, but he is a hardworking man and does his best to improve his work.

Today, for the first time, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to purchase a generator for his work. It is important to note that, in Lebanon, there are a lot of electricity shutdowns, and people need to either have their own generator, or have a subscription from someone who provides electricity.

In the future, Ali hopes to keep on improving his work, as well as his income.

loans.use: To purchase a generator for his work

loans.name: Rolando Felix

texts.es:
Rolando de 30 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayor parte de los habitantes son comerciantes de un nivel bajo). Tiene un hijo de 5 meses, el vende huevos al por mayor. 

Para garantizar la economía de su familia el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en huevos, empezó en el 2004 para independizarse, desde ese tiempo se ha dedicado a vender huevos al por mayor cada cubeta la vende a $ 2.45. Para tener mas ingresos en ocasiones vende productos químicos. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar huevos, en el futuro quiere tenr una distribuidora de huevos para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is 30 years old. He lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban area, the majority of inhabitants are lower class sales people). He has a 5-month-old son. He sells eggs wholesale. He needed to invest his savings in eggs in order to guarantee his family’s earnings. He began in 2004 to go out on his own. Since then he has worked selling eggs wholesale. He sells each carton for $2.45. He occasionally sells chemical products to earn more. He wants to buy eggs in order to continue with his business. He would like to have an egg distributor in the future to insure his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eggs

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith G. is from the village of Cabunungan, Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Judith is widowed and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Divine Favor. Group

texts.en:
Yassah G., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Divine Favor.  Yassah is 35 years old, single and has three children who range from 4 to 17 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support. She also cares for two siblings.

For six years, Yassah has been operating a beauty salon in Redlight, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.  A hard-working person, she plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more hair braiding materials including hair drier, perm, gel, shampoo, etc.

Yassah's dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more hair braiding materials such as hair drier, perm, gel, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim S. is only 23 years old but already runs his own business of plastic windows and doors. He is making it on his own.  He has two years of experience in this field. Karim`s monthly income is about $250-$450 and he would like to increase it to $625. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He wants to build his own shop and not have to pay rent.

loans.use: to build his own shop

loans.name: Benkola  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkola III constitués par sept femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Siguila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environ 1, 1 hectare de petit mil et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkola III Group are seven married women who are on average 27 years old with one child. They live in polygamous families in Siguila, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro region in the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI with the intent of better organising their wintering activities. The cash crops cultivated are millet, peanuts and beans. This is their fourth loan request, the preceding ones having been fully reimbursed. With this new loan Sali D. intends to buy agricultural inputs, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate approximately 1,1 hectares (2.7 acres) of millet and beans. After harvesting the crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to both men and women customers. By end of season group members hope to attain average earnings of approximately 50,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertiliser, herbicides, weeding and small farming equipment

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio G. is from the village of Cabaruan. He is 55 years old. Eugenio is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eugenio owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing electrical repairs in the local community. Eugenio has been engaged in his business for over 36 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eugenio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Eugenio is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Eugenio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Hermes Felipe

texts.es:
Hermes es un hombre muy trabajador, se dedica ah administrar su propio negocio. El alquiler de cuarto y  un taxi que el mismo trabaja. Casado y padre de tres hijas.
Negocio que inicio con iniciativa y con ahorros de su trabajo anterior. Atreves de los préstamo ha venido hacer las mejoras a su casa. Pues todo esta ah altos costos principalmente la canasta básica. El equilibrio lo ha logrado gracias al cuarto que alquila ya que las carreras de taxi están bajas.
Con este préstamo hará la mejora de su techo, ya que necesita mejorar esta condición en su casa. Para el bienestar familiar y que gracias a los financiamientos de la institución lo está logrando: para esto comprara: diez lamina de zinc, doce perlines,  cuatro bolsa de cemento, bidón de pintura, entre otros.
texts.en:
Hermes is a very hard working man.  He administers his own business which is a room rental and driving a taxi.  He is married and the father of three daughters.

He started his business with his own initiative and savings from a previous job.  Thanks to loans he has been making home improvements because everything, especially the basic monthly food needs, has gone up in price.  He has managed to stay even thanks to the room he rents because the taxi fares have been low.

With this loan he will improve the roof because he needs to improve this aspect of his house for his family’s wellbeing.  Thanks to the loans from the institution he is accomplishing it.  He will buy ten sheets of zinc metal, twelve metal beams, four sacks of cement, a large container of paint among others.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to reroof and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.es:
Leopoldina C. procedente de Bogotá  desde hace algo mas de tres años, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla e instaló su propio negocio  de ventas de carnes frías y también  de venta de mercancías  por catálogo, aprovechando sus buenas relaciones con la central de policía que le queda muy cerca a su vivienda y con la clínica de este mismo organismo. Así fue como inició su negocio, al que gradualmente ha ido agregando nuevos clientes y también nuevas mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos.  Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el planea provisionarse  de amplios volúmenes de carnes frías  ya  encargadas para la época de fin de año,  en la que sus clientes preparan las mas deliciosas comidas para celebrar el fin de año. Con este nuevo capital invertido aspira a generar un mayor incremento en sus utilidades,  por el buen número de clientes que han realizado ya sus pedidos y porque es la época en que  Leopoldina compra directamente a las empresas las ofertas de fin de año,  como .
Su sueño es tener una casa propia y adicionalmente exhibir sus productos en una gran miscelánea que le facilite el intercambio comercial. Su mayor desafío fue en su proceso de adaptación  cuando llegó a Barranquilla. Su sueño es,  al lado de su conyugue, lograr una  educación de calidad para sus dos hijos que están en las edades de 7 y 18 años, canalizándoles un futuro lleno de éxitos y prosperidad.
texts.en:
Leopoldina C. arrived from Bogotá a little over three years ago to the city of Barranquilla and set up her own business selling refrigerated meats and also selling merchandise by catalog. She makes good use of her good relations with the police depot which is quite near her living quarters and with the associated clinic. That is how her business got its start. Gradually she has been adding new customers and new merchandise by means of specialized product guides. 

This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use it to supply the large volumes of refrigerated meats which have already been ordered for the end-of-the-year season during which her customers prepare their most scrumptious dishes to celebrate the New Year. With the investment of this new capital she hopes to generate a bigger increase in her profits due to the good number of customers who have already placed their orders and because it is the season in which Leopoldina takes advantage of end-of-the-year deals, buying directly from the companies. 

Her dream is to have her own home and additionally to exhibit her products in a large retail center which would facilitate her business interactions. Her greatest challenge was during the process of adaptation when she arrived in Barranquilla. Her dream is that, along with her husband, she would obtain a quality education for her two children who are 7 and 18 years old, channeling for them a future full of successes and prosperity.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of cold meats such as stuffed turkeys and cold cuts along with delicious sauces

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: Maria Lucrecia tiene 65 años es casada y posee 6 hijos mayores de edad. La señora Maria tiene aproximadamente 9 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general, la cual vende de forma ambulante. Ella empezó con una pequeña cantidad de ropa, con capital propio. Todos los fines de semana visita a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares para ofrecer sus productos, a pesar de que toda la semana pasaba en su trabajo, guardaba energías para  los fines de semana. Después poco a poco fue introduciéndose al negocio de la venta de cosméticos y adornos. Pues es así que ella busca la forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. Solicita es crédito para la compra de materia prima. Su sueño es  dedicarse específicamente a la administración de su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Lucrecia is 65 years old.  She is married and has 6 grown-up children.  Maria has been selling goods in general for approximately 9 years.  She sells them in an itinerant manner.  She started out with a small quantity of clothes, with her own capital.  Every weekend she would visit her friends, neighbors and family members to offer her products.  In spite of the fact that she worked in her job all week, she still kept energy for the weekends.  Then, little by little, she started introducing cosmetics and decorations into her sales business in an attempt to create more income for her household.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies.  Her dream is to devote herself to the running of her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Barangay Daan Lungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fishing business.  Her husband Randolf G., who is 40 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 3 and 20 years old. 

Marilou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $250, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for the future and for the education of her children. Marilou G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 24 years old. Gil is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gil owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Gil has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to provide service. Gil is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gil from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda A. is from the village of San Isidro, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Erminda is separated and has 2 adult children. Erminda owns & operates a retail business, buying and selling bananas. She has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Erminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, de 59 años, enviudo hace 22 años, con mucho coraje y trabajo cuido de sus 5 hijos; pero ahora solo vive con uno de ellos, Cristian, de 28 años de edad, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). En sus más de 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, está luchadora mujer siembra palta, café y plátanos; ya tiene 25 años dedicándose a la agricultura, su amplia experiencia le ayudó a comercializar sus cosechas a muy buen precio; tanto así que los intermediarios mayoristas van a su propio terreno agrícola. Rita menciona que en campañas de cosecha, que oscilan entre el mes de diciembre al mes de Junio, donde vende un promedio de 1200 bateas de palta. Para el futuro ella desea mejorar la calidad de sus plantaciones y por ende dinamizar sus ganancias. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante en compañía de los integrantes de su nuevo banco comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en: 59-year-old Rita, widowed for 22 years, takes care of her 5 children with a lot of courage and work. Now only one of them (Christian, 28) lives with her in her own house located in the town of Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle). In her more than 2 hectares of agricultural land, this fighting woman sows avocados, coffee and bananas. She has worked in agriculture for 25 years, and her ample experience helped her to sell her harvests for a very good price. So much so that the wholesale intermediaries come to her own agricultural land. Rita mentions that in harvest seasons, that oscilte between the month of December and the month of June, she sells an average of 1200 trays of avocados. For the future, she wishes to improve the quality of her plantations and thus boost her profits. This is the first time that she is taking a loan with MFP, and she hopes to get ahead in the company of the members of her new communal bank. With the loan that she will receive, she plans to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer, which she will scatter among her different crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animals and medicines for bone pain

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine has two children who are aged between one and three years old. Her elder child is in school while the young one hasn’t begun school yet. 

Clementine sells bread, cakes and donuts, on a wholesale basis; she has done this business for five years. Clementine is requesting this new loan in order to buy more cakes, bread and donuts. She plans to make as much savings from the profits as she can. This will possibly facilitate her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: Buying more cakes, bread and donuts to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza C. is from the village of Malandog, Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

location.town: Malandog, Rogongon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Isimiso Group

texts.en:
Thandi is 53 years old and single with 7 children, aged 9,20,21,27,28 and 37. Only 1 attend school. In the photo above she is wearing a blue head scarf, standing in front of her group. She's been in this business for 8years and sells Pillows and clothes at the flee market in Mandini, South Africa. She has no other source of income. 
She requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy Fabrics, pillows and clothes .She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes she does not get fabrics by the time she goes to buy and when it is being delivered to her the clients no longer buy her stuff. In five years' time she would like to buy herself a car and own a fabric shop.  

 She says that the extra income from this loan will her send her children to university. 
 
She  added that she have seen WDB and Kiva changing other people's lives from her area,so she decided to join so her life can change as well.

loans.use: To buy cotton, wool,  and needles.

loans.name: Michelle's Group

texts.en:
Michelle C. is from the village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Michelle is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Michelle is married and has one infant child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Michelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase new items to expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 37 years old and married . She has been selling shoes and bags for one year, and her business is well-organized. She works from 6am until 7pm every day.  She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is 26 years old, married to Ben Okelo and has three children aged eight, six, and three years old. She owns a grocery business in Mosoriot trading centre in Kapsabet and has been in this business for two years. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES.
Benta has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES and plans to use the money to purchase vegetables and fruits for her grocery business. This is her second loan after servicing her first loan successfully. The profits will be used to educate her children and also improve the status of her grocery business. Benta hopes that she will be able to educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kossi Apédo

texts.fr: Pompiste  de profession, Kossi  a 37 ans et est mariée à une revendeuse .il a deux enfants. Depuis 2000 il s’est lancé dans la vente de bouteille de gaz car il a constaté que le réapprovisionnement du  gaz se fait rare dans les ménages. Son approvisionnement se déroule à Lomé et après il distribue aux ménages  qui lui font la demande. Ce crédit sera destiné  à l’achat de bouteilles de gaz pour satisfaire en nombre voulu les familles dans ce besoin.
texts.en:
Kossi is a gas station attendant. He is 37 years old and married to a retailer. He has two children. 

In 2000, he started selling bottles of gas after realizing that the supply is scarce for most households. 

He gets the gas in Lomé and sells to households who request to be replenished. 

He will use this loan to buy enough bottles of gas to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy bottles of gas for resale

loans.name: Rwenyonyozi Tukore Group

texts.en:
She is on the sunny side of 29, a stickler for diligence, highly spirited, focused and enterprising. These are all attributes which describe this happily married mother of four who goes by the name of Carolina. The business she bears a hand in is a lucrative business, but very highly competitive in nature. Food sales has been her business enterprise for the past decade. Carolina operates her business from the main food market in Ntungamo. The fact that she owns a farm has been a vantage point of sorts. She has been able to take in stride the high demands from her clients because she is able to harvest and sell what she grows. This coupled with her other stocks in trade have enabled her to make significant headway throughout the years. 

Carolina has mostly been selling bananas, beans, rice, cabbage, and ground nuts. She says her monthly sales revenue is 60,000 shillings and she says with this Kiva loan, she is going to purchase more beans, rice, ground nuts, and cabbage seeds to plant. She thinks this will increase her harvest after the crops mature. She also envisions better sales profits in the future with increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, rice, ground nuts and cabbage seeds to plant.

loans.name: Halima

texts.pt:
natural de Provincia da Inhambane. Foi a escola ate 7 classe, solteira e Mae de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 7 anos. Saiu de Inhambane sob proposta de emprego que uma amiga tera lhe aranjado e decidiu afixar sua residencia.
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salario que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com colegas de serviço e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
tornou se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema apartir do dia 25 de Março de 2009 ate o presente ano de 2011.  O primeiro financiamento no valor de 3.000,00Mts foi para compra de cimento para bater blocos, no segundo no valor de 8.000,00Mts, no terceiro no valor de 10.000,00Mts tambem para compra de materiais e pagamento de mao de obra. Com o presente emprestimo de 30.000,00Mts pretende continuar com a sua actividade( compra de pedra , e chapas de zinco para cobertura).
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a hluvuku-adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Halima is from the Inhambane province.  She attended school until the 7th grade.  She is a single mother of 2 sons ages 3 and 7.  She left Inhambane for a job that a friend had arranged for her, and she decided to stay.  She now works and lives in the tourist area of Ponta D'Ouro in the Matutuine district.  Her salary enables her to feed her family and save a bit in the bank.  

She learned about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with colleagues and friends, and decided to learn more about the process of becoming a client and benefiting from loans to complete her projects. She became a client of Hluvuku-Adesma on March 25, 2009, and is still a client in 2011.  Her first loan was for 3.000.00Mts to purchase cement for blocks.  The second was for 8.000.00Mts, and the third was for 10.000.00Mts also to purchase materials and pay for labor.  With this loan of 30.000.00Mts, she plans to continue the work, purchasing stones and zinc panels for roofing.

She is anxious to complete her home, and will count on Hluvuku-Adesma for additional loans.

loans.use: to purchase stones and zinc panels for a roof.

loans.name: Daysi Estibali

texts.es:
Daysi, vive con su madre y hermanos, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, ella trabaja con proveedores, quienes le llevan la mercadería para el negocio, trabaja todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar estantes de madera para el negocio, esta compra de mobiliario  le ayudara a tener mejor visibilidad en su negocio, ordenando los productos por  necesidad  y así prestar un mejor servicio.
El sueño de ella es comprarse su propia casa, por lo que se esfuerza diariamente para conseguirlo.
texts.en:
Daysi lives with her mother and brothers and manages a household products store.  She works with suppliers who bring the goods to the business, and works seven days a week.

She is currently seeking a loan to buy wooden shelving for the business.  The purchase of furniture will help with better visibility in her business, so she can order products when needed and thus providing better service.

Her dream is to buy her own home, which she is making a daily effort to achieve.

loans.use: to buy wooden shelving for the store.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is 44 years old and is a married woman with three children aged 19, 16 and 8. Her oldest child is in college now. Her husband works as a fireman.

Leonides runs a tailoring business at her home. She has been making uniforms, providing alterations to clothing, and repairing torn fabrics for nine years. She usually earns 500 PHP per day from her business.

Leonides has requested a loan to purchase cloth, threads, needles, buttons and other tailoring materials. She hopes for her business to grow and to be able to send her two younger children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, threads, needles, buttons and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Francia

texts.es: Francia es una mujer de 33 años, que vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, con su esposo y su hijo de 13 años  el cual se encuentra estudiando. Francia tiene el negocio de elaborar artesanías desde hace tres años,  anteriormente vendía solo por encargo, pero como  se capacitó con el SENA para perfeccionar el oficio artesanal, tiene contacto con varios clientes y  una tía que le presta mercancías y la ha asesorado para emprender su propio almacén  donde ella vive y con esto está muy entusiasmada. Porque su sueño es crecer hasta lograr un punto comercial bien posicionado donde su esposo también pueda trabajar con ella. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará insumos, dos vitrinas para  aprovechar el sitio y otras manualidades que ella no produce , ofreciendo así mayor diversidad.. Esta inversión tendrá éxito debido a que es una zona comercial de fácil acceso y con parqueadero, donde llegan muchos visitantes que son impactados por la belleza de sus productos.  Mientras Francia cumple con su sueño, continua manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 21%,  una razón corriente de 24.
texts.en:
Francia is a 33 year-old woman who lives in the town of San Jacinto, in Bolívar department, with her husband and her 13 year-old son who is in school.  Francia's business is making handicrafts.  She has been doing this for three years.  She previously used to sell her products to order only but she trained with SENA (a national apprenticeship service) in order to perfect her trade and made connections with a number of customers and a lady who provides her with merchandise and who advised her to set up her own store in her area.  Francia is very excited about all this as her dream is to grow her business until she has a well-positioned sales location where her husband can work with her.

This Kiva loan is Francia's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy supplies, two display cabinets to make the most of her location, and other handicrafts that she doesn't make herself, so that she can offer a wider range of products.  This investment will be successful because her business is located in an easily accessible commercial area with a parking lot.  Many people come to her business and they are impressed with the beauty of her products.  While Francia realizes her dream, she continues maintaining a sales profitability of no less than 21% and a current ratio of 24.

loans.use: to buy supplies, two display cabinets and other handicrafts

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est commerçante, né au Rwanda.et elle est mariée, elle a  45 ans, elle a 5 enfants entre 8 ans et 26 ans et un enfant va à l’école, elle a deux ans des études primaire. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des poissons pour les revendre aux marches locales. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est  améliore la qualité de service qu’elle donnée et minimise les couts  pour attire la clientèle. Pour ses ambitions elle voudrait devenir une grande commerçante dans la région de grands lacs, construire des  maisons pour sa famille ,payer le minerval de ses enfants et  les faire soigner. Elle fait aussi l’agriculture.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a merchant who was born in Rwanda. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children, aged 8 to 26. One of the children attends school. Madeleine has a second grade education. This loan cycle is her first one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy some fish for resale at the local markets. 

Her strategy for business growth is to improve the quality of service she provides and to minimize costs in order to attract customers. As for her ambitions, she would like to become a major merchant in the Grands Lacs region, to build a house for her family, to pay the school fees for her children, and to take care of them. Madeleine is also a farmer.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale at the local markets

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Daniel has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar and salt, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Daniel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Daniel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his business.  Daniel is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his capital

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale.

loans.name: Herlinda Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Herlinda Rosario es casada, tiene 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo quien tampoco estudia, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de  todo tipo y tamaño, lleva ya 5 años con este negocio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar más mercadería para la venta: playeras, suéteres, bufandas, lencería, servilletas, pañuelos. Espera ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
