Señora Herlinda Rosario is 58 years old and is married.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has one son who is not in school either.  She sells clothes of every type and size, and has had this business for 5 years.

She decided to seek a loan that will enable her to buy more merchandise for resale: shirts, sweaters, scarves, linens, napkins and handkerchiefs.  She hopes to see her business grow large.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 43 años, es un hombre honesto, trabajador y sobre todo muy responsable, esta casado y vive junto a su esposa en una iglesia en la cual el es pastor, junto a ellos viven sus tres hijos de 19, 12 y 08 años a quienes crían juntos y desean brindar una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Juan consiste en salir a las calles en busca de pasajeros que tienen la necesidad de ir de un lugar a otro, el siempre esta atento a su teléfono pues al mismo tiempo que brinda el servicio de mototaxi esta en espera de la llamada de alguno de sus buenos clientes que necesitan de sus servicios como electricista, ya que muy bueno en ese trabajo. Lleva ya unos 12 años como electricista y 8 meses como Mototaxista y hace todo el esfuerzo por brindar una buena educación a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que ama lo que hace, además de tener tiempo disponible para dedicar a sus hermanos en el templo donde brinda orientación espiritual. Espera mas adelante poder aumentar el número de moto y tener una flota de vehículos para dar oportunidad de trabajo a otras personas. Este será el segundo préstamo que tiene y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, pagará la letra de su mototaxi y comprará algunos materiales y equipos que le hacen falta para su trabajo de electricista.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 and is an honest, hardworking and, above all, a very responsible man. He is married and lives with his wife in a church where he is the pastor. Together they are raising three children, ages 19, 12 and 8 and want to give them a good education and a better quality of life.

Juan’s work consists of going into the street in search of passengers who need to go from one place to another. He is also always ready at his telephone, because at the same time as he provides motorcycle taxi service he awaits calls from one of his good clients who may need his services as an electrician, since he is very good at that work as well. He has been an electrician for 12 years and a motorcycle taxi driver for 8 months. He is making every effort to provide a good education for his children. 

What Juan likes about his work is that he loves what he does as well as having time available to dedicate to his brethren in the temple, where he gives spiritual orientations. He hopes in the future to be able to increase his number of motorcycles and to have a fleet of vehicles so that he can provide work for other people. 

This will be Juan’s second loan and he hopes to gain the support of each one of you. With the sum requested, he will make a payment on his motorcycle taxi and buy some materials and equipment that he needs for his work as an electrician.

loans.use: to make a  payment on his motorcycle and to buy electrician's tools.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Humberto es una persona muy trabajadora, labora en un taller de herrería como soldador, y su apreciable esposa trabaja los fines de semana vendiendo comida rápida  como hamburguesas, burritos y hot dog, para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos ya que cuenta con uno en preparatoria, ellos empezaron por su cuenta a ampliar la planta baja de el frente de su vivienda y su deseo es terminarlo ya que le falta la losa y las ventanas y por eso se acercaron  a la  institución para que los apoyaremos y ver su sueño hecho realidad, agradece el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Humberto is a very hardworking man. He works as a welder in a blacksmith's workshop while his wife provides invaluable support by working on weekends selling take away food such as hamburgers, burritos and hot dogs, which helps her husband with the cost of raising their children, one of whom has just started school. 

The couple would like to enlarge the room which they have built onto the front of their house. They have already started on it but now they would like to finish it by adding stonework and windows, which is why they approached this institution for help. They look forward to seeing their dream made reality and they are grateful for the support offered to them to complete this project.

loans.use: to expand the ground floor of his house

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera, se dedica a laborar en una institución propia del municipio teniendo ya varios años y contando con una gran experiencia en dichas labores además que se ha ganado el aprecio de muchas personas por ser una trabajadora muy eficiente. 

Una de las necesidades que tiene es adquirir a lo inmediato un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción tales como láminas de zinc,  perlines y pago de mano de obra para mejorar el techo de su vivienda y así darle una mejor apariencia y mejor nivel de vida a su familia. 

Por tal razón decidió  solicitar su crédito en Ceprodel para llevar a cabo sus planes de mejora sabiendo que le servirá de mucho beneficio para el desarrollo de su obra.
texts.en: Señora María Teresa is a native of the municipality of El Sauce.  She is a single mother.  She has been dedicated to working in an institution of her own city for several years already and is very experienced in said work.  She has earned the appreciation of many people for being a very efficient worker.  One of the needs that she has is to acquire immediately a loan to buy building materials such as sheets of zinc and supports and to pay for labor to improve the roof of her dwelling and thus to give it a better appearance and provide a better standard of living to her family.  For this reason she decided to request a loan from Ceprodel to carry out her home improvement plans, knowing that it will serve to benefit her a lot for the development of her work.

loans.use: to buy zinc and perlines (supports).

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 33 and married but has no children yet. They live in a village and manage a variety store selling different grocery items and soft drinks. She has been operating her business for almost three years now and usually earns a profit of PHP 7,000 a month, which they use to acquire their basic necessities. She aims to improve her variety store to increase her income and save for their future. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she still has the strong determination to improve the business.

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, charcoal, beverages, junk foods, canned goods and noodles to sell in her store. She believes that her loan will help a lot to increase her product offerings and income. She hopes that in the future, she will make the business grow and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, charcoal, beverages, junk foods, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Minkailu.  He is married, his spouse is a trader, and her income is Le450, 000. They have four children aged 19, 15, 10 and 7 years old. In 2001, Minkailu established his shoe business.  He began his business after he dropped out of school and realised that he needed a source of income to enable him to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business.   He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  

Minkailu has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase - Comfort Slippers - 2 cartons @ Le815, 000, Madam Shoes - 1 carton @ Le600, 000, Foam Slippers - 5 dozen @ Le605, 000, Sponge Sandals - 1 carton @ Le750, 000, Sponge Slippers - 2 dozens @ Le240, 000, Plastic Shoes - 1 packet @ Le150, 000 and Toilet Slippers - 4 packets @ Le1, 080,000.  The balance of Le 262, 000 will be used for transportation.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Minkailu plans to build his own house and educate his children. He also plans to have a shop and buy a car.  His believes that this loan will help him to improve his business.  His major challenges are that some items get faded, especially in the dry season, and this can force him to sell at cheaper prices.  He serves 15 customers each day.  His business is popular because of good quality items. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase - Comfort Slippers - 2 cartons @ Le815,000, Madam Shoes - 1 carton @ Le600,000, Foam Slippers - 5 dozen @ Le605,000, Sponge Sandals - 1 carton @ Le750,000, Sponge Slippers - 2 dozens @ Le240,000, Plastic Shoes - 1 packet @ Le150,000 and Toilet Slippers - 4 packets @ Le1,080,000, with the balance of Le262,000 for transportation.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her grocery store. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for resale, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to own a large shop. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Felistus Mawea

texts.en:
Felistus is married and  has four children. She operates a restaurant where she serves food and snacks. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in Mwingi shopping center in Thika. 

Felistus is requesting a loan for 24,000 KES, which she will use to buy wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of milk in the area. Her business goal is to run another restaurant in Kyulungwa shopping center in Thika within five years.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Ana Francisca se sigue dedicando al trabajo en un consultorio dental,ella esta realizando protesis,la socia tambien se dedica a vende productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales,ella vende los productos de belleza en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Francisca continues working in a dental office.  She also sells beauty products such as perfumes, creams and lipsticks.  She sells her beauty products independently.  Ana Francisca works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her son.  She would like to expand and improve her business selling beauty products.  She is requesting this loan to buy beauty products such as perfumes, creams and lipsticks wholesale.

Ana Francisca is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as perfumes, creams and lipsticks wholesale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga, tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de un niño, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años.
Gregoria tiene un Restaurante, recuerda que el primer préstamo que tuvo fue para poder comprar celulares, porque ella hacia llamadas, luego trabajó en un restaurante, da gracias a Finca por todo el apoyo que le brindaron, poco a poco veía que sus ahorros iban creciendo, y eso es por las enseñanzas que le dieron de la importancia de poder ahorrar, ahora ella valora mucho eso, su vida cambio desde que esta en Finca, pudo tener una mejor vida, con muchos valores, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de víveres para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the Amauta Huamanga Communal Bank. She is 32 years old and the single mother of one son. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for two years.

Gregoria has a restaurant. She remembers that the first loan she had was to buy cellular phones, because she had a phone call business. Then she worked in a restaurant. She thanks FINCA for all of the support it has offered her. Little by little, she is seeing her savings grow thanks to what she has learned from them about the importance of being able to save. Now Gregoria values this highly. Her life has changed since she joined FINCA. She is now able to have a better life, with high value.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy products for her restaurant

loans.name: María Odilia

texts.es: María Odilia de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tortillería enfrente del lugar donde reside, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su trabajo es de excelente calidad al igual que la materia prima, además los precios son muy accesibles; María es una mujer joven activa, que siempre está dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograr sus objetivos , piensa que para triunfar hay que hacerse ideas propias, conocer la realidad, pensar en la verdad y ser dueños de uno mismo para poder conquistar el mundo de afuera, ella está dispuesta a alcanzar ese triunfo es por eso que le solicita  a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. María Odilia tiene fe con su duro trabajo podrá darle una vida plena a su familia.
texts.en:
María Odilia, 34, lives with her life partner and their children.  She has a tortilla shop in front of her house.  Lately her clientele has grown due to the excellent quality of her raw materials; in addition, her prices are very affordable.

María is a young, active woman who is always willing to work hard to reach her objectives.  She believes that in order to succeed one must have original ideas, to be aware of one’s reality, to think truthfully and to be self-aware to conquer the outside world.  

She is set to reach this success and this is why she’s asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn at wholesale.  María Odilia trusts that with her hard work she’ll be able to give her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy accessories for cell phones and watches.

loans.name: Adut

texts.en:
Adut lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 31 year, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Adut heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania K. from Vratza is 34 years old. She is married and has a daughter. Her sister Silvia Dimitrova is 36 years old. She is also married and has a son.

Together Tania and Silvia have an advertising agency. They started their business three years ago because of their mother who lent them some money. Both sisters used this money to rent an office and to buy some software and hardware.

Now both of the two sisters are strongly motivated to develop this business. Tania’s and Silvia’s husband also have own business. One of them is a mechanic and has an own garage and the other keeps an engineering store.

Both sisters need about $ 800 to buy some materials for their business

loans.use: To byu materials for the business

loans.name: Masaila

texts.en: I am a married man, a father of 4. I sell cabbages for a living. I intend to use the loan to expand my business.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz has a grocery store where she also serves snacks during tea time and provides phone call services. She lives with her mom, grandmother and three younger brothers ages 18, 12 and 6, and she supports them with her income. The house they live in is their gradmother's. The loan would be used to buy more merchandise for her store and to improve her income. It is Beatriz's second loan and her good credit history qualifies her for another loan to better her income and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz tiene una tienda de abarrotes, servicio de té y atención de llamadas telefónica móvil al publico, vive con su madre, abuela y tres hermanos menores de 18, 12 y 6 años, y con los ingresos que genera ayuda a la manutención de la familia. La Casa donde viven es de su abuela. El destino del crédito es para incrementar mercadería de la tienda, para mejorar sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito, su buen antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a otro crédito para mejorar sus ingresos familiares, de esa forma ayudar en la familia.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 24 years old and has a small garage in Kirkuk to fix cars and vehicles. This is his first loan application from AL-Aman. He wants to get $1200 to purchase a new testing machine for his garage and new equipment. He has a big family, and he wants to enhance his family's standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new testing machine for his garage and new equipment

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy A. is a 42 year old married woman with 7 children. She hails from the urban sector of Benin City, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for a year. She buys timber, saws it into wood and sells to customers. She needs the loan of $1175 to enable her buy more timber for sales. She has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Sonia Benita

texts.es:
Sonia is a 34-year-old married woman. Her family is composed of her, her husband, and their three children. She sells a variety of products, such as telephone cards, sweets, soda, etc, in a portable kiosk that she has in the Hospital Modelo de Yapacaní. Her husband also contributes to the family income by lending his services as a reporter to the radio station Emisora Local OMEGA.

Sonia's kiosk is the only one established and authorized in the hospital, so she doesn't have any competition. This is why she needs the loan to obtain another portable kiosk to increase her amount of products and sales. For Sonia, it is very important to fulfill all of the demand of her variety of clients. This is the third loan Sonia has had with this institution, and she has proven herself as a responsible and punctual person with her payments, and has never been one day late.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia es una señora casada de 34 años de edad, su familia está conformada por cuatro miembros, su esposo y tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de toda variedad de productos como ser tarjetas telefónicas, dulces, gaseosas, etc., en el kiosko portatil que tiene dentro del Hospital Modelo de Yapacaní, por otra parte el esposo también colabora con los ingresos familiares ya que él presta servicios como reportero en la radio Emisora Local OMEGA. El kiosco de Sonia es el único establecido y autorizado en el Hospital razón por la cual no tiene competencia, es por ello que requiere el presente crédito para la adquisición de otro kiosco portátil (anaquel) para aumentar sus productos y sus ventas, para Sonia es muy importante el atender a cabalidad la demanda de variedad de sus clientes. Esta es la tercera frecuencia de Sonia en la Institución y en ese tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos, esto debido a que a la fecha mentiene cero días de mora.

loans.use: Purchase of a kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a hard working mother of three young children. Ever since her husband left her she has been running a small restaurant from her own home where she offers simple yet delicious meals. With this job she has been able to manage the daily expenditures that her three children require and she has been able to provide them with a secure household. Now that her customers are demanding more, she would like to increase her investment capital in order to fulfill all of her clients' needs. Her restaurant is the sole source of income for the family. Let's help Beatriz get on with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, es una trabajadora madre de tres pequeños niños, desde que su esposo se marchó para no regresar instalo en casa un pequeño restaurante en el que ofrece platos muy simples pero deliciosos. Con esta labor ha podido suplir los gastos que demandan sus pequeños a diario y les ha podido otorgar seguridad.Debido a que la demanda de sus clientes va en aumento desea incrementar su capital de inversión para cumplir cada una de las demandas de sus clientes ya que esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta esta familia.Ayudemos a Beatriz para siga con su labor.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of basic necessity products

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik is 34 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Khachmaz town. Namik has run this business for 2 years and now needs a loan of $600 to buy foodstuffs in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Kikabala Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatina S.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add capital. Fatina is 47 years old and is married. Her husband sells fish for work. She has 8 children ranging from age 14 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatina makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and cater for the family.

Fatina is joined in her small group by Rose W., Nadina N., Jennifer N., and Lukia N.. Rose W. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to purchase poultry feed. Nadina N. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to diversify to selling fruit. Jennifer N. operates a retail shop business and wants to increase stock. Lukia N. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To expand her fish selling business and make more profits

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng M., age 37, has divorced since her child was two years old. Now, she lives with her 10-year-old child who studies at a primary school. She runs a grocery store at home, selling provision of food and household stuffs to the people in her community. She makes on average around $20 each day of income.

In order to meet her growing customer needs, Mrs. Heng M. has recently applied for a loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory. She believes this will increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has a small business selling men’s clothing at a busy outdoor market in Stryi, Ukraine located near the beautiful Carpathian mountains. She has worked hard to make her business a success, even though her circumstances have sometimes been difficult. Nataliya is married and has two children, a son who is 21 and a daughter who is 15. Their family financial situation has been tough at times due to her husband’s struggles with alcohol addiction. Nataliya also takes care of her nephew while his mother is away working.

Nataliya has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase additional inventory for her business. She has been a client with Nadiya Ukraine since 2003. We are happy to have this opportunity to continue assisting her in her business endeavors.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: William

texts.es:
Thanks to the support from his beloved family William has been able to fulfill his dream of owning a house where his children can grow in a healthy way with no limitations, and thanks to his work as a farmer he can cover their needs for their development. William’s land is necessary for the support of his economy and his animals represent an extra income as he obtains earnings daily from selling milk and cheese, activity carried out by his wife. Due to the loss caused by climate factors he has not been able to capitalize and for that reason he requests a loan in order to improve the sowing and production for this season.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

William, gracias al apoyo de sus seres queridos ha podido consolidar su sueño de tener una casa propia donde sus hijos puedan crecer sanos y sin limitaciones y gracias a su labor de agricultor puede ofrecerles lo necesario para su desarrollo. Los terrenos de William son indispensables para el mantenimiento de su economía y como una ayuda son sus animales con los cuales puede obtener ingresos diarios gracias a la venta de leche y queso que realiza su esposa. Debido a las pérdidas que tuvo por factores climatológicos no ha podido capitalizar su inversión y por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de mejorar su siembra y producción esta temporada.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: 35 year old Rosalina I. is married, with four children.  She has many years of experience in the banana plantation business where she sells bananas to the general public four days per week.   She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  With one previous loan from SPBD, SPBD remains Rosalina’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for a loan from traditional banks. Rosalina successfully paid off her first loan and is now requesting for a second one to purchase funggicide for banana ridex, milkek C, fertilizers and weed killer. She aims to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To expand banana plantation business

loans.name: Carmen Adela

texts.es:
Carmen is 44 years old and lives with her 2 children. Because she was abused by her husband, she decided to separate. For the past 7 years she has sold spices, ranging from ones she grinds and packages to the most prestigious brands. With her friendly manner and quality products, she is able to make a satisfactory income. Every day she prepares the spices she grinds at home, working part time (in the morning) in the market and in the afternoon she can be with her children, who are her joy.

Her motivation and her efforts are focused on raising her two small children, every day she gives them her love and affection. Carmen is requesting a loan to buy goods wholesale so she can stock up her business. Her goal is for her business to have all of the products that meet her customers´ needs and in the future, to open up a branch.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen tiene 44 años y vive con sus 2 hijos. Debido al maltrato de su esposo, decidió separarse de él. Se dedica a la venta de condimentos, desde licuados y envasados hasta de las más prestigiosas marcas, esto hace 7 años, con la amabilidad y productos de calidad que ofrece está generando satisfactorios ingresos. Cada día, prepara en su casa las especias que deben molerse, trabaja medio tiempo (por las mañanas) en el mercado, y por la tarde puede estar con sus hijos lo cual es su alegría.

Su motivo y esfuerzo se concentran en sostener a sus dos pequeños hijos, cada día les da de su amor y cariño. Carmen solicita un préstamos para comprar mercadería al por mayor, así, implementar su puesto. Su meta es poder lograr que su negocio tenga todos los productos que satisfagan a sus clientes y en el futuro, abrir una sucursal.

loans.use: Increase the selection of products for her business.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.en:
The Primavera ("Spring") group bank, from Portachuelo in the tropical Santa Cruz region of Bolivia, has been working with AgroCapital for three loan cycles now under the presidency of Sra. Juanita B.; this will be the group's fourth loan.

Eleven of the fourteen group members work selling food: Yobana, Maria Teresa and Maria Esther sell prepared meals; Maria Lourdes owns a liquor store; Teresa, Olga, Argentina and Angela sell bread, and Dory and Alina are cooks. Of the remaining group members, Ramiro and Castulo work in construction, while Marlene is an Avon saleswoman. Most of the group members plan to use their Kiva loan to buy cooking supplies and construction materials.

Sra. B. has led the group well, teaching them about the central communal guarantee they offer one another, and the group has paid off all of its previous loans without any problems. Therefore, they have been approved for a new loan so that they can continue to work and keep investing to develop and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase cooking supplies and construction materials

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El contacto para la formación del presente comité fue la Sra. Zulma F. integrante del comité “Mujeres en Acción” de la zona del km 8 Monday_ C.D.E. Ella es amiga de la Sra. Florentina M. quien vive en el km7 Ciudad Nueva _ C.D.E., la señora contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité. Esta señora se caracteriza por ser muy activa y solidaria en el barrio , la misma trabajó con varias comisiones de la comunidad por eso se intereso mucho en formar el comité en su barrio.

Vive con su con sus dos hijas , es madre soltera se dedica a la venta de bebidas , con este trabajo genera un buen ingreso para su familia, las demás integrantes del comité se dedican a actividades diferentes como venta de frutas, verduras, joyas , también comercios como kiosko y despensa. El el comité esta constituido por 15 integrantes ,el grupo se denomina “ Sta Rosa ” en representación de las integrantes muy Activas, ellas retiraron un monto de 4500.000, a cada una le corresponde un monto de 300.000 Gs.
texts.en:
Ms Zulma F. is the contact for this committee, which is part of Mujeres en Accion located in the km 8 Monday_ C.D.E. She is friends with Ms Florentina Media who lives at km 7 of Ciudad Nuevea _ C.D.E. She contacted her friends and neighbors to form the committee. She is a very active and reliable woman in the neighborhood, and has work with many neighborhood committees. For this reason, she was interested in forming this neighborhood committee. She is a single mother to two daughters, and she works selling drinks. She is able to earn a good income for her family. Other members of the committee work in other fields, including fruit sales, vegetable sales, jewelry sales, and in businesses such as kiosks and pantries. The committee consists of 15 members, and calls itself "Sta Rosa" representing the very active participants. They are requesting an amount of 4500,000, 300,000 Gs for each member.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, cosmetics, drinks, fruit, vegetables, cleaning products, material, first aid products, among others.

loans.name: Sophanny's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group loan for three members and Mrs. Sophany is group leader. Mrs. Sophanny K., 29, is a vegetable seller who transports produce to customer's home via used bycicle, earning approximately $3.75 per day. She lives with her three children, all of whom are students, in the Krolorng Village, Kompong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Kheav Sokhon, 33, is a bricklayer and earns about $5 per day. With her growing business, Sophanny now requests a loan of 600,000 Riel to purchase more vegetable inventory to sell. Because of her business, she is able to support her family’s living expenses and to support her children in getting a higher education. The other two members are:

1- Mrs. Sreyroth C. is a rice farmer and raises pigs. She requests a loan of 400000 Riel to purchase pig food to fatten her pigs.

2- Mrs. Soknoeurn Y. is a rice farmer and sells vegetable. She is widowed and requests a loan of 400000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.

The group lives in Chrey Vean Commune, Kampong Cham Province.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable inventory to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a simple vendor who lives in a small village of Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela, where people are disciplined and hardworking. Riding a ferry boat is the only means to get in and out of the village. 
	
Daily, Juanita wakes up very early to catch the first ferry to the other side of the river and then she takes a tricycle to the public market where she purchases vegetables and other products to sell in her village. Using a basket to carry her products, Juanita then walks from house to house to sell her vegetables. 

Juanita has always been a good borrower. She always pays on time, and she works hard to improve her business. She wants to use this loan to buy a tri bike (a bicycle with a carriage) for her house-to-house vending. This will not only help her move faster and easier but also to carry more items to sell in her community

She dreams of having a successful business, sending her children to college,  and saving for her family’s future.

loans.use: additional working capital
